job_ad_details:
A fantastic opportunity to work with a highly focused and dedicated team in a long established business in Brisbane South. You will be an important part of our team as this role offers you the chance of seeing your hard work and process expertise utilised throughout the manufacturing process.

As an injection moulding die setter you will be involved in all aspects of the injection moulding process, playing an important role relating to continuation of production with continuous improvement initiatives within an automated manufacturing facility.

To be successful in this role you will possess the following:

Job tasks and responsibilities

  • Lead the Safety-First activities and drive risk mitigation
  • Understand and help champion LEAN initiatives
  • Proactively identify hazards to maintain our perfect record in safety in all aspects of the business
  • Assist in the safe continuous running of the shift and deliver the plastics production schedule
  • Perform intermediate machine and equipment trouble shooting.
  • Identify bottlenecks and work through solutions for smooth process flow
  • Pack product as per product quality plans
  • Organising completed production parts for warehousing
  • Ensure high product quality of all manufactured and finished goods

Skills and experience

  • A clear commitment to a Safety-First culture
  • Strong communication and interpersonal skills
  • A great team player
  • Plastic Injection Moulding and die setting experience is desirable.
  • The ability to influence outcomes and build a team culture
  • A "can do" and "hands on" proactive attitude
  • Have a current forklift licence

If you strongly feel you can fit into this role please get in touch at gulshan@sdiplastics.com.au

job_title: Part time Café All-rounder in Liverpool
job_ad_details:
A restaurant in Liverpool is seeking a part time Café All-rounder (up to 40 hours per week) to join our team.

To be considered for this role you should:
  • Be available at both days at weekends
  • Have at least 3 years of experience as a Café All-rounder
  • Have Australian work rights

At Interactive we want the way we do business to positively impact our people, the community, the environment and our business.  
  
We’ve got programs in place but we always strive to do better. In this role, you’ll own our sustainability and WHS programs and drive us to hit greater heights. 
  
Here are some of the things you’ll own and execute in this role: 

  • Achieving ISO 14001 (Environment) and ISO 45001 (WHS) accreditations  
  • Owning the overall strategy for our sustainability and WHS programs and ensuring it aligns with our overall business strategy and objectives 
  • Introducing more sophisticated metrics to track our sustainability performance  
  • Embedding a more commercial mindset to our sustainability program 
  • Telling our story to prospective customers and external stakeholders who want to understand what we stand for 

A bit about you: 

  • You’ve previously led WHS and Environment programs and initiatives and you’ve previously matured the businesses you’ve worked in 
  • You’re familiar with ISO 14001 (Environment) and ISO 45001 (OHS) standards
  • You’re passionate about HSE but bring a pragmatic and commercial lens to your work 
  • You can present at a variety of levels, including Executive, Board of Directors, regulatory bodies and prospective customers 

A bit about us: 

We’re a tech company, but with a special personal touch. Our customers trust us to hold their most important data, support their critical devices and secure their systems and we were named in the WRK+ Best Places to Work in 2023 and were named the #1 Best Place to Work in Australia in 2020. 
 
Why Interactive? 

As part of our team, you’ll enjoy perks like free on-site baristas in our Sydney and Melbourne offices, flexible/hybrid work (with no minimum or mandated office days) and access to a diverse range of benefits and discounts from our partners.  
 
Sounds like the opportunity you’ve been waiting for? We can’t wait to hear from you!

Culture

THE WHO, THE WHAT AND THE WHERE


Our client is a well-established, custom industrial and commercial fabrication provider based north of Perth. They pride themselves on providing innovative solutions and quality workmanship. The company is comprised of a range of experts in their field and everyone is passionate about customer service.


WHAT’S INVOLVED?


Working in the Projects team, alongside managers and mechanical engineers, your role will be to convert design briefs into fully detailed workshop drawings, ensure quality standards are met, and projects run on schedule. Your job will involve:

  • Liaising with engineers and other members of the project team to plan designs for products
  • Create 3D designs using CAD software
  • Identify functionality issues and redesign products
  • Ensure final designs meet Client specifications
  • Ensure regulatory compliance of designs
  • Develop manuals for designed products
  • Coordinate projects including budgeting, scheduling and monitoring
  • Undertake product quality control
DO YOU HAVE WHAT IT TAKES?


We are looking for an organised, analytical, mathematically-minded professional, who is through, reliable and works well in a team. You will also need:

  • Experience using AutoCAD and/or Inventor
  • Good MS Office skills, including Excel and Word
  • Experience in sheet metal fabrication
  • An Australian-recognised Cert III (or higher) in drafting or equivalent
  • An understanding of laser-cutting procedures and metals processing
  • Familiarity with drafting standards (e.g. AS1100)
  • Excellent communication abilities, especially the ability to instruct and articulate instructions in writing
THIS SOUNDS PERFECT! WHERE DO I SIGN UP?

job_title: Outside School Hours Care Assistant Manager
job_ad_details:
About us

Grand Avenue State School Outside School Hours Care, operated by the Grand Avenue State School P&C Association, is currently looking to fill the position of an Assistant Manager. The purpose this role to assist the Manager with the efficient and effective operation and overall strategic, financial and operational management of the service. 

As part of the leadership team, you will have the opportunity to grow and develop our service which caters for up to 225 students. 

If you are enthusiastic about creating positive experiences for children while contributing to their overall well-being and development, this opportunity at Grand Avenue State School OSHC could be an excellent fit for you.

Tasks & responsibilities

  • Be responsible for the overall management and administration of the service;
  • Supervise the implementation of developmentally appropriate programs for children;
  • Recruit staff in accordance with relevant regulations;
  • Maintain day-to-day accounts and handle all administrative matters;
  • Ensure that the service adheres to all relevant regulations and statutory requirements;
  • Ensure that the service meets or exceeds quality assurance requirements;
  • Liaise with families and outside agencies;
  • Formulate and evaluate annual budgets;
  • Liaise with management committees as appropriate;
  • Provide professional leadership and development to staff;
  • Develop and maintain policies and procedures for the service; and
  • Act as the Nominated Supervisor, if appointed.
     

Qualifications & experience

  • Holds qualifications approved by ACECQA in Qld such as OSHC, child care, speech pathology, psychology, occupational therapy, nursing, the arts, education. 
  • Hold a First Aid, CPR, Anaphylaxis and Asthma qualifications or Willingness to immediately undertake appropriate training
  • It is desirable to have at least 2 years experience in a similar role

Essential Criteria:

  • Excellent interpersonal, communication and organisational skills;
  • Ability to prioritise tasks, and use knowledge and initiative to problem solve;
  • Strong work ethic, with an ability to work collaboratively; 
  • Commitment to service and performance excellence; 
  • Understanding of workplace health and safety requirements; and
  • Hold a valid Blue Card.

The Opportunity

We are currently looking to recruit an Administrative Assistant to support our Ashurst Service Central (ASC) - Client team on a permanent basis in Brisbane.

Operating as an integral member of the ASC-Client team, you will provide proactive and effective administrative support to our Brand, Marketing, Communications (BMC) and Business Development (BD) Teams and other areas within the business.

Working alongside counterparts in Glasgow some of your main responsibilities will be (but not limited to):

  • Preparation and maintenance of marketing material, including website updates, email marketing, bids and tender documents and client reports;
  • Assistance with event invitations, attendee lists, online event setup and recording and event feedback surveys;
  • Forming positive working relationships, particularly with the BD, BMC and ASC teams.

A full job description including a breakdown of responsibilities can be found either below or attached to the role on our careers page www.ashurst.com/en/careers

Essential Skills & Experience

To be successful in this role you will have the following skills or experience:

  • Proficient with Microsoft Office products (Word, PowerPoint and Excel)
  • Excellent verbal and written communication - able to write clearly, concisely and to a high standard, with an excellent grasp of grammar and punctuation
  • Demonstrated attention to detail and accuracy
  • Excellent organisational skills
  • Collaborative, team-orientated approach with the flexibility and willingness to go the extra mile

About Ashurst

Ashurst is a leading progressive global law firm with a rich history, celebrating it's bicentenary in 2022. We are proud of our history and are future-focused, having expanded into new technologies through our NewLaw division, Ashurst Advance, and our consulting arm. Our in-depth understanding of our clients and commitment to providing excellent standards of service have seen us become a trusted adviser to local and global corporates, financial institutions and governments in all areas of commercial law. To find out more please visit www.ashurst.com.

What makes Ashurst a great place to work?

We offer you all the things you should expect from an international law firm, some of which include:

  • Competitive remuneration with the flexibility to reward high performance;
  • Flexible working;
  • Complimentary gym memberships;
  • Corporate health plans;
  • Global professional development offering for all employees; and
  • An industry-leading programme that celebrates diversity and inclusion.

We are committed to delivering positive impacts to our communities through our Social Impact programme, with a strong emphasis on working with First Nations people through our pro bono practice.

We aim to recruit, retain and promote the best people from the widest possible talent pools. We are committed to offering a safe and welcoming environment for all employees to ensure they are supported to work at their best.

Beyond this, what sets Ashurst apart from others is our global strength, our drive to innovate and collaborate, and our commitment to excellence. It is these values that make Ashurst a unique place to work.

Job Description

Do you have a passion for shaping and influencing company culture? If so, we want you to join our team!  

We’re looking for an HR Advisor to provide expert advice, pragmatic guidance, and support across a broad range of people-related matters.

The successful applicant will be responsible for performance management, disciplinary processes, long term injury management and capacity cases, internal investigations, grievance management, mobilisation and demobilisation support, and structural reviews. 

Reporting to the National Workplace Relations Manager and based out of our Perth Support Centre, the successful candidate will need to excel in a matrix structure engaging with operational leaders, HR Business Partners, employees, subject matter experts in a variety of fields and HR Advisory peers across Australia.  

Who are we looking for?  

We’re looking for someone who thrives in fast-paced, high-volume environments; there’s never a dull moment at Sodexo.   

The successful applicant will be highly resilient, thrive in fast-paced and high-volume environments, and be able to pragmatically work through challenges.

To be successful, you’ll need:  

Australian citizenship or full Australian working rights  

Bachelor’s degree in human resources (or related field)  

Previous experience in human resources (or related field)  

Experience preparing and representing in external conciliations would be advantageous  

 Why choose Sodexo?  

Sodexo is a people business, employing over half a million people worldwide and thousands here in Australia. Our employees, who personify Sodexo's unique values of Service Spirit, Team Spirit and Spirit of Progress, are our greatest asset through their commitment and dedication.  

We believe the more diverse we are, the stronger we are. No matter your background, we will do all we can to help you thrive. We are committed to promoting equal opportunities, valuing diversity, and creating an inclusive working environment for all our employees.    

At Sodexo, we are a proud Equal Opportunity Employer and encourage applications from all applicants regardless of age, race, sex, ethnicity, religion and beliefs and people with disabilities.  

We offer a competitive salary, many development opportunities and an outstanding benefits and recognition program!   

How to apply?  

If you are interested in joining the Sodexo team and meet the minimum criteria outlined above, please apply with your resume detailing relevant employment experience  and availability.   

One of our friendly recruiters will contact shortlisted candidates for a phone interview. This will also be your opportunity to ask any questions you may have.  

Submit your application today and become part of the Sodexo family!

Company description:

QinetiQ Pty Ltd



Job description:

We are currently accepting applications for a Business Analyst to join our Oracle ERP Implementation team. The successful candidate will play a key role in QinetiQ's Oracle Cloud ERP project where you will be responsible for managing stakeholders, facilitating workshops, defining As-Is/To-Be process mapping, validating key requirements and processes and ensuring business buy in and understanding.

You will be process minded, possess excellent communication, analytical and problem solving skills and will have a background in Finance, Procurement, Manufacturing and Supply Chain with experience in the implementation of ERP systems and technologies.

We are flexible on location, this position can be based out of SA, ACT or VIC.

As Business Analyst you will be accountable for:

  • Leading and facilitating discovery workshops and interviews to elicit and validate business and technology requirements, processes and workflows;
  • Creating and maintaining traceability between requirements and implemented solutions throughout project lifecycles;
  • Participating in analysis and design workshops to develop detailed user cases and user stories;
  • Identifying, providing guidance and recommendations for effective business improvement initiatives across QinetiQ's processes and systems;
  • Undertaking business and technology impact assessments to define stakeholder needs, objectives, challenges and risks;
  • Contributing to and guiding positive change implementation; and
  • Developing and maintaining working relationships with key stakeholders, including internal teams and external vendors and suppliers.

To be successful in the role of Business Analyst you will need to bring with you:

  • Solid experience of working in a Business Analyst role within major business change and transformation projects;
  • Strong understanding of financial practices including associated area of procurement, manufacturing and supply chain;
  • Experience working on the implementation and rollout of ERP/Finance platforms;
  • Deep experience in As-Is and To-Be Business Process modelling using industry standard tools and techniques;
  • Excellent skills in requirements gathering and documentation, including writing user stories and acceptance criteria.
  • Experience in progressing business change with process improvement and quality assurance;
  • High level of analytical and organisational skills with good attention to detail and ability to think laterally and conceptually;
  • Excellent verbal and written communication skills with the ability to effectively collaborate with stakeholders at all levels; and

Whilst not essential, a tertiary qualification would be advantageous.

Candidates will need to be eligible to obtain an Australian Government Security Clearance.

Whilst applications must be made online, confidential enquiries are welcome and may be directed to Roz Byrne, Talent Acquisition Lead via email: rbyrne@qinetiq.com.au

Applications will close on the 28th February 2025



Profile description:

QinetiQ employs more than 8500 people in more than 50 locations around the world, offering our customers premier expertise in advice, services and creative technology-based products.

QinetiQ Australia, part of the global QinetiQ group, provides technological and scientific expertise to help customers protect and advance their vital interests. As an innovative science and technology company, we help solve some of our customers' most challenging problems. Our determination to deliver and improve today and anticipate and shape tomorrow, makes QinetiQ a very exciting, rewarding and respected place to work and learn.



We offer:

Some of our benefits include:

  • Individual professional development fund
  • Flexible work
  • Purchased leave program and loyalty leave
  • Up to 18 weeks paid parental leave
  • Annual incentive scheme
  • Complimentary salary continuance insurance
  • Annual volunteering leave with Operation Give Back
  • Relaxed dress code

A full list of our employee benefits and further information can be found here:

https://www.qinetiq.com/en-au/careers/benefits

The successful candidate will have:

Metro South Health is Australia's first digital health service and one of the largest in Queensland, with an estimated residential population of approximately one million people or 23 per cent of Queensland's population.  

This is your opportunity to join the dedicated team of professionals at Metro South Health and be part of a world-class, dynamic and growing health service that embraces technology, excellence in health care, teaching, research and empowering our people to be the best in serving our community.

About the Role

 Fulfil the accountabilities and responsibilities of this role in accordance with Metro South's purpose and objectives, as outlined below.

  • Resolve day to day operational issues regarding resources, workflows, procedures and staff within the team and assist with review of the work practices by maintaining high professional work standards and seeking ways for ongoing improvement. 
  • Supervise and manage administration staff responsible to this position including preparation of rosters, management of workloads, organisation of relief where appropriate, and performance planning and review and ensuring duties are completed efficiently and within timeframes.Manage all aspects of administrative staff responsible to this position in line with Queensland Health HR policies and guidelines including Performance and Development compliance, and professional and mandatory training.

Our ICARE² values of Integrity, Compassion, Accountability, Respect, Engagement and Excellence, shape our culture within Metro South Health. Our values guide our day-to-day decision making and are fundamental to what we care about as a health service, how we behave, how we interact with each other and provide care to the many patients who come through our doors every day. 

We offer rewarding career opportunities across a wide range of clinical and non-clinical areas across our health service and pride ourselves on providing a work environment that is safe, satisfying, flexible, and promotes a healthy work-life balance.

As a Metro South employee, you will benefit from a higher than standard employer contribution to Superannuation of up to 12.75%, access to salary packaging, flexible working arrangements and competitive salary rates with annual incremental increases.

It is a condition of employment for this role for the employee to be, and remain, vaccinated against COVID-19 (Health Employment Directive No. 12/21 (PDF) and Queensland Health Human Resources Policy B70 (PDF))

You can find out more about why it's so great to work at Metro South here: www.metrosouth.health.qld.gov.au/join-our-team.

Office Manager

The Cattle Council of Australia was established in 1979 to represent and promote the interests of Australian beef cattle producers. This is achieved through wide and regular consultation with, and policy advice to, key industry organisations, Federal Government Departments, Ministers and their Offices, and other bodies regarding issues of national and international importance to the beef industry.

We require a positively charged Office Manager to provide office support including diary and travel management, organisation of council meetings, functions and management of the President’s diary. As the initial point of contact for telephone enquiries from stakeholders, government and other audiences, the successful applicant will be driven, direct and organised, always conduct themselves in a professional and friendly manner, and possess a high level of skill working with the Microsoft Office suite of programs.

About Randstad
Randstad is the second largest Recruitment and HR Services provider in the world. Our Industrial division has over 20 years experience in providing recruitment solutions to the fast paced manufacturing, logistics and warehousing sectors, where companies really rely on being able to find the right person, at the right time.


Working as a recruitment consultant within our industrial division means that you will be managing a high volume blue collar temp desk within Warehousing/Manufacturing. It is important that you are able to work with a real sense of urgency, have good speed to market and operate within a fast paced environment as you can make the difference between clients meeting their operational deadlines or losing valuable productivity.

What is the role?
We currently have an exciting opportunity available for a consultant to join our successful Parramatta Industrial Division. In this position you will be managing and growing a successful Blue Collar Desk. This desk has an established business but there are plenty of additional growth opportunities to be developed.
The role is varied and challenging and will require you to manage client, candidate relationships, fill vacancies, candidate interviews and client visits.

What are we looking for?
To be successful in this position you will have a background in a fast paced environment with exceptional delivery of service. You will have exceptional communication skills, proven ability to meet targets, the ability to juggle multiple tasks at once with your exceptional organisational skills and a genuine desire to work in a highly successful environment. Recruitment experience is preferred but not essential.

In this role day to day responsibilities will include:
• Make calls to existing clients
• Visits and meeting clients
• Develop working relationships with clients
• Fill job orders
• Interview candidates
• Build relationships with your candidates
• Grow your desk week on week
• Working towards KPIs and achieving your targets
• Ensuring database, compliance and administration are maintained

The ideal candidate must have the following qualities and experience:
• Temp recruitment experience or sales experience
• High energy levels and a positive attitude
• Excellent relationship and communication skills
• Passion to succeed in a busy working environment
• Team focused and a collaborative working style
• Excellent time management
• Hold a current driver license
• Be available for early morning start time which is on a rotation basis


What will we offer you?
• an intensive on-boarding and structured training program; including online e-learning, classroom training, peer mentoring and on the job coaching/shadowing
• great rewards and incentives; regular awards & recognition programs, sales competitions, an extensive employee benefits program
• access to our global brand, marketing materials and thought leadership research
• we have established teams and client base, customised technology and an exceptional office environment

If you are looking for your next career move, please apply today!

At Randstad we take time to celebrate our wins and team achievements. Our personal milestones are part of our successful journey. Last year we celebrated our 55th anniversary which is highlighted in the video clip attached!

Great fun team Successful team- making Commission Parramatta Location Great Commission

Deakin University is currently seeking to appoint a Leader to transform faculty services and systems within the Faculty of Arts and Education to create a strong service culture. The position will collaborate across the University to ensure Faculty needs are met and exceptional services are provided to Faculty and University stakeholders including staff, students and partners.

Reporting to the Executive Director, Faculty Services, you will play a key role in providing strategic direction and leadership of the professional services required to support the Faculty to excel in the delivery of its strategic and operational outcomes in  education, research and impact.  The position works closely with the Executive Dean, Faculty of Arts and Education and is a key member of the Faculty Executive team.

As the Director, you will have an oversight of financial management, academic services, partnerships and engagement, research management, health safety and well-being, project management, infrastructure as well as domestic and international student load planning, marketing and recruitment activities. The position also has oversight of School administration, accreditation processes and placement support.

Your key responsibilities will include:

  • Stakeholder engagement with internal partners to support Faculty operations and external partners aligned to enhancing operational strategy and impact.
  • Ensuring and promoting high-quality service delivery aligned with University and Faculty ambition, priorities and strategy.
  • Strategic course and unit management, ensuring ongoing financial and/or strategic viability, and ensuring appropriate academic services support to achieve operational requirements.
  • Strategic research management ensuring available resources and support aligned to the achievement of Faculty research strategy targets and outcomes.
  • Financial management and analysis of Faculty operations ensuring ongoing sustainability.
  • Investigate major issues and stimulate the development of strategies to resolve problems affecting operations and operate within the constraints of University objectives and professional standards.
  • Act as a coach and leader and work with team members to establish clear performance expectations. Facilitate growth and development by giving balanced, constructive feedback considering individual capability and team performance, in alignment with Deakin’s code of conduct and core University strategies and policies that promote a safe, sustainable and productive working environment.

To be successful, you’ll have:

  • A combination of relevant tertiary qualifications, preferably at post graduate level, and demonstrated significant and substantial experience in a senior Faculty Services role, in large and complex organisation.
  • Demonstrated capacity to build and maintain strong and productive relationships with multiple internal and external partners and stakeholders from business, government, or community sectors.
  • Demonstrated capacity for analytical and conceptual thought in the diagnosis of problems and in providing innovative, timely, relevant, and practical solutions.
  • Demonstrated strong understanding of contemporary Faculty services concepts and strategies and the capacity to adapt and implement these for the benefit of an organisation.

For a copy of the position description and additional information regarding the role and Faculty, please see below:

 Director Faculty Services HEW 10+ final .pdf

 About Arts and Education.docx

 Recruitment pack.pdf

Please submit your updated resume and a short cover letter outlining your skills and experience for this role.  Applications for this position close on Sunday 28th November 2021.

This role requires the incumbent to apply for and maintain a Working with Children Check (refer to Deakin’s Recruitment Procedure for further details).

Please note that whilst we still accept applications from any persons interested in our roles, due to the impacts of COVID-19, we are currently prioritising applications from those with current working rights in Australia and who are not affected by travel restrictions. Are You Ready?

Deakin is a Victorian university with a global impact. We are an agile, dynamic and innovative university committed to making a positive impact through our excellence in education, research and innovation and the contributions we make to the wider community.

We understand that our reputation has been built on the dedication and expertise of our staff and we offer a dynamic and diverse working environment with opportunities to grow and develop careers. We believe that a progressive, thriving culture will ensure that people choose to come, and stay at Deakin and contribute to our ongoing success.

We value diversity and aim to build an inclusive environment that champions, embraces and respects differences. We support and encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, and people of all cultures, sexual orientation, and genders.

About Our Facility

Barwon Health is the largest health service in regional Victoria and based in Geelong, it is within commuting range from the west side of Melbourne.  With approximately 9,000 employees, 30 sites and a broad range of services, Barwon Health plays a key role in the health and wellbeing of our local community and the Barwon South Western region.

Barwon Health’s Nutrition & Dietetics Department provides services across the care continuum including Acute Care based at University Hospital Geelong, and Rehabilitation, Subacute and Aged Care based at McKellar Centre. We provide dietetic services to inpatients and outpatients across all clinical specialties according to current best practice and professional standards. We work collaboratively across sites, as well as with our community-based colleagues. Our staff pursue clinical excellence, consumer-centred care and interdisciplinary teamwork. 

About the Role

As the Grade 1 Dietitian at Barwon Health, you will act as a high-functioning team-member of the Department of Nutrition & Dietetics to provide evidence-based nutrition and dietetic services to patients, clients and customers of Barwon Health. 

If you are a motivated dietitian with experience in an acute care hospital and would like to join our dynamic Nutrition and Dietetic service that is committed to best practice and providing you with opportunities to develop your clinical dietetics expertise please apply today!

About the culture 

Barwon Health is a values driven organisation and you will thrive working in a culture that values respect, compassion, commitment, accountability and innovation.

You will have the opportunity to be part of a highly skilled, professional, friendly and dedicated team who takes pride in providing high quality service.  Barwon Health provides a supportive environment that encourages professional growth and education in this specialist area.

Barwon Health staff benefits

  • Flexible working arrangements
  • Professional development
  • Access to employee wellness facility
  • Salary packaging
  • Social club
  • Doorstep to the Great Ocean Road, Bellarine Peninsula and the Surf Coast

About the Geelong Region, AUSTRALIA

Sitting within one of Victoria’s six regional health centres, Barwon Health serves the community of Greater Geelong and beyond. Victoria’s second largest city after Melbourne! Derived from the local Wadawurrung name for the region; Djillong, (Geelong) and means “Tongue of Land”.

  • Enjoy a range of lifestyle choices including inner city, coastal, suburban and rural homes at affordable prices.
  • High standard of schooling options throughout the area
  • A stone throw from the Surf Coast and Great Ocean Road
  • Appreciate beautiful parks, rivers, walks and wineries
  • To find out more about the Geelong region, visit our Moving to the Region page on the Barwon Health website. 

Diversity and Inclusion

At Barwon Health, we are committed to a diverse and inclusive workforce where we value each person’s uniqueness. We embrace diverse life experiences and the perspectives of our people, whilst providing high-quality health care to all members of our community, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, religion, cultural background, disability, or sexual orientation.

At Barwon Health, we are committed to providing positive employment opportunities for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and welcome employment applications from candidates of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander background.

We at Barwon Health strongly encourage people with disability and diverse backgrounds to apply for our roles.  We are strongly committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people. Fujitsu Australia and New Zealand is focussed on helping its customers with their digital transformation. We partner with our customers to consult, design, build, operate and support business solutions and are recognised as a supplier of choice for leading corporate and government organisations.

What's On Offer?

Here is a great opportunity to help build the Fujitsu brand in the Oceania Region as part of our transformation to a digital business. We are pleased to announce an exciting opportunity to join the Marketing Team based in Sydney as a Marketing Coordinator – Communications.

This is an interesting and varied role focussed on supporting the Communications function of the Oceania business. The role is challenging and fast-paced and includes the following duties:

  • Developing and executing the social media publishing schedule for the company's social media platforms including LinkedIn, Twitter and Facebook. Creating strategies to increase employee engagement with the company's social media channels.

  • Creating engaging content for internal and external communications activities. This includes he execution of communications activities such as the Intranet News Feed and regular company e-newsletters, liaising with stakeholders across the Oceania business as needed including the Executive Team, HR, Sales and Delivery Units.

  • Processing internal communication requests, including writing and editing of communications and seeking appropriate approvals.

  • Being the touch point for external enquiries, including monitoring of external email accounts and responding to queries from customers and the general public in a timely manner.

  • Supporting the members of the Marketing Team across a range of digital and non-digital activities to deliver a diverse range of marketing campaigns and events.

  • Editing (proof-reading) and reviewing content for marketing material in support of other initiatives.

  • Assisting in the coordination of internal and external events.

  • Producing and editing videos for internal use as required.

What Do We Want From You?

Experience/Qualifications:

The person we are looking for this exciting role will:

  • Be a self-starter with a proven ability to take ownership.

  • Have excellent writing ability, a passion for writing and a good eye for detail.

  • Have excellent English skills – speaking, writing and listening.

  • Be able to demonstrate a proven ability to work to tight deadlines.

  • Have qualifications and experience in Marketing and/or Communications in a corporate environment.

  • Be comfortable working with digital platforms and able to demonstrate proficiency in Microsoft Office.

  • Be a true team player.

  • Have skills in Adobe Creative Suite and video editing (desirable).

Location

Macquarie Park, NSW

What’s in it for you?

A leading business specialising in premium safety equipment seeks an energetic and strategic territory manager to grow sales and act as a business partner for the company. For this role, you will be awarded a competitive base salary of up to $90k + superannuation.

Before stepping into the role, you will undergo a one-week onboarding and training program at their head office in Sydney. This is a highly autonomous role that allows you the flexibility to work from your home office and on the road across your assigned territory in NSW.

Best of all, this is a fantastic opportunity to represent a quality product to a diverse customer base for an established, international business.

What will you be doing

As territory manager, you will plan, develop and execute strategic business and partnership plans, targeting both existing and new accounts. Grow sales for the company’s range of quality electrical components and safety equipment. Set your sights on key stakeholders, such as electrical contractors, distributors, OEMs, switchboard builders, wholesalers and end-users.

Demonstrate a consultative and solutions-selling approach to actively engage with said prospects, as you manage and develop your client portfolio. Moreover, you will also conduct site inspections and develop market intelligence to accurately forecast both short and long-term sales opportunities.

Utilise your sales experience and technical aptitude to achieve success in this highly dynamic role.

Who will you be doing it for?

Your future employer is a thriving business specialising in the manufacture of high-grade electrical parts and safety equipment with a worldwide presence. With over a century of experience, they have multiple branches across the globe and thousands of employees - all dedicated to serving a diverse customer base. As the newest addition to the team, you will work with driven colleagues, led by experienced and supportive management.

• Riverland Mallee Coorong Local Health Network, Murray Mallee Community Health
  • Salary: $1,019.10 - $1,079.60 per week (pro rata) - Temporary Part Time (up to 30 June 2022) - WHA3, WHA4, WHA5
  • Multiple positions available

 

The Regional Local Health Networks moved to a Consumer Directed Care model for the provision of aged care, disability, and support services. This allows consumers to maintain greater control over their lives by allowing them to make choices about the services they receive and who delivers those services. Consumers are encouraged to actively participate in identifying and setting goals, and to determine what level of involvement they want in managing their own care arrangements.  

Under this model of care, the funding associated with the role of the Community Support Worker is controlled by consumers, rather than by the health provider. This means that consumers have an active role in determining the shifts that are available, the duties that are performed, the frequency of demand for the service, and the choice of provider organisation.

The Community Support Worker is integral to supporting this model of care by providing services including personal care, cleaning, meal preparation, transport and social support, to persons who are aged, frail or disabled and who wish to remain living in their own home with some assistance, or are living in a Residential Aged Care facility.

Community Support Workers need to be flexible, conscientious and empathetic and be able to work autonomously in the community. They will work closely and collaboratively with the consumer, their family and other health professionals, to provide quality outcomes and maintain consumer independence where possible.

Riverland Mallee Coorong Local Health Network Inc supports staff to further develop their skills across a variety of areas. Ongoing education is encouraged and enables staff to provide quality and responsive services to consumers.

Working at WHA4 level you must have a certificate 3 in Individual Support (Ageing, Disability or Home and Community).  Working at WHA5 level you must have a certificate 3 in Individual Support (Ageing, Disability or Home and Community) and at least 560 hours satisfactory in service experience.

In addition to the annual salary package we also offer salary sacrifice benefits, employer superannuation contributions and leave loading.

This is a multiple position, multiple classification part time vacancy, classification to be determined upon qualifications and working hours per fortnight and salary will be adjusted according to actual hours worked.

Appointment will be subject to a satisfactory Criminal History Screening/Check and specific immunisation requirements.

COVID-19 vaccination is an essential requirement under the Emergency Management (Healthcare Setting Workers Vaccination) (COVID-19) Directions 2021 to work in SA Health/health care setting.

Suitably qualified Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander applicants are strongly encouraged to apply and will be given preference as a special/equal opportunity measure under section 8(1) of the Racial Discrimination Act 1975 (Cth), and sections 34(2) and 56(2) of the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 (SA).

The South Australian public sector promotes diversity and flexible ways of working including part-time. Applicants are encouraged to discuss the flexible working arrangements for this role.

Head of compliance job based at a global bank in Sydney CBD

Your new company
This company are a global bank based in Sydney and are a leading provider for a wide range of financial solutions to corporate and institutional clients.

Your new role
The role will to lead a team to identify and manage the key regulatory and legal requirements of the bank. You will assess and look to improve the current compliance monitoring programme. You will ensure all Australian regulations and laws are adhered too with ongoing banking activities and continually monitored for changes in legislation and regulation, in accordance with group policies and procedures. You will continue to develop controls policies and processes and ensure complete compliance testing to ensure compliance. You will look at conflicts of interest, Chinese walls, staff trading policies, insider trading risks. You will ensure the compliance training programme is implemented and all staff are trained according and kept abreast of any changes to regulation to enhance awareness. As the AML/CTF Officer, you will implement the AML/CTF programme and keep abreast of changes to the AML/CTF Act, ensuring the culture is driven throughout the business. You will forge a collaborative relationship with external regulators and be the main point of contact and will look at any new financial products from a compliance perspective. You will investigate any compliance breaches and report them and help putting in place remediation plans with the guidance of senior management.

What you'll need to succeed
You will require extensive experience within the banking industry and have worked within a senior regulatory compliance role. You will have corporate or institutional banking experience at a senior level and an excellent knowledge of financial products. You will hold relevant tertiary qualifications to at least degree level, and additional qualifications ascertaining to compliance, as well as a post graduate studies will be looked upon favourably . You will have local Australian market experience and experience of dealing with the regulators. You will be able to manage a team and have the ability to influence at senior levels. You will be able to articulate bank regulation and legislation and build excellent relationships with external regulators. You will have strong analytical skills and report writing ability. You will display strong leadership skills and a strategic mindset.


What you'll get in return
A fantastic senior leadership opportunity to work for global bank that have an excellent reputation and a great working environment.

What you need to do now
If you feel you fit the criteria and are interested in the role, please click ‘apply now’ or for a confidential discussion, contact Philip Lewis on 02 8226 9752 or email your CV to philip.lewis@hays.com.au to be considered.

job_ad_details:

Flying from any state capital to site.

Australian residency and full work rights.

  • Trade Certificate
  • 3 years minimum industry experience
  • Strong tig welding skills
  • Be able to pass full medical and drug and alcohol testing.
  • Experience in Oil and Gas, LNG, Refinery or Petro Chemical industry an advantage.
  • Working at Heights, Confined Space and EWP qualifications highly regarded.


This is a great opportunity to secure long-term project work, paying very attractive rates and conditions. APPLY NOW if you meet the above criteria.

School Of Agriculture and Food Sciences

The School of Agriculture and Food Sciences is one of the largest agricultural schools in Australia, comprising research and teaching experts in agribusiness, animals and wildlife, environment, plants and soil, and food and nutrition. The School offers a range of undergraduate and postgraduate coursework and research degrees encompassing those disciplines ranging from Bachelor to Doctorate. Situated at St Lucia and Gatton within the Faculty of Science, the School is a large and dynamic multidisciplinary hub with farm, pasture and laboratory facilities, and an established reputation for excellence and commitment to finding innovative and technology focused solutions to global challenges. UQ is ranked the top university in Australia and one of the top 20 universities in the world for agriculture. (QS World University Rankings by subject 2017 Agriculture and Forestry, https://www.topuniversities.com/university-rankings/university-subject-rankings/2017/agriculture-forestry).

The Role

The agronomy group at UQ Gatton has active research programs exploring agronomic and genetic approaches to improving grain legume production and reliability, and to developing improved fertilizer decision making and application strategies. This position will form part of that research team, with the appointee asked to focus on nutrient – soil interactions that underlie effective fertilizer application strategies. Specific questions will include the most effective form of phosphorus (P) fertilizer to maximize P bioavailability in the short and longer term in soils with differing clay contents, pH, P sorption capacity and Ca status; and the interactions between fertilizer products when N, P and K are co-located in bands in clay soils and at high in-band concentrations.

The Person

Applicants should possess a PhD in Agricultural Science, Environmental Science, or Science, with expertise in crop nutrition or soil chemistry. You should also have a strong desire to develop a successful and highly-productive research career, excellent analytic and troubleshooting skills, very good oral communication and writing abilities, and the capacity to work effectively within a research team that includes industry researchers.

Location

Whilst the position is based at Gatton, the successful applicant will be expected to work at St Lucia campus as need may be and depending on the requirements of the role.

Position Description

PD - Postdoc Research Fellow.pdf

Remuneration

This is a three year full time appointment at Academic Research Level A. The remuneration package will be in the range $ 81,545.80 to $ 87535.13 p.a., plus employer superannuation contributions of up to 17% (total package will be in the range $ 95,408.59 to $ 102,416.10p.a.).

Enquiries

To discuss this role please contact Professor Michael Bell (m.bell4@uq.edu.au or +61 7 3365 0140) or Associate Professor Peter Kopittke (p.kopittke@uq.edu.au or +61 7 3346 9149).

To submit an application for this role, use the Apply button below. All applicants must supply the following documents: Cover letter, Resume and Selection Criteria responses.

For information on completing the application process click here.

Application Closing Date

Applications close on 26 Nov 2017 at 11:55 pm E. Australia Standard Time

Legal Information and Referral Officer (LIRO)

About Western Sydney Community Legal Centre

Western Sydney Community Legal Centre works across Western Sydney, providing a range of legal and legal support services to the community. We are a new organization following the amalgamation of Macquarie Legal Centre, Mt Druitt and Area Community Legal Centre and Hawkesbury Nepean Community Legal Centre.

Our organization has 2 arms – a legal practice which provides legal information, legal advice, limited and targeted case work and community legal education across criminal, family, care and protection, civil, employment and discrimination areas.  We have a specialist services in the areas of home building and tenancy. We also undertake law reform work.

Our community program arm provides legal support services including court advocacy for women experiencing domestic violence, children and young people appearing in the Children's court with a specialist service supporting ATSI young people. We run a Children's Contact Centre for families experiencing family breakdown, enabling children to have supervised contact with both parents and supervised change over. We also provide support to Aboriginal communities living in the Windsor area to access legal services and legal support services and run an education program for young people and youth workers.

WSCLC is a dynamic organization about to embark on a new Strategic Plan.

About this Role

Responsible for providing and assisting with the delivery of efficient and timely support services which facilitate the effective management of the legal services, in accordance with the Centre's Objectives, Strategic Plan and Service Agreement.

The Generalist Paralegal is employed by, and is accountable to the Management Committee of Western Sydney Community Legal Centre through the Manager. Day-to-day the LIRO will work with and be directly supervised by the supervising solicitor at the Windsor Branch of WSCLC.

The position holder is required to work independently with minimal supervision but is directed to refer problem situations to the Chief Executive Officer of Western Sydney Community Legal Centre.

Day-to-day the LIRO will work with and be directly supervised by the supervising solicitor at  Windsor

This position is part time 14 hours a week, based at Windsor

KEY RESPONSIBILITIES

  1. Ability to coordinate telephone advice and referral services as well as provide information to clients.
  2. Ability to work independently and as a cooperative member of a team.
  3. Ability to mange the client database and client files. 
  4. Demonstrated understanding of legal and social issues relevant to disadvantaged groups.
  5. Ability to implement responsive and accessible services and to work with a broad range of other services and agencies.
  6. Good organisational, administrative and communication skills.
  7. Excellent written, word processing and computer skills.

SELECTION CRITERIA

  1. Ability to coordinate telephone advice and referral services as well as provide information to clients.
  2. Ability to work independently and as a cooperative member of a team.
  3. Ability to mange the client database and client files. 
  4. Demonstrated understanding of legal and social issues relevant to disadvantaged groups.
  5. Ability to implement responsive and accessible services and to work with a broad range of other services and agencies.
  6. Good organizational, administrative and communication skills.
  7. Excellent written, word processing and computer skills.

HOW TO APPLY

All applications require:

  • A CV including 2 referees, preferably including your most recent supervisor
  • A statement addressing the  selection criteria.  For each criteria please write a short statement on how you address this criteria.

Applications which do not include a statement against the selection criteria will not be considered

Applications to be emailed to recruitment@wsclc.org.au  no later than 19 September 2017 by 5:00 pm.

Only people who are successful to the interview stage will be contacted.

We have a current requirement for a Design Manager (Landscape Architect) in the Architecture team for approx. 12 months

The City of Sydney is the local government authority responsible for the city centre and more than 30 suburbs within the council boundaries. The council provide services for more than 200,000 residents and 20,000 businesses, as well as the daily influx of workers and visitors into the City. On any given day, the local population swells to more than 1 million with people commuting, doing business, shopping, playing, studying, or here to see the sights of Sydney.

We have a current requirement for a Design Manager (Landscape Architect) in the Architecture team for approx. 12 months (possible extension dependent on project budgets) to commence as soon as possible.

Design Managers in this team are responsible for the delivery of design for the City’s capital works projects with specific expertise in public buildings. There is a range of building projects underway or planned including the Green Square Aquatic centre, the Green Square Library, new community and childcare facilities and a range of community and commercial facility upgrades.

City of Sydney Design Managers undertake feasibility, develop project briefs and contracts and manage the design process and teams. Typically consultant design teams are engaged to undertake design and documentation from feasibility developed in-house.

Experience and competence across project phases is desirable including initiation and feasibility, Concept Design, Documentation and Construction phases.

The successful applicant will have considerable expertise and experience in the detailed design and delivery of high quality public and /or facilities, demonstrating a high level of proficiency in project management, contract management and with the personal attributes that will enable them to successfully engage with both consultant teams and project staff as well as clients and stakeholders.

The candidate could be dealing with cluster of Projects, so this is very much project based role. A range of specific opportunities exist depending upon the strengths of the candidate, from feasibility and concept stage focus of new projects to a managing design issues and quality control in a range of projects in construction.

A minimum of 3-5 years post graduate experience is anticipated.

Please contact Andrew Holden or Helena Gunner on 9277 7000 if you have any further enquires.

Alliance and Unit Overview

Planning and Economic Development plans for and regulates the development of the City’s natural and built environment and many of the activities that happen within in the City and is responsible for the development and growth of the City of Perth’s economy.  The Transport and Urban Design Unit is located within the Planning and Economic Development Alliance alongside:

  • City Planning
  • Development Approvals
  • Economic Development
Transport and Urban Design is responsible for the design, coordination and appropriate delivery of projects and programs within the public realm in the City along with the planning, design and management of the City’s streets and transport networks, as identified by the City’s strategic plans and vision.  The Transport unit also works closely with other units and relevant State Government agencies to ensure that movements to, from and within the City can happen in efficient and sustainable ways.

Position Objectives

The Transport Engineer will assist and support the Senior Transport Engineer in the development and implementation of initiatives for the Transport unit’s programs and projects and provide a high level of project management and support within the unit.   They will deliver traffic and transport engineering ranging on projects including all contract administration as required to ensure delivery of the capital works projects.  
 
The Transport Engineer will provide specialist technical advice to internal and external clients and be a key customer interface between the City and State Government Transport/Development Agencies/Departments as required including the private/public sector.

The successful candidate will be delivering the objectives of the role in a busy environment that includes but is not limited to the following key responsibilities:

  • Provide management support to the Senior Transport Engineer in the development and implementation of initiatives for the Unit’s programs and projects
  • Provide leadership, management and development for the Unit’s junior staff
  • Assist the Senior Transport Engineer in day to day operations/ functions including coordination and monitoring of various activities of the Team
  • Undertake comprehensive research and analysis of a wide range of traffic and transport related issues and opportunities
  • Develop, prepare and implement project briefs, budget justifications including all necessary project documentation in readiness for capital budget reviews 
  • Establish and manage project scope, program, budget, risk and quality for each project assigned
  • Be a primary point of contact for internal stakeholders relating to assigned projects
  • Manage multi-disciplinary teams undertaking studies or designing, documenting and implementing works relating to the design and management of the City’s street and transport networks
  • Ensure major developments and public works produce sustainable transport outcomes and are in the best interest of the broader community
  • Prepare comprehensive reports to senior / executive management and Council and correspondence as required

How to Apply

Our client is an award-winning, industry leader providing solutions to Customers from supply chain, machining, fabrication and assembly. Located in Bayswater, the team of 60 has been providing solutions to heavy industry, with a focus on transport, for 50 years.

With the continued growth, the company is seeking a Quality Assurance Engineer to join the team and provide technical support to operations.

About You

Reporting to the Quality Manager, you have hands-on engineering experience and the ability to ensure parts and processes meet ISO quality standards and customer standards. 

You are a natural problem solver who is able to trouble-shoot and work collaboratively to implement successful quality initiatives. 

Your Duties and Responsibilities

Some of the key responsibilities will include:

  • Liaise with External ISO Auditors to complete audits 
  • Establish appropriate manufacturing process controls to eliminate the outflow of non-conformances.

  • Ensure that equipment calibration (measuring tools & all production jigs) is performed as per the calibration schedule and maintenance carried out
  • Monthly Quality reports to management highlighting issues with status of actions derived from KPI (Includes PPM Reports, DMR Status, Scrap Reports etc.)
  • Ensure that all QA related documentation is available and displayed at the workplace for all current and new jobs.

Key Requirements

  • Qualification in engineering or mechanical discipline
  • 3-5 years’ experience in a Quality role within a Mechanical Engineering manufacturing environment
  • Practical knowledge and experience in Quality Control tools 
  • Experience implementing Quality Engineering principles and Advanced Quality Planning / PPAP
  • Great mechanical aptitude
  • Excellent interpersonal communication and stakeholder management
  • Knowledge of Microsoft Office and CAD software (Solidworks or equivalent)

The Benefits

  • Busy production environment with strong pipeline of work

How to apply

Click ‘apply now’ with a current copy of your CV and a covering letter that addresses the criteria above.

Job DescriptionConsultant to Director Salary Range 60k to 180k+KPMG Data & Cloud

is a team with a passion for helping our clients solve their business challenges. We achieve this through technology-based solutions that unlock insights and value from data and leverage innovative cloud-based solutions. Leveraging the "One KPMG" approach, our team works collaboratively with the wider KPMG service lines to provide our clients with industry-specific, tailored proposals that result in highly differentiated business transformation outcomes.We re-imagine and re-invent organizations to become world class enterprises using advanced technologies, data and human insights.

We help organizations to embrace Data Strategy, Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Cognitive, the Internet of Things (IoT), Data, Analytics & Modelling and more.

Data Platforms
  • Drive a technical roadmap for the team, covering non-functional requirements such as scalability, reliability and observability
  • Assess new and existing data sources on their applicability to address the business issue and translate the outcomes of the analytical solutions we design in the context of business impacts and benefits.
  • Design, construct, install, test and maintain highly scalable, resilient, recoverable data management systems by bringing a software engineering mindset and applying DataOps principles
  • Automate the build deployment of data pipelines using and DevOps and CI/CD patterns, including defining what tests are required and can be automated at each stage of the lifecycle of a data pipeline.
  • Understand, explain and evangelize buzz words such as serverless, cloud native and PaaS and how they impact the design of Data Pipelines
  • Be comfortable with code or tool based data pipelines and understand the pro and cons of each.
  • Work closely with Data Scientists to extract and manipulate data from a variety of sources and subsequently cleanse, standardize, scale, bin, categorize, tokenize, stem and transform it in order to get the data into a state suitable for further analysis.
  • Design, develop and implement the automated approach for productionising model scoring and the closed loop feedback paths required to support test and learn.
  • Select and configure analytics toolsets considering the clients' business issue and analytic maturity.
Intelligent Automation

The Intelligent Automation and Low-Code Consultant thrives in a unique culture where thinking outside the box is required daily and creative input is necessary to solve business problems. You will work as a solution designer to help shape and deliver strategic initiatives to go beyond simple process automation towards sophisticated and transformational intelligent automation initiatives. You will work proactively to:

  • Contribute to the development of automation strategies and solutions, leveraging technologies including low-code / no-code platforms, robotic process automation (RPA), process discovery / mining, conversational automation, image recognition, voice recognition and business process management (BPM) / workflow technologies.
  • Collaborate with industry and functional subject matter professionals and technical team members as a part of dynamic, fast-paced project teams to design and build elegant, high-impact business applications using intelligent automation and low-code platforms.
  • Assist with the definition of operating models and team structures to manage the implementation of intelligent automation and low-code programs.
  • Help clients explore how Artificial Intelligence and Advanced Analytics can augment automation technologies.
  • Facilitate client discovery sessions and perform investigative interviews to elicit stakeholder perspectives, motivations and requirements to define project scope and requirements, and translate business processes to functional specifications and user stories.
  • Guide technical design sessions to define user experience, data definition, process / rules configuration and integration for intelligent automation and low-code solutions.
  • Build, test and deliver intelligent automation and low-code solutions using industry leading vendor technologies.
  • Collaborate with onshore / offshore colleagues throughout the agile software development process.
Cloud Platform Engineering
  • You are highly experienced in developing infrastructure as code (IaC) using Terraform in AWS, Azure or GCP
  • You are highly experienced in building cloud platforms and landing zones
  • You have experience with APIs and building or maintaining integrations
  • You have experience building CI/CD pipelines and automation tooling
  • You are knowledgeable about DevOps concepts, practices and tools
  • You are knowledgeable about coding best practice, basic security considerations, and relevant tooling
  • You have experience developing within modern software delivery methodologies e.g. Agile, Lean, TDD and/or BDD
  • You are highly organised, motivated, and capable of working independently
  • You have experience in building practice assets and go to market propositions
  • You have experience in managing practice staff and/or recruiting
  • You are experienced at pricing and/or commercially managing large engagements, or a willingness to learn
  • You have a background in cloud engineering, software development, or a relevant field, with 6+ years experience
  • You have certifications in AWS, Azure or GCP
Data Strategy & Management
  • Craft innovative data strategies that articulate a compelling vision and propose the future capabilities required to enable advanced value creation opportunities for sustained client growth and profitability.
  • Assist clients with understanding leading edge data capabilities and the transformational impact they could have on their business.
  • Define and implement robust data management operating models (including data governance frameworks) including effective structures, roles and responsibilities, processes and the advanced technologies required to drive the effective management of data across the enterprise.
  • Define and implement programs to improve the understanding of data governance responsibilities and data literacy across the enterprise.
  • Interpret data risk regulatory frameworks and determine robust approaches for clients to embed controls into ways of working.
  • Engage with senior client stakeholders to understand their vision and to define and recommend valid and pragmatic data strategies and solutions.
  • Define the business capabilities, business services and information flows required to deliver the recommended Digital Delta strategies and solutions.
  • Collaborate closely with a multi-disciplinary team of technical specialists comprising of KPMG employees, vendor specialists and client employees.
  • Analyse the anticipated impact of the implementation of new Digital Delta technology solutions on the client across the people, processes and culture areas.
  • Define and implement change plans to prepare and engage clients for new solutions to ensure successful adoption and value realisation.
  • Develop and deliver clear and articulate, audience appropriate, presentations of findings and recommendations, ensuring presentations are persuasive and provide a captivating story.
  • Document work results in a comprehensive, coherent manner using professional business writing skills.

We have offices in the following locations:

  • Sydney
  • Melbourne
  • Brisbane
  • Perth
  • Adelaide
  • Canberra
  • Hobart
Additional InformationKPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. We partner with clients across an array of industries to solve complex challenges, steer change, drive disruption, and enable growth.

Our people are what make KPMG the thriving workplace that it is and what sets us apart is that we know great minds think differently. Collaborate with a team of passionate, highly skilled professionals who've got your back. You'll build relationships with unique and diverse colleagues who will provide you with the support you need to be your best and produce meaningful and impactful work in an inclusive, equitable culture.

At KPMG, you'll take control over how you work. We're embracing a new way of working in many ways, from offering flexible hours and locations to generous paid parental leave and career breaks. Our people enjoy a variety of exciting perks, including retail discounts, health and wellbeing initiatives, learning and growth opportunities, salary packaging options and more.

Diverse candidates have diverse needs. During your recruitment journey, information will be provided about adjustment requests. If you require additional support before submitting your application, please contact Talent Support Team .

At KPMG every career is different, and we look forward to seeing how you grow with us.

  • Relationship Building: Leverage strategic relationships to manage risk and maximise contract value.
  • Negotiation Leadership: Establish negotiation strategies and lead complex contract negotiations.
  • Contract Review: Lead reviews of expiring contracts to shape future procurement strategy.
  • Decision-Making: Apply expertise in contract variations, exemptions, extensions, and transitions.
Experience Needed:
  • Minimum 5 years in finance/contract management roles.
  • Knowledge of government procurement policies and legislation.
  • Proven experience in negotiating complex contracts.
  • Strong analytical and budget management skills.
  • Excellent communication and relationship-building abilities.

job_title: Becario en Supply Chain - Mexico City, Mexico
job_ad_details:
Dentsply Sirona es el mayor fabricante mundial de productos y tecnologías dentales profesionales, con una historia de 130 años de innovación y servicios para la industria dental y los pacientes de todo el mundo. Dentsply Sirona desarrolla, fabrica y comercializa una oferta integral de soluciones que incluyen productos para la salud bucal y dental, así como otros dispositivos médicos consumibles, bajo una sólida cartera de marcas de clase mundial. Los productos Dentsply Sirona brindan soluciones innovadoras, efectivas y de alta calidad para mejorar la atención al paciente y brindar una odontología mejor y más segura. La sede global de Dentsply Sirona se encuentra en Charlotte, Carolina del Norte. Las acciones de la compañía cotizan en los Estados Unidos en NASDAQ bajo el símbolo XRAY.

Despertando lo mejor de las personas

A pesar de lo avanzada que está la odontología en estos días, estamos comprometidos a mejorarla aún más. Nuestros empleados sienten pasión por la innovación y están comprometidos a aplicarla para mejorar el cuidado dental. Vivimos y respiramos alto rendimiento, trabajando como un equipo global y sacando lo mejor de cada uno en beneficio de los pacientes dentales y de los profesionales que los atienden. Si desea crecer y desarrollarse como parte de un equipo que está dando forma a la industria, sepa que estamos buscando a las mejores personas para unirse a nosotros en nuestra misión de hacerle sonreír.

Trabajando en Dentsply Sirona, puede:

  • Desarrolle más rápido, con nuestro compromiso con el mejor desarrollo profesional.
     
  • Mejore su desempeño, como parte de una cultura de alto desempeño y empoderamiento.
     
  • Dar forma a una industria, con un líder del mercado que continúa impulsando la innovación.
     
  • Marque la diferencia ayudando a mejorar la salud bucal en todo el mundo.  

Aquí en Dentsply Sirona, los pasantes elegidos son aquellos que tienen un perfil colaborador, actúan con agilidad, son responsables, confiables y valoran el respeto, además de querer revolucionar la salud bucal en todo el mundo con nosotros. Nuestra empresa es el mayor fabricante de productos y tecnologías dentales profesionales de la industria, con una historia de 130 años de innovación y servicio a pacientes de todo el mundo. ¡Ven a dar los primeros pasos de tu carrera y prepárate aún más para el mercado de DS!

Principales Responsabilidades

  • Análisis de operación y desarrollo de estándares para la operación.
  • Diseño de procesos, diagramas de flujo
  • Soporte en proyectos de cadena de suministro.
  • Uso de impresora Zebra
  • Determinación de estándares
  • Elaboración de KPI
  • Mapeo de proceso
  • Mejora de proceso de cadena de suministro y distribución
  • Control de la producción / stock mínimos y máximos de inventario
  • Desarrollo de tableros de control mediante Power BI y Power pivot.

Calificaciones requeridas

  • Estudiantes de carreras como: ingeniería industrial, calidad, transporte, logística, comercio internacional y afines
  • Conocimiento en Excel y paquete office
  • Conocimiento en SAP es un diferencial
  • Facil aceso a la zona norte de la ciudad de Mexico

Dentsply Sirona es un empleador que ofrece igualdad de oportunidades. Todos los solicitantes que cuentes con las competencias que requiere el rol serán considerados para las vacantes independientemente de su nacionalidad, religión, género, edad, orientación sexual, discapacidad o antecedentes. Gracias por su interés en Dentsply Sirona.

job_title: Senior Pastor - God's Will Church Brisbane
job_ad_details:
Senior Pastor - God's Will Church Brisbane

호주 높은뜻 브리즈번교회 담임목사 청빙 공고

높은뜻 브리즈번교회는 "하나님이 주인 되신 교회"라는 높은뜻 목회철학을 따라 2017년 2월, 호주 브리즈번에 개척된 교회입니다. 짧은 시간 적지 않은 성도들과 함께 하게 되었고, 이에 이민사회 안에서 주님의 부르심과 사명을 가지고 다음세대를 믿음으로 세워가고자 힘써 나아가는 교회입니다.

현재 담임 목사의 비자 문제로 인해 사임하게 되어 새로운 담임목사를 청빙하게 되었습니다.

[높은뜻 브리즈번 교회는 호주 퀸즐랜드 그리스도 교회(Churches of Christ in Queensland, www.cofc.com.au) 소속 교회이며, 한국 높은뜻 연합선교회(대표 : 문희곤 목사/높은뜻 푸른교회) 회원 교회입니다.]

등록 교인은 약390여명이고 주일

출석 평균 260여명의 성도(교육부포함)와 함께 예배드리는 교회입니다.

좀 더 자세한 교회소개는 홈페이지(www.godswillau.org)와 Youtube "높은뜻 브리즈번교회" 영상을 참고 바랍니다.

1.지원자격

1)목사안수 이후 목회경력 3년이상(부목사 사역 포함)

2)정통 개신교 신학대학원 졸업자

3)호주비자 신청에 결격사유 없는 자, 사회법에 흠이 없는 자

4)높은뜻교회의 목회철학인 [높은뜻 정신]을 이해하고 받아 들일 준비가 되어 있으신 분(홈페이지 참고)

2.제출서류

*이메일 접수 godswillbrissy@gmail.com

1)이력서

2)자기소개서(성장과정,가족관계,신앙고백,사역내용,지원동기 등)

3)목회자 추천서(현재 소속교회 또는 이전교회 담임목사)

- 2차 심사때 필요한 서류입니다. 

4)설교영상 링크(최근 6개월 이내 2편 이상)

3.접수기간 - 2024년 7월31일 까지

4.문의 : (청빙위원) 김영욱 집사, 한선이

집사

- 그 외 교회와 사역, 비자에 관해 궁금한 부분 있으시면 이메일로 문의바랍니다.

(godswillbrissy@gmail.com)

언제든 부담 없이 문의해주시면 성심 성의껏 답변 드리겠습니다.

주님의 인도하심으로 귀한 목회자를 만날 것을 기대하고 기도합니다.

감사합니다. 

Advertisement for Senior Pastor Position at God's Will Brisbane Church

God's Will Brisbane Church, following the lofty mission philosophy of being "a church owned by God," was established in Brisbane, Australia in February 2017. Over a short period, it has grown significantly with a dedicated congregation, striving to establish the next generation in faith through God's calling and mission within the immigrant community.

Due to current visa issues affecting the incumbent pastor, we are now seeking a new senior pastor.

[God's Will Brisbane Church is affiliated with the Churches of Christ in Queensland (www.cofc.com.au) and is a member church of the Korean High Purpose United Mission Church (" 높은뜻 연합 선교회, Representative: Pastor Moon Hee-gon / High Purpose Blue Church).]

The church has approximately 390 registered members, with an average Sunday attendance of around 260 members (including 4 education departments).

For more detailed information about the church, please visit our website at www.godswillau.org and view our YouTube channel "God's Will Brisbane Church."

Qualifications:

1) Minimum 3 years of pastoral experience post ordination (including associate pastor roles).

2) Graduate of a recognized evangelical theological seminary.

3) Eligible for an Australian visa application without disqualifying factors, with a clean record under social laws.

4) Willingness to understand and embrace the church's mission philosophy of "Korean High Purpose United mission, 높은뜻 연합 선교회" (refer to the website).

Required Documents:

** Submit via email to godswillbrissy@gmail.com

1) Resume

Personal statement (including personal growth, family background, faith testimony, ministry experience, motivation for applying, etc.)

***** Required for the second round of assessment.

2) Pastoral recommendation letter (from current or previous senior pastor)

3) Links to sermon videos (at least 2 videos from the last 6 months)

Application Deadline: Until July 31, 2024

Contact: Kim Young-wook (김영욱 집사),  Han Seon-i (한선이 집사)

For any inquiries regarding the church, ministry, or visa, please contact us via email.

We look forward to meeting and praying for a valuable pastor led by the guidance of the Lord.

Thank you.

OPERATOR
