Job description:

Pharmacist

We are currently looking for a Full Time Community focused Pharmacist with customer care at the heart to join our ever growing and well-loved family business in Glenfield Mall. Located on the North shore of Auckland. Plenty of eateries for exciting lunches/dinners or you can shop till you drop.

  • A strong, stable and supportive environment with over 190+ pharmacists working collaboratively in our business.
  • Care, guidance and mentorship from senior store managers and our leadership team
  • Competitive hourly rates +10% bonus rates for all weekend and evening shifts
  • New Zealand owned and operated - Future Partnership/ownership opportunities
  • Attractive staff discounts across all our brands and stores
  • Support with continuing education and certifications within applicable fields
  • Internal opportunities all over New Zealand with supported relocation
  • We pay for APC, PDA and all role/industry related training as well.
Job Description

In this fast paced, dynamic, multifaceted role where every day is different, you will be responsible for:

  • Day to day management of store, dispensary and team operations
  • Professional patient counselling and providing complete patient care solutions
  • Accurate and efficient dispensing of prescriptions using RxOne
  • Supervising dispensary staff
  • Dispensary inventory management and order processing
  • Supporting and developing new business strategies
Skills Attention to detail Dedicated work ethic and a strong team player Exceptional customer service and communication skills Solid business acumen and eye for perfection Strong leadership, interpersonal and organisational skills Certifications KAPS (Knowledge Assessment of Pharmaceutical Sciences) exam Annual Practicing Certificate (APC) Education Physical Requirements Repeat the same movements Stand for long periods of time Use hands to handle, control, or feel objects, tools, or controls Apply Now The successful applicant will be required to meet a satisfactory National Criminal History Check outcome.Interested in joining our team? Take the next step in your career with us. Apply today and explore limitless opportunities!

Optic Digital is a New Zealand owned and operated organisation of highly skilled business and technology professionals. Delivering tangible technology solutions for businesses across the country is what we do best. Our people are thought leaders, subject matter experts, confident and we deliver meaningful outcomes when partnering with our clients.

We are proud to offer tailored client care across a range of services - be it consulting, architecture, security, programme and project management, business analysis, testing, development or engineering.  So, there’s plenty of scopes for you to harness your breadth of experience in our industry. 

About The Role
Our client is looking for an experienced Desktop Support Engineer to work closely with an existing L1-2 Service Desk Engineer to meet the busy demands of the business. You will provide additional IT desktop support, assisting with a range of BAU support activities based out of their Auckland Head Office, with some WFH flexibility. This is a high demand role, so we need someone who is able to keep up with the pace of things, as well as get stuck in and get tasks done efficiently and effectively.

The role will see you providing second-tier technical troubleshooting, software installs, network and server support, application configurations, printer, phone and other onsite hardware issues and other desktop related fixes. This role is for an initial 12 month duration on an independent contract, with the potential of an additional 5 months following. 

About You
  • At least 4 years of prior professional experience supporting enterprise desktop environments 
  • Solid knowledge and experience in Microsoft Office 365 and Windows 10 support
  • Strong end-user support experience (deskside support)
  • Good communication skills - this will be key to your success!
  • Knowledge in Windows Servers 2012 and Active Directory and Networking
  • Project management skills and ITIL processes knowledge
  • Relevant Technical Qualifications in IT - e.g. Bachelor's Degree, Post Grad Diploma, National Certificates etc.  
You will be the go-to person when it comes to IT and desktop related support and be a point of escalation for the L1 engineer. You will provide face-to-face support for approx. 70 users in Auckland, and remote support across their Wellington and Christchurch teams. With this, we need someone who is approachable, friendly, and can comfortably juggle multiple requests at one time. You will possess the ability to handle all issues with a professional manner, as well as being able to deal with situations appropriately before they escalate.

About the Client
A multi-category consumer goods company who are looking to transform a global industry. They have a high awareness of their business responsibility and are working towards continued sustainability efforts, which underpins their business.

If this sounds like you APPLY NOW. 

Applications close 11.04.2022 and can only be submitted via Seek. 
   
Please note, only applicants that are eligible to work in New Zealand and can make themselves available for interviews in Auckland will be considered.

For any questions regarding these roles, please get in touch with Andrea on andrea.may@opticdigital.com.

Our Kohi Beach Store is looking for amazing personalities!

The Kohi Beach Store is iconic, located just across the beautiful Kohimarama beach, our community loved us, and we do too! 

We are looking for passionate, loud, and fun new team members to be part of our crazy and kind team.

If you:

  • Have a shining and beautiful personality, we are looking for someone loud and fun!
  • Are good with pressure - the Kohi Beach Store is always busy, and we like working with a small, tight team.
  • Have a strong work ethic, guests are your priority, and you are ready to help your co-workers
  • Have experience in a similar position, but if you have a CAN DO attitude, we want you!
  • Are flexible with your schedule, early start, and weekend work may be required

We offer:

  • Great remuneration
  • Discount in all our venues across Auckland and Tauranga
  • A supportive and professional environment, where you will have opportunities to grow

    If that sounds like you will be a good fit, please apply through seek.

Are you a rating whizz or an Accountant looking for a new challenge?

Then come and join a Finance team who love what they do and share a passion for numbers, knowledge, collaboration, cake, and continually striving to improve how we do things.

Working from our Richmond office and reporting to Finance Manager, this full-time position is responsible for providing financial strategy and policy advice on the management of Council's income from rates, fees, charges and any other income sources. You will also manage a small team responsible for the invoicing, collection of rates, water and other revenue sources.

You will be reliable, organised and pro-active, with a ‘can-do' attitude and curious nature. You'll bring with you a relevant tertiary qualification and at least six years' experience in financial services. You'll also have experience in data management, modelling and analysis, budget management and in the measurement and progressive reporting of business performance.

We're also looking for proven leadership, staff management and mentoring skills and a strong commitment to teamwork. You'll also ideally have previous rating management experience, and an understanding of the legislative environments of New Zealand local authorities. If you have the right attitude and approach we will train you in these areas if you don't.

In return, we offer a great team to work with, ongoing professional development, a variety of challenging and interesting work, a day off for your birthday, flexible working options, relocation assistance and a benefits package suited to your preferences. 

If this sounds like you, apply now!

You can view the full details, and submit your application online at careers.tasman.govt.nz/Vacancies or for more information contact the Human Resources Team on Ph. 03 543 8393.

Applications close 21 March 2021.

Company description:

At EY, you'll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are, with the global scale, support, inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we're counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better, too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself, and a better working world for all.



Job description:

Mā te kahukura ka rere te manu I With wings a bird will fly

At EY we believe that whoever you are, your uniqueness helps us stand apart.

We bring together extraordinary people, like you, to build a better working world.

Kei a koe te mana I The choice is yours

We have an exciting new opportunity for an full-time Entry Level Executive Assistant to join our dynamic, fast paced, friendly EA Team, in our Christchurch office. We are looking for someone who likes to be organised and efficient and has a strong drive to want to continue to build on their organisational skills and thrives working in a team environment.

As an executive assistant, your experience in business communication will help you to build effective relationships with important stakeholders and senior leaders. You'll have autonomy and clear responsibilities, working in our friendly, collaborative environment. Your talents will be respected and you'll be supported in developing the career path you choose.

Your key responsibilities

  • Diary and calendar management
  • Travel management both Domestic and International
  • Expense processing, adhering to firm deadlines
  • Meeting scheduling and logistics, including catering and meeting room reservations
  • Data entry for our in-house client relationship management database

 ABOUT THE ROLE:

This unique role is based within our (NZ Defence Force) customer’s structure at Papakura Military Camp. Your day to day instruction will come from within the Combat Service Support team, where you will be providing hands on technical expertise and advice for the vehicles and equipment that support NZDF activities across the Northern Region.


ABOUT YOU: 

To be successful in this role you will need to be motivated self-starter need who is comfortable managing your own workload.  We are also looking for:

•          Experienced Diesel Mechanic (minimum 3 years)

•          Trade qualified - National Certificate in Heavy Diesel Vehicles or equivalent qualification essential

•          Ability to work unsupervised

WHAT WE OFFER YOU:

At Lockheed Martin we aim to provide all our employees with a positive work environment and offer our employees an opportunity to learn and grow within the company.  From competitive salary packages and benefits to training and development opportunities we show our appreciation for your skills, ambitions and potential.

+ Purchasing an additional weeks leave

Other benefits working for Lockheed Martin include:

+ Up to 4% employer Kiwisaver contribution

+ A great employee recognition programme

+ Uniform

+ Free parking

SPECIAL REQUIREMENTS: 
To be considered for this role you must be able to obtain and maintain a Government Confidential Security Clearance. See minimum criteria below:

  • most preferably a NZ citizen who has resided continuously in this country for the last 5 years, OR
  • is a citizen of, and/or has resided continuously in one or more of the following countries for the last 5 years: either Australia, Canada, NZ, UK or the USA; and has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZSIS

You will also be required to undergo pre-employment activities including drug screening and vetting by NZ Police.

This role reports directly to the Mercury Bay Area Manager.

The role of Community Development Manager will lead the building of effective relationships with the Mercury Bay communities to enhance the Council's community empowerment model.  This means partnering Council with communities and stakeholder groups to support and implement programmes, projects and initiatives.  The work includes delivering excellent customer service, strategic programme and project planning, promoting economic development, project management and delivery, community board governance, financial planning management and  reporting and event facilitation.

job_title: Senior Maritime Weapons and Technical Intelligence Analyst
job_ad_details:
What you will do

The New Zealand Defence Force (NZDF) is looking for a technically-minded critical thinker who is able to make sense of global weapons-related military developments and communicate their analysis to senior decision makers, capability staff and war fighters. Senior weapons and technical intelligence (WTI) analysts are the New Zealand specialists on the technical characteristics, capabilities and limitations of selected weapon systems.

One full-time senior maritime WTI analyst position is now available at Devonport Naval Base in Auckland or HQ New Zealand Defence Force in Wellington.

As a senior maritime WTI analyst, you will:

  • Collect, research, analyse and disseminate maritime-related weapons and technical intelligence to the New Zealand Defence Force and other stakeholders, including international partners.
  • Collaborate closely with regional analysts, other NZDF agencies, NZ Government agencies, and allied WTI agencies.
  • Produce written reports and verbal briefs, and contribute to WTI databases.
  • Support NZDF deployed operations and future NZDF capabilities.
  • Grow your career and develop your networks.

What we need

Ideally we are seeking applicants who have previous experience as WTI analysts. However, as an alternative, you may be currently working elsewhere within the New Zealand or allied intelligence or defence communities.

Not only will you collaborate with other intelligence analysts to produce military capability-related intelligence, you will also have the opportunity to work alongside senior NZDF staff, government officials and allied military and civilian personnel.

As someone who has always leaned towards technical analysis, you enjoy working with technical data. This attribute, combined with exceptional communication skills, means you can easily explain technical matters to non-technical audiences, both verbally and in written form.

Working with sensitive information in a confidential environment isn't new to you, and integrity is one of your key values. You work well in an inter-disciplinary environment, and can operate effectively in a distributed, collaborative workspace, including with on-line systems. Previous operational military experience will be an advantage.

There are some specific job requirements which you must be able to meet, including being able to travel domestically and overseas, possibly at short notice and including into operational theatres.

You must be able to obtain and retain an NZDF TSS-level security clearance. This means you will need to be a New Zealand citizen, or hold citizenship in the United States, Canada, the United Kingdom or Australia. A tertiary qualification in a relevant scientific, technological, engineering or mathematical (STEM) discipline, and/or knowledge and experience with relevant weapon systems, is necessary.

Who we are

The Weapons and Technical Intelligence branch of New Zealand Defence Intelligence produces all-source WTI assessments relating to selected weapon systems that may pose a current or future military threat to the NZDF and allied partners.

Every hour of every day, 365 days of the year, the New Zealand Defence Force is contributing to the defence, security and well-being of Aotearoa / New Zealand. As a modern, professional military, it is our goal to maintain well trained, equipped and disciplined armed forces that can react to crises at short notice.

Why Us

Great opportunity to support our deployed operations. Grow and develop your career as a senior analyst. Check out the great benefits for you and your family when you join NZDF!

How to Apply

All short-listed and New Zealand-based applicants will be required to attend an assessment day, an interview, and psychological testing. International applicants will be assessed remotely. More detail will be provided to those applicants that are short-listed.

To view the Position Description and to 'Apply Online', please use the links on this page. For further information, please use the Contact Us option to send an email quoting NZDF 1812003.

Applications close at 5pm on Wednesday 16 January 2019.

Please note: Applicants must be legally entitled to work in New Zealand and be able to obtain and maintain the required level of NZ Government security clearance for the position. The minimum citizenship and residency criteria for security clearances to be granted by the New Zealand Defence Force are as follows:

Higher Level Security Clearance

  • Most preferably a NZ citizen, who has resided in this country continuously for at least the last ten years, OR
  • A citizen of, and/or has resided continuously in, one or more of the following countries for the last ten years: Australia, Canada, NZ, the United Kingdom (UK) or the United States of America (USA); and has a background history that is verifiable and can be assessed as appropriate by the NZ Security Intelligence Service (NZSIS) towards a recommendation of suitability for a security clearance at this level.

If you do not meet these minimum criteria, we will not be able to accept your application.

Machine learning and te reo

We need an experienced data scientist who is skilled in the application of machine learning methods to natural language problems. Knowledge of tikanga and te reo Māori or other Polynesian languages is preferred.

About the role

We are looking for someone with experience relevant to the development of:

  • speech recognition for te reo Māori using Mozilla Deep Speech
  • speech synthesis for te reo Māori
  • models of natural language understanding
  • speech recognition in multilingual contexts.

The work is part of the Papa Reo project, which aims to use machine learning methods to develop digital tools for te reo Māori, and to support indigenous communities globally in revitalising their languages. The work will require development of machine learning models and their integration into operational systems. The current focus is on automatic speech recognition (using Mozilla Deep Speech) and on voice synthesis. It is anticipated that the scope will widen to include models of natural language understanding (e.g., to respond to queries in te reo Māori), and multilingual contexts (e.g., a mix of te reo Māori and New Zealand English).

Papa Reo is led by Te Hiku Media, in collaboration with Dragonfly Data Science, the Mozilla machine learning team, and university researchers. The seven-year programme is funded by the New Zealand Ministry of Business, Innovation & Employment’s Strategic Science Investment Fund, which aims to increase New Zealand’s data science capability.

This is a unique opportunity to join a multi-organisational team that is led by Māori, is answerable to the community, and that includes software developers, PhD students, linguists, and academic researchers. This role will include collaboration and mentoring of junior researchers, and publication in primary literature. There is also the opportunity to become involved with Dragonfly’s broader work in the area of natural language processing.

This role is offered as a permanent position, with salary depending on experience. The role is based in New Zealand. Dragonfly has an office in Wellington, and staff in Auckland who are working on Papa Reo. There is the potential to work from home, anywhere in New Zealand.

To apply for this position, please send a cover letter and a curriculum vitae to Edward Abraham (edward@dragonfly.co.nz). International applicants are asked to check their visa eligibility on the Immigration New Zealand website. Because of COVID-19, there is currently limited immigration to New Zealand, however highly-qualified applicants may be eligible to enter New Zealand under the "other critical worker" category.

Applications close at 12pm, Monday August 17, 2020.

 

About Dragonfly Data Science

Dragonfly Data Science is a small company engaged in a wide range of data science projects across different sectors. Our work involves different aspects of data science, from the collection of data, data preparation and validation, statistical analysis, through to communicating results to a wide range of audiences.

As a company, we aim to be at the cutting edge of data science practice, and this focus is evident in our increasingly diverse portfolio of projects. We are committed to following principles of reproducible research, applying complex data analysis methods, such as Bayesian modelling and neural network approaches. Our commitment includes the production of high-quality outputs in the form of scientific reports and publications, presentations and interactive data visualisations.

We are an inclusive and friendly company, focused on collaboration and innovation. We strive to provide a positive and supportive work environment.

Our purpose

Here at Datacom we connect people and technology in order to solve challenges, create opportunities and discover new possibilities for the communities we live in

About the Role

The main role of a Implementation Consultant is to assist in implementation projects for new and existing Datacom PaySystem clients for Payroll, Employee Self-Service, HRIS, Reporting and integration to third party applications. Responsibilities

Why you want to join us

Our brand and reputation depend on ‘proving the promise’ and we aspire to be the trusted advisor for our customers across Government and the private sector from enterprise scale to regional business. We offer our staff a competitive salary package, fantastic perks and benefits like healthcare, life insurance, discounts at local retailers and a supportive, flexible working environment. If you want to join a company making a difference, apply now!

This is a key role where you will manage the end-to-end sales transactions and ensure all our customer orders are fulfilled. You will manage customers to ensure satisfactory completion of each sales transaction including the China markets.

The main responsibilities of this role include..

  • Proactively manage customer payments to ensure compliance with payment terms and escalation of issues where needed

  • Manage the end-to-end sales order transactions and ensure a high level of customer satisfaction

If you are switched on, love building strong relationships and have previous experience in a customer facing role then we want to hear from you!

Skills and Experience 

To be considered for this role will require …

  • intuitiveness to be able to quickly assess situations and 
  • decisively/effectively act

About the assignment

Assist Ministry of Justice staff to improve monitoring, cataloguing and archiving procedures to effectively manage national legal documentation and library resources.

The Adviser will work closely with Supreme Court staff to develop organised systems for record appraisal, sorting and preservation, and ensure procedures meet the requirements of Freedom of Information Act and Data Protection. This will include an initial assessment of archiving needs for court records and library resources, as well as, systems for their retention and disposal.

Overall, the Adviser will support staff to overcome current records management challenges, particularly regarding access and retrieval, by developing procedure manuals for staff, and providing training to strengthen their records management skills.

VSA is looking for a volunteer with:

  • A qualification in records management or other relevant discipline
  • Proven track record in professional records management
  • At least five years' experience with cataloguing library and/or archive resources
  • Experience in appraisal of historical material
  • Experience training others in records management

This is a 1-year assignment based in Nuku'alofa.

About volunteering with VSA

VSA is New Zealand's largest and most experienced volunteering agency working in international development. 

We cover living allowances, accommodation and utilities. Travel, visas, insurance and medical costs are organised and funded by VSA.

Volunteers must be a NZ citizen or permanent resident.

If current VSA assignments don't suit your skills and experience you can register your interest with us and we'll let you know when something in your field is available.

How to apply

To visit this job profile on our website and download an assignment description please click 'apply for this job' below.

Our Ecology & Water Science team is heavily involved in the Te Ara o Te Ata: Mt Messenger Bypass project near New Plymouth and we are looking for an experienced Ecologist to join the project team. We are seeking an ecologist with a minimum of 2 years professional experience across the fields of terrestrial or freshwater ecology. Prior experience working on infrastructure projects would be ideal.

You'll be working on a challenging and exciting project, be involved in a diverse fieldwork programme and work with a great team of technical specialists. You will have the opportunity to work with threatened NZ fauna such as bats, birds (including kiwi), invertebrates, lizards and freshwater fish. You will specifically be involved in:

  • A range of scientific and ecological services and applications in a variety of terrestrial and freshwater ecosystems to support construction of the SH3 Mt Messenger bypass
  • Terrestrial habitat assessments
  • Weed + pest surveys and monitoring
  • Terrestrial fauna surveys and monitoring (bats, birds (including kiwi), invertebrates and lizards)
  • Species relocation and translocation
  • Freshwater surveys and monitoring
  • Supervision of vegetation clearance activities
  • Development and implementation of Ecological Management and Monitoring Plans
  • Planning and co-ordinating fieldwork activities in collaboration with the Te Ara o Te Ata construction team, with support from the project Ecology Team Leader, Ecology Field Operations Coordinator and a large team of other ecologists
  • Report writing, including preparation of technical reports, compliance reports, ecological management plans and assessment of ecological effects reports
  • Data collection, management and information presentation
  • Liaison with T+T staff, Council personnel and DOC representatives
  • Engagement with mana whenua and incorporation of Mātauranga Māori into project work
  • Liaison with Te Ara o Te Ata Alliance staff, working within a multi-disciplinary team and attendance at team meetings

This full-time, largely field-based permanent position will commence from July 2024 and will be based at the Mt Messenger project office in between Uruti and Tongapōrutu, Taranaki.

Kei te whakapono mātou ki tō whanaketanga | We want to develop you

We will provide you with training and mentoring, and we also promote an open culture where innovation and lateral thinking is encouraged. Tonkin + Taylor is a company where you can feel comfortable asking others for advice and where people are equally willing to listen to your ideas.

Working at T+T and Te Ara o Te Ata Mt Messenger Alliance provides a rich learning environment for you to grow and develop every day. You're in the driver's seat when it comes to your learning, and there are heaps of opportunities to tap into a wealth of knowledge, expertise and formal development opportunities.

Nā tōu rourou | What you'll bring

  • A minimum of a Bachelors degree in Ecology, Zoology, Botany or closely related discipline, MSc desirable
  • A minimum 2 years' relevant professional work experience in a consulting, regulatory and / or research environment
  • Previous experience working on infrastructure projects and implementing ecological management aspects preferred, but not essential
  • Experience preparing technical ecology reports, including compliance reports
  • Experience collecting a range of ecological data, familiarity with ecological survey techniques, data management and record keeping
  • GIS skills and digital mapping competencies (preferred)
  • Excellent communication skills and able to confidently communicate with a range of parties including Council, DOC and local Iwi representatives
  • Be backcountry competent and comfortable working in remote and rough terrain
  • Be adaptable and flexible to working hours - evening and dawn work expected due to the nature of the work
  • Be Health and Safety conscious - you will also be expected to undertake and pass drug tests
  • Solution focused with problem solving skills, high attention to detail and professional initiative
  • Full NZ drivers licence (preferred)
  • Electrofishing certification (preferred)

Ngā Hua | Our benefits

  • Exposure to a variety of professional experts and projects; T+T are involved in a number of large-scale alliance projects, as well as smaller community focused projects
  • A highly supportive team environment where you are encouraged to pave your own career path that caters to your own personal pathway
  • Professional memberships and continued education support
  • Internal training programs
  • Mentoring programs
  • $750 annual wellbeing allowance and wellbeing programme
  • Additional support provided should you need to relocate to take up this opportunity

Mō tō mātou āhuatanga | Who we are

Tonkin + Taylor is New Zealand's leading engineering and environmental consultancy, renowned for our technical excellence in solving complex challenges. We are proudly a New Zealand, employee-owned company and our collective mission is to create and sustain a better world.

At T+T, we strongly believe that it's our people that keep our clients coming back. Our people are known for delivering award-winning solutions, working collaboratively, and delivering exceptional outcomes for our clients. They are our greatest asset, and we invest in their development, well-being, and their career aspirations.

We are proud to have a diverse Ecology + Water Science consulting team in New Zealand with a range of technical specialists, and with that comes great collaboration and opportunities for our staff!

Toroa tā mātou pae tukutuku mō ētehi atu kōrero | For more information, check out our website

APPLY NOW! Or for further information on T+T, go to: http://www.tonkintaylor.co.nz. T+T is not only a place to work - it's a place where your work will make a difference.

'Everyone Matters' is one of our three core values at T+T, and we are committed to attracting and retaining a diverse workforce who foster inclusion, participation, and equal opportunity.

We are proud to be an Immigration New Zealand Accredited Employer, a member of Diversity Works, and Partners of TupuToa and Pūhoro STEMM Academy. We particularly encourage speakers of Te Reo Māori or Pacific languages to apply.

T+T are proud to be part of the Rainbow Tick Whānau and welcome applicants from rainbow communities.

Are you a tech savvy digital specialist, with a deep understanding of Ecommerce? Then we have the opportunity for you!

First, a little about us:

We build & acquire top performing brands.

Founded in 2009, Groovy began as a boutique performance marketing agency. 

In 2018 we diversified, and started acquiring & investing in our own retail & e-commerce brands, which has now become our core focus.

Our small but effective team is made up of designers, developers, marketing specialists, and all-round good people.

Our brands span across the Health & Nutrition (Sportsfuel, Nothing Naughty, Clean Nutrition, Vitally), Entertainment (Game Kings) and SAAS (Shopify Apps) categories.

Learn more about us at https://www.groovy.group.

What we're looking for:

As our business grows, the need for a full time Ecommerce Manager has emerged. This role has traditionally been taken care of by the CEO in conjunction with members of the marketing team.

In this role your core responsibility will be growing and improving the ecommerce experience for our businesses, as well as becoming our internal expert on all key ecommerce / digital platforms.

Activities will include:

  • Managing, monitoring, and improving the activity and performance of our ecommerce sites
  • Taking ownership of all our ecommerce activity with the objective of considerably increasing profit
  • Day to day ecommerce site management, product and promotion management, updating site content in keeping with brand standards
  • Identifying, planning, and implementing new e-commerce features and site enhancements, that improve the customer experience
  • Implementing an A|B testing approach to gain greater insight into website strategies and tactics

While not a requirement, our ideal candidate would have:

  • Experience with Shopify
  • 2+ years experience in related roles
  • Strong analytical, technical troubleshooting and problem-solving skills
  • Experience using digital analytics/intelligence tools including Google Analytics and Google Tag Manager
  • An understanding of Web Development, API's, and how different digital platforms integrate and work together
  • Knowledge of paid and organic search and paid social media
  • Understanding of email automation
  • A high degree of commercial acumen
  • Good understanding of ecommerce & digital marketing principles
  • Passion for putting the customer and their experience first in all decisions
  • Excellent communication skills

You'll work closely with all team members, from marketers & product managers to web developers & other creatives.

Our Ecommerce stack includes: Shopify, Klaviyo, Algolia, Prismic, Gorgias, Google Ads, Google Tag Manager, Google Analytics, and more.

Culture fit is important.

We could try and sell you on our modern office, stocked with unlimited cafe quality coffee, hang out area with bean bags, and gaming consoles, but the truth is culture is more than just perks & benefits. We're a family at Groovy. We spend a lot of time together, whether it's around the lunch table, working on our latest marketing campaigns, or out at the pub quiz on Thursday nights.

Could you see yourself at Groovy?

1. First apply via Seek with a resume in pdf format so we can keep track of all applications. Please share your past experience related to Ecommerce! That's the best way to stand out.

AND

2. Contact Alex by emailing alex@groovy.group to discuss this job. Tell me about yourself, share some of your experience, and explain why we need you on the team.

I look forward to hearing from you!

This is a varied role where no two days are the same. You will be responsible for maintaining our delivery vehicle to a high standard, loading and unloading the vehicle safely and ensuring that our products are delivered onsite to our customers around the greater Wellington area in a professional, timely and safe manner.

From time to time you will also be helping out in our warehouse receiving inwards goods, picking and packing orders and putting stock away or helping out on our trade counter serving customers and providing sales service and support.

We have a lot going on at once so we are looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced environment but can remain calm under pressure and work well with the team to achieve our goals.

To be successful in this role you will need to hold a full Class 1 NZ Drivers Licence, have excellent organisation skills and enjoy contributing to a successful team. Safe work practices are a must and you will need to physically fit as there is manual and heavy lifting involved. An F endorsed forklift licence would also beneficial.

Hours are Monday to Friday 7.30am – 5.00pm with a rostered Saturday morning.

You’ll be joining a well-respected business offering a range of benefits and opportunities for career advancement that come with being part of Fletcher Building. Please apply online at fbcareers.com and quote reference 10021838.

Our Purpose: What We're Here For

When you work with the Canterbury District Health Board, you're part of something very special. We're world leaders in the delivery of integrated health care, and we're always striving to Make It Better. From the carers on the front line working directly with patients and communities, to our talented support teams who enable that care, we plan, fund and deliver health services to the almost 600,000 New Zealanders that live in the Canterbury region. And we're all about putting people at the heart of everything we do.

Our Culture: What Matters To Us

Ko Te Whatu Manawa Tangata
Putting people at the heart of all we do

For us to continue putting our communities at the centre of our health system, we're putting our own people at the centre of everything we do. Because health is ultimately all about people. What's important around here is the way we care for and respect others, the responsibility that all our people take for delivering outcomes, and that we go about our work with integrity in all we do.

What matters to us is doing the right thing, valuing everyone, and being and staying well ourselves so we can care for our community.

The Role: What This Opportunity's All About

We are looking for a motivated individual to join our Pharmacy Distribution team. This role will see you monitoring supply and delivery of pharmaceuticals to wards and departments, delivering/processing inward goods to the pharmacy and general stock management and housekeeping duties. There is also an aspect of data entry to this role.

You will need to be flexible, enthusiastic and able to prioritise a substantial workload to meet deadlines. This role requires interaction with our multi-disciplinary team so an ability to relate to different people is important.

Site rotations may include Christchurch, Burwood and Hillmorton Hospitals. This is a full-time (1 FTE) permanent position.

Skills and experience:

  • You will be walking long distances and lifting heavy cartons so physical fitness is key
  • Previous hospital or pharmacy work would be an advantage

Belonging Here: Becoming Part of Our Story

Our people enjoy access to a fantastic benefits scheme, flexible working arrangements and a genuine and ongoing focus on career development.

We hope you'll seriously consider joining us, but if this isn't a good fit for you, please share the opportunity with your personal networks and help us find our next rock star!

If this particular role isn't for you, we do have other similar opportunities - please look on our careers page or give us a call to discuss.

Phone: 03 3377961

job_title: Food Process Technologist - Volunteering opportunity in PNG
job_ad_details:
Change your scene and become a VSA Volunteer and share your experience, knowledge, and skills to transform the lives of many. Work with our partner organisation to create a fair future for all. 
 
VSA will organise and fund, flights, visas, insurance, accommodation, living allowance and utilities while on assignment. 

Please note VSA Volunteers must be a NZ citizen or permanent resident. 

Volunteering with VSA 
 
Volunteer Service Abroad (VSA) is not your typical volunteering agency, we are committed to building sustainable communities across the Pacific. If you’re an experienced Food Process Technologist, looking for an extraordinary overseas experience in the Pacific to build into your field of expertise – working collaboratively with the Department of Agriculture and Livestock of PNG, then read on, as we have an exciting opportunity in store for you!
 
Our Partner Organisation - Department of Agriculture and Livestock (DAL)

The Department of Agriculture and Livestock (DAL) of Papua New Guinea (PNG) is the national institution responsible for the oversight and development of the country's agriculture and livestock sectors. As the backbone of PNG’s economy, agriculture supports the livelihoods of a significant portion of the population and is critical to the nation’s goals for inclusive, sustainable economic growth and food security. DAL plays a pivotal role in shaping the sector’s future by providing policy advice, technical and administrative support, and strategic leadership. 

The Assignment

As Food Process Technologist you will equip and support food processors and communities with essential skills and knowledge to transform raw agricultural produce into safe, marketable products. You will provide technical expertise and support in order to strengthen food safety standards and develop safe, efficient, and sustainable practices in small-scale food processing. You will assess the current state of small-scale food processing technology, identify opportunities for improvement, and deliver targeted technical guidance to meet the specific needs of small-scale food processors, ultimately helping to strengthen standards for food safety.

The Volunteer

Are you someone who wants to make a difference, have a sense of adventure and like the challenge of being outside your comfort zone?  VSA Volunteers are technical experts who impart their skills and knowledge to the local community. You will need to be flexible, adaptable, resourceful, resilient with a passion for Aotearoa and the wider Pacific community.

We're looking for a volunteer with the following:
  • A tertiary qualification in food science, food technology, or a related field.
  • Proven expertise and experience in small-scale food processing technology, with knowledge of equipment, processing techniques, and quality control measures.
  • Strong knowledge of food safety regulations and standards.
  • Demonstrated experience in conducting assessments, developing technical guidance, and providing capacity-strengthening support.
  • Ability to mentor, coach, and support the professional development of others
The Country

Most people living in Papua New Guinea (PNG) are Melanesian, but some are Micronesian or Polynesian. PNG has over 800 known languages although there are three official languages: Tok Pisin, English, and Hiri Motu. Numerous indigenous languages are still used by people from a society that ranges from traditional village-based life to modern urban living.

Underlying the Papua New Guinean culture is the wantok system. Wantok, or ‘one talk’, refers to the people who speak your language or your extended family/clan; a Papua New Guinean’s primary loyalty will be to their wantok.
  
The country is predominately Christian, with indigenous faith and spirituality still important to many locals.
  
The people of Papua New Guinea are famously warm and hospitable and the isolated mountain ranges are often home to unique fauna and flora found nowhere else in the world.
  

Apply Now!

Apply for this amazing opportunity through our website. For more information on this assignment, email volunteer@vsa.org.nz.


To review the full assignment description please copy and paste the below link into your browser: https://vsa.org.nz/assets/Assignment-Descriptions-2019-2020/2024/November-2024/Small-scale-Food-Processing-Technology-Advisor-PNG-42084-1.pdf

If you are on the VSA website, please click on the download assignment description tab above.

job_title: Graduate Engineer - Aeronautical Design and Certification.
job_ad_details:
Flight Structures is independently NZ owned and operated, we are based in the Waikato - but work across NZ and internationally.

We hold both Part 146 and Part 148 Certificates from the Civil Aviation Authority of NZ. We work across aerospace from design, certification, manufacturing and engineering analysis from our Hamilton base. We achieve Aviation Excellence. Plane and Simple.

The focus of this position is to provide engineering analysis and design services to clients of Flight Structures.  Key responsibilities in this role are to:

  • Prepare documentation, reports and manuals to demonstrate compliance of modifications with CAA and FAA regulations;
  • Conduct structural and systems analysis;
  • Design modifications to aircraft and helicopters;
  • Prepare structural, systems, and flight test schedules.

You will have a BE (Mechanical, Aeronautical or equivalent) with excellent analytical and drawing/modelling skills.  In addition you will have strong report writing ability, and the ability to manage your time to meet clients' deadlines. We take pride in our team work - you will need to be able to work within small multi functional project teams.  A demonstrated interest in aviation will help your application.

This position would suit a new graduate who is looking to start their career in aviation.  We offer a flexible working environment, the opportunity to learn off experts and the chance to see aircraft out the window daily.

Position to start Summer 2024/25 (Date to be negotiated)

For more information on what we do please refer to:

https://www.flightstructures.co.nz/company-brochure

To apply please send a cover letter and CV via Seek.  

Applications close 30th June - the team reviewing applications will be reviewing all applications at the closing date and confirm receipt and shortlisting within a week of closing.

First, here’s a little about us:

Isthmus is one of New Zealand’s leaders in pioneering the design of culturally meaningful, enduring, healthy and inspiring environments.

Our award-winning design studio has been going strong for over 28 years, and is unique because it exists at the intersection of architecture, landscape architecture and urban design. We have big aspirations to take our architecture and integrated design practice to new heights, and we’re embarking on a phase of serious growth. You’ll get a unique opportunity to help us build this within a well-established, exceptional environment.

It means more inspiring projects, the chance to collaborate and lots of excitement. This way of working is an expression of our design philosophy of “no boundaries”. We design across disciplines, allowing the project to be shaped by different perspectives, collective intelligence, and the diverse design skills of our creative team in order to create places that are more enduring, meaningful and fit-for-purpose.

We have a number of new and exciting projects happening in delivering residential, public, mixed-used and commercial buildings. Projects that satisfy our passion for design that integrates into the fabric of the urban environment. We have openings in our Auckland and Wellington studios and we’re looking for people to join us who think differently – questioning old ways of doing things and opening discussions that can lead to new possibilities
 
What it’s like to work at Isthmus:
  • You’ll join a studio that’s design-led first and foremost – but with commercial savvy.  
  • Personal growth is more important here than titles and labels.You’ll get the encouragement to stretch your abilities and fast-track your career beyond old-school hierarchies.  
  • You won’t be pigeon-holed, instead you’ll work across a diversity of inspiring, complex projects in an environment where your strengths and interests will be nurtured.  
  • You’ll find we have a big focus on helping you continue to learn and develop. We’ll even contribute towards the costs of professional development, conferences and institute membership.  
  • Work/life balance is encouraged and you’ll be offered things like flexible work hours, time in lieu, and our very own public holiday ‘Matariki’ – a day off and a special dinner we throw for the whole team and whanau.  
  • You’ll enjoy a special culture that includes lots of little extras like bike parks, fruit deliveries, Friday after work drinks, and dinner if you’re working late – to show our appreciation to you.
Here’s the role:

Working across a diverse range of new projects, you’ll be delivering residential, mixed-use and public buildings integrated into the fabric of the urban environment. You’ll be an important contributor within our award-winning studio as you deliver pioneering, impactful solutions that enrich places and people.

In the senior role the heart of your job as a leader in our business will be helping to foster the talent of others and leading the way on innovative integrated design solutions. You’ll oversee project teams and expertly manage projects, carefully overseeing scope, deliverables, design quality and profitability.  You’ll also guide strong client relationships and contribute to winning new and exciting work.

The next Architects to join Isthmus will have:
  • Experience across multi-unit residential, commercial and mixed use projects
  • The ability to translate innovative design into practical solutions 
  • An understanding of NZ building codes and relevant standards
  • A drive for excellence, innovation, and to do things differently
  • A proactive attitude: you’ll grab opportunities to chart your own course
  • Excitement about working in shades of grey and the opportunity to collaborate within our “no boundaries” design environment
  • A hunger to join us on a journey, contributing to the continued growth of our design practice
If you’ve got a fresh approach to design and are ready to create some of New Zealand’s best designed places, send us your CV with a portfolio of the work you’re most proud of. Learn more about us and our current vacancies or check out some of our work at www.isthmus.co.nz 

Ref: 788

Diverse projects across residential, public, mixed-used and commercial Join us for the journey as we embark on exciting phase of growth Grow a career with no boundaries

Clearwater Golf Club is one of New Zealand's premier golf facilities. The club has hosted 7 NZPGA Championships, 2 New Zealand Opens and 5 NZ Women's Opens since opening in 2002.

Peppers Cradle Mountain Lodge is an award winning iconic property based in Tasmania on the doorstep of the Cradle Mountain Lake St Clair National Park. The Lodge features 86 Cabins, Restaurant, Conference and Wedding facilities, Tavern Bar and Bistro, Boutique and Spa. The food at Peppers Cradle Mountain Lodge is simply exquisite; with freshly prepared menus using the very finest local ingredients and Tasmanian produce.

This is an exciting opportunity to join a successful growing company, with opportunities for personal development and career advancement

$85,000 - $109,999

About Plexure 

Imagine if your shopping experience was designed specifically for you? This is what we do at Plexure! Using our intelligent product with over 220 million users, we harness the power of data to create magical moments for our customers and their consumers. 

Plexure is a dual ASX and NZX listed company with a presence in over 60 countries. We have all the fun aspects of a fast-paced start up, but with the legs of a more established organisation. We work with some well-known household brands, who have trusted us to help them reach their customers on a personalised level. We have people in the UK, US, and Japan- things never stop at Plexure! 

Why are we hiring? 

We are in growth mode! As we look to bring on new customers and explore new opportunities, we need more people to join us on our journey and help build out our product. We are going places, so come and invest your career in Plexure- we are open to engineers at all levels! 

What will you be doing? 

Data underpins our product capabilities, and good quality data is fundamental to the success of our customers. We need great data minds to help us expand our data warehouse with clean data, ready for analysis, while helping us build systems and processes to document our data for internal and external users. 

You will be involved in shaping our vision for quality data and enabling our organisation to scale to new heights. You’ll collaborate with data engineers on projects and advocate for and emphasize the business value of applications.  Help us innovate and change so that we are always striving to be better, more efficient, and optimal. Enjoy working on a cloud first platform with the latest technology stack. 

What are we looking for? 

Our engineering team has one thing in common- we all love technology. We are all driven by the latest and greatest and strive to keep up to date with all the changes that are thrown our way. We look for relevant experience, and a hunger to learn and develop. We look for the future leaders in the tech world, so we can hone and shape them, and we strive to promote from within.  

We have a diverse data ecosystem, our data services run across AWS and Azure clouds. We use tools like Prefect Cloud and Spark to build our pipelines. Python and SQL power most of our data products, to avoid manual work we rely heavily on strong DevOps practices for our CI/CD pipelines and infrastructure.  

What is the team like? 

We love our pool table! It's a common tool to destress or get to know a new Plexurite. We have regular social club activities, and it's not unusual to see a few of us heading out to coffee or lunch together. Everything we do has a remote element to it, so if you are working from home that day, you are still involved! We recognise that people are people, and we have lives outside of work, so there is flexibility around your life and family.  

What is in it for you? 

  • Fully funded private health insurance (your wellbeing is key at Plexure)  
  • Birthday leave – woo!  
  • Flexible working and remote working 
  • Joining an organisation where innovation is at the heart of what we do. 
  • Career and upskilling initiatives in place so you can be your best self. 
  • Wellness initiatives (Employee Assistance Programme and annual flu shots available)  
  • FOOD. We love food so at Plexure there’s an endless supply of soft drinks, daily 3pm snacks, Friday drinks and monthly morning teas.  
  • An active social club (work hard, play hard) 

What if you're not based in Auckland? 

Great news! If you're the right fit for us, we will not let your location stop us from bringing you onboard! We welcome candidates from all over New Zealand (as long as you have the right working rights) and we have a travel allowance to support your remote working set up and travel to/from Auckland. If you can commit to regular visits to Auckland, we will consider your application. Remember, we are an accredited employer as well!

  • Financial management of the facility (monthly & annual budgeting & reporting)

About the successful candidate:
  

We are looking for an experienced professional with a proven track record of working in a management and leadership role within the health and disability sector. A commitment to the values of Presbyterian Support & the total well being of aged care residents is critical.


The successful applicant will hold a current annual practising certificate with the Nursing Council of New Zealand.


As the position is based in Balclutha, South Otago we are also looking for someone committed to the community & lifestyle the area has to offer.

  
About the process:
If you have any questions on the position please don’t hesitate to contact Andrew from Platinum Recruitment on 0277 528 465 or andrew@platinumrecruitment.co.nz for a confidential discussion.

A full position description is available to be reviewed upon request.

The Manager will be on the Enliven Management Team and will have the opportunity to contribute at both a operational and strategic level to ongoing service development. There will be ongoing support for professional development and post graduate study for the successful candidate.


If you already know enough to know this is the right role for you in your career please APPLY NOW!

Project Manager

Our client is a leading builder that specializes in the construction of high-rise buildings with a minimum value of $30 million. Their projects are known for their exceptional quality, innovative designs, and timely completion. To continue their growth and success, they are seeking an experienced and dynamic project manager to join the team.

Responsibilities:

  • Manage the entire project lifecycle, including planning, scheduling, budgeting, and execution of high-rise building projects.
  • Collaborate with architects, engineers, contractors, and other stakeholders to ensure project goals are achieved.
  • Manage project timelines, budgets, and resources to ensure project completion on time and within budget.
  • Coordinate the procurement of materials and equipment necessary for the successful execution of the project.
  • Ensure compliance with all relevant building codes, safety regulations, and other legal requirements.
  • Communicate project status and progress to senior management and other stakeholders.

Requirements:

  • Bachelor's degree in construction management, civil engineering, or a related field.
  • Trade Certificate Ideal.
  • At least 5 years of experience as a project manager in the construction of high-rise buildings with a minimum value of $30 million and at least 6 levels.
  • Proven ability to manage large, complex construction projects from start to finish.
  • Excellent leadership, communication, and problem-solving skills.
  • Familiarity with project management software and tools, including scheduling, budgeting, and resource management software.

Our client offers a competitive salary and benefits package. If you are a talented and motivated project manager with a passion for construction and a track record of success, we encourage you to apply.

To apply, please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your qualifications and experience. We look forward to hearing from you. For more information contact McKensie Hooper on 022 658 9267 or mhooper@marblegroup.co.nz.

Business Support Coordinator

Seaview, Wellington

ECL Group Fuel Systems specialise in providing a range of services to the petroleum industry.   
 
Our Business Support coordinators play a key role in the seamless delivery of agreed services to our customers. 
 
In this role you will be tasked with the scheduling of planned and reactive work for our Service Technicians and the review and approval of completed jobs.
 
Full training will be provided and you will have the backing of our close knit and experienced team.

The core duties of the position are:
  • Data entry, cleansing and administration of invoicing and programmed maintenance tasks
  • Review and approval of completed work for invoicing
  • Ensure all jobs are accurately updated with relevant information including job management and escalation steps
  • Preparation and dispatch of daily schedules, working closely with Service Managers to ensure correct skill allocation and effective use of resource
This role will best suit someone with the following skills and experience:
  • Possess energy, enthusiasm and thrives under pressure
  • Have well developed analytical and critical thinking skills with the ability to identify trends and opportunities for improvement
  • Possess excellent relationship management skills with the ability to relate to a wide range of internal and external stakeholders
  • Have clear and concise written and verbal communication skills
  • Has a good head for working with numbers
  • Previous experience in a data entry, invoicing, billing, logistics, planning or job management (scheduling) role

In return for your skills and experience we offer a dynamic role where there will be plenty of opportunity for you to learn and grow.

This will allow you to register your details and submit your application for this vacancy.  Alternatively for further information please contact Wendy on 021 782 103.

At Lion, we enrich our world everyday by championing sociability and helping people to live well. We're all about making life's sociable moments that little bit more special.

We have an exciting opportunity for a highly skilled individual to join the team as Category Analyst. This role reports to our Senior Category Manager and is based at our Freemans Bay office in Auckland and flexibly from home.

As our Category Analyst you will support the delivery of defining where we play and how we realise value by providing actionable category & channel insights to drive category growth. You will have the primary responsibility for data management in the team, owning the day to day interactions with our key data suppliers, and setting up the governance & reporting of category insights ensuring delivery across appropriate stakeholders. This role will work in an agile way, flexing across all categories and channels.

We're looking for someone with highly developed analytical skills, has experience working with shopper data, with Nielsen data and skilled in space management. You will need to have a good understanding of the market and industry dynamics, applying this knowledge to create actionable insights. If you're naturally curious and enjoy uncovering the root cause of performance issues then this could be the perfect opportunity for you.

When you join Lion, every day you'll be challenged to do better, but you'll be equally encouraged to achieve balance in your personal life. In an environment where we all feel supported at work, and cared for personally, we've got every reason to love coming to work.

Start a conversation with us today!

A background in the industry would be advantageous. This integral role will see you reporting to and working closely with the Sales & Operations Team. In addition, you will be accountable for developing new business, servicing the company's existing client base, and establishing long-term business relationships at all levels.

Ashlee

Are you passionate about connecting people with New Zealand's taonga?  Do you know how to get others engaged and active in supporting conservation, restoration and kaitiakitanga?  Are you comfortable working within the confines of statutory processes and systems?  Are you able to see the big picture and find innovative, practical solutions?

If that sounds like you, this might just be your dream job!

 

The Department of Conservation is seeking applicants for the position of Ranger, Community; Kaitiaki, Āo Hāpori based in Palmerston North.  This is an exciting opportunity to become part of a strong and hardworking team, and support conservation growth in the Manawatu District alongside our Treaty partners and community.

 

Core components of this role include:

  • Coordinating local involvement in statutory processes, such as Statutory Land Management, RMA, and the administration of concessions and Wildlife Act permits;
  • Overseeing community-led conservation projects on public conservation land;
  • Providing support for landscape scale conservation initiatives in our communities;
  • Managing relationships with a wide range of stakeholders;
  • Supporting whānau, hapū and iwi in kaitiakitanga;
  • Supporting the Manawatu Operations District to deliver high quality conservation outcomes.

 

The ideal applicant will:

  • Have a tertiary qualification, or equivalent experience, in either project management, environmental science, or community education and outreach;
  • Be familiar with legislation relevant to conservation and how it applies to DOC's work (e.g. Conservation Act, Marine Mammals Act, Wildlife Act, Reserves Act, Resource Management Act);
  • Be adept at learning and using a wide range of systems and processes;
  • Be analytical and innovative, able to identify issues and opportunities then develop solutions;
  • Be organised and thorough, able to plan, deliver and assess complex projects;
  • Be a team player with excellent interpersonal and communication skills;
  • Build positive working relationships across a broad range of public and private sector businesses and groups;
  • Hold a current full New Zealand Driver License

 

Experience working with whānau, hapū and iwi and an understanding of te ao Māori me ngā tikanga will be an advantage.

 

Eligibility to work in New Zealand is mandatory, including a valid work visa covering the whole period of employment if applying internationally.

Please apply online via the DOC Careers Centre.  Applications must include a cover letter, CV and evidence of the required capabilities as per the role description.

For any queries, please contact Kelly Hancock, Supervisor Community email khancock@doc.govt.nz or phone +64 6 27 5909231 quoting vacancy 400/4362.

Applications close at 5pm on Monday, 6 January 2020. Shortlisting will occur in the week beginning 13 January 2020 with interviews likely to be in the week beginning 21 January 2020.

DOC is committed to a diverse workforce that represents the communities we serve, and to creating an inclusive workplace culture.

About the business

Based in Albany, Allied Medical is a market leader in the assistive technology sector, with a focus on making some of the world’s best rehabilitation products available to improve lives. Powerchairs, wheelchairs, scooters, home healthcare equipment and the like – are what we get excited about – and what we’re great at.

As part of the Operations Team, this is a fantastic opportunity for you to be involved in developing your career with a New Zealand owned business that is experiencing very solid growth.

 

About the role

Our customers rely on our products to improve their mobility and quality of life. We are looking for someone to share our goal of meeting our customers' expectations every day.

We need an experienced Warehouse Co-ordinator to join our close-knit team to help us get our products to our customers.  Your day will include the following:

  • Picking and packing orders
  • Stock counting and organisation
  • Unpacking and checking inwards goods and returned trial equipment
  • Maintaining the cleanliness of the warehouse
  • Support others teams as required

 

Skills and experience

Ideally, you will have two or more years of logistics experience and are looking for an opportunity to show what you are capable of.  It would be cool if you also have:

  • Excellent written/spoken communication skills
  • A quick pace of work
  • Warehouse optimisation and process experience
  • Fork hoist license
  • Continuous improvement / Lean experience
  • Enjoy the challenge of meeting deadlines
  • Full drivers license and fully Covid-19 vaccinated 

If this sounds like something for you and you can see yourself as part of the Allied Medical Team, please click ‘Apply for this job”.

Please note, a Ministry of Justice report will be required as part of the recruitment process and all applicants must have NZ residency.

• Large Growth Mandate!
  • National Building Products Supplier
  • Privately Owned
  • Auckland based

Our client is a successful supplier in the building products sector. Locally manufacturing and distributing, it has an extensive network throughout New Zealand. Privately family owned, this business is considered a true New Zealand success story. It has annual retail sales of circa $300 million and approximately 300 staff.

They are now looking to appoint a new Chief Executive who will have a clear mandate to lead and grow the business, and to increase market share in very active markets. It is an exciting time for the organisation as it looks to evolve and enter a new phase of growth and financial performance.

Accordingly we are seeking individuals who can demonstrate the following:

  • A successful Chief Executive or General Manager within a significant industrial / manufacturing B2B product business, including having an understanding of innovation and design in a competitive market.
  • Demonstrated experience driving profitable sales and market share growth, whilst building on existing products and brand. This also includes defining and developing additional channels to market.
  • First class people leadership skills, ideally in an organisation with in excess of 300 staff.
  • The ability to build strong, successful and positive working relationships throughout the entire business and stakeholders.
  • Strong financial management skills and commercial acumen, and has managed P&L’s of at least $100m.
  • Exposure or experience working in a private company environment would also be advantageous, along with having worked with an entrepreneur who is willing to take calculated risks.
  • Strong Health & Safety understanding.

To apply on a confidential basis, please submit your curriculum vitae to cv@seqelpartners.com quoting reference number AHHP.

job_ad_details:
หน้าที่และความรับผิดชอบของ

  • การวางแผนงาน : ควบคุมดูแลแผนงานที่ต้องทำให้เป็นไปตามกำหนด และคอยตรวจสอบปัญหาที่อาจเกิดขึ้นพร้อมแก้ไขหากเกิดเหตุขัดข้อง
  • มีทักษะด้านการวางแผน การจัดการ การแก้ไขปัญหา การบริหารเวลา การคำนวณ การตรวจสอบควบคุมงบประมาณเบื้องต้น
  • ประสานงานกับแผนกต่าง ๆ ที่เกี่ยวข้อง จึงควรมีทักษะในการสื่อสารและ ติดต่อประสานงาน
  • การสนับสนุนการปฏิบัติงาน : ช่วยเหลือทีมขายในการเสนอราคา ความรู้เกี่ยวกับด้านโฆษณา การก่อสร้างป้ายโฆษณา ผลิตภัณฑ์ขององค์กร  และเอกสาร ฯลฯ เพื่อให้มั่นใจว่าสอดคล้องกับกฎระเบียบ ภายในองค์กร
  • การเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพกระบวนการ : ปรับปรุงกระบวนการขายเพื่อเพิ่มประสิทธิภาพ และประสิทธิผลในขณะที่ปฏิบัติตามมาตรฐานการกำกับดูแลและการปฏิบัติตามข้อกำหนด
  • การจัดการระบบและเครื่องมือ : ดูแลการใช้งานและการบำรุงรักษาระบบการขาย เครื่องมือ และแพลตฟอร์มเทคโนโลยีเพื่อรองรับกิจกรรมการขาย
  • การประสานงานข้ามสายงาน : ทำงานร่วมกับแผนกภายในเพื่อการประสานงาน ให้ผลสำเร็จของงาน เกิดความราบรื่น  ติดตามงาน เน้นการสื่อสารที่มีประสิทธิภาพ 

    คุณสมบัติ

  • มีความเป็นผู้นำที่แข็งแกร่งและทักษะการประชาสัมพันธ์
  • หาความรู้เพิ่มเติมด้านที่เกี่ยวข้อง เช่น การใช้โปรแกรมต่าง ๆ ในการคำนวณ หรือด้านการจัดการ เป็นต้น
