Embassy of the Federative Republic of Brazil

Level 13  - Maritime Tower – 10 Customhouse Quay

Wellington  / New Zealand

Phone: (+644) 473-3516 / Fax: (+644) 473-3517

http://Wellington.itamaraty.gov.br - brasemb.wellington@itamaraty.gov.br

PROCESSO SELETIVO PARA AUXILIAR ADMINISTRATIVO

E D I T A L Nº 30/2016

A Comissão de Seleção da Embaixada do Brasil em Wellington, no uso de suas atribuições delegada pelo Embaixador do Brasil em Wellington, torna pública, de acordo com as disposições do Decreto nº 1.570, de 21 de julho de 1995, da Portaria do Senhor Ministro das Relações Exteriores de setembro de 1995 e do despacho telegráfico nº 87, de 13 de setembro de 2016, a realização de processo seletivo para provimento de uma vaga de Auxiliar Administrativo.

1. DOS REQUISITOS BÁSICOS PARA INSCRIÇÃO:

Os candidatos devem satisfazer as seguintes condições:

1.1. Comprovação de situação regular de residência ("Resident Visa"), nos termos da legislação neozelandesa, no caso de brasileiros ou de nacionais de terceiros países;

1.2. Aptidão física e mental, a ser objeto de comprovação, por certificado, em caso de aprovação no processo seletivo;

1.3. Idade mínima de 18 (dezoito) anos;

1.4. Atestado de bons antecedentes ou equivalente;

1.5. Para os candidatos brasileiros, comprovação de:

  • quitação com o serviço militar, para pessoas do sexo masculino;
  • quitação com as obrigações eleitorais;e
  • declaração de que não ocupam cargos, empregos ou funções públicas no Brasil;

1.6. Qualificação para as funções indicadas nos itens 3.1.3 e 3.1.4, inclusive domínio dos idiomas inglês e português;

2. DA INSCRIÇÃO NO PROCESSO SELETIVO:

2.1. Não será cobrada taxa de inscrição;

2.2. DO PRAZO: O período para inscrição no processo seletivo inicia-se no dia 21 de setembro  de 2016 e encerra-se no dia 21 de outubro de 2016, sujeito a eventual prorrogação, a ser definida pela Comissão de Seleção;

2.3. DA MODALIDADE: As inscrições, acompanhadas de toda a documentação exigida no item nº 2.4 e seus subitens, deverão ser entregues na sede da Embaixada (Level 13, Maritime Tower – 10 Customhouse Quay – Wellington), em envelope lacrado, ou enviadas por correio, observado o prazo de recebimento em 21 de outubro de 2016, até as 16h, e endereçada a:

Embassy of Brazil

Postal Address: P.O Box 5431 – Wellington – 6140

Attention: Comissão de Seleção;

2.4. – DA DOCUMENTAÇÃO: Para ter sua inscrição deferida, o interessado deverá remeter os seguintes documentos: 

2.4.1. "Formulário de Inscrição" devidamente preenchido, que poderá ser encontrado na própria Embaixada e na sua página eletrônica, na Internet, http://wellington.itamaraty.gov.br;

2.4.2. "Curriculum Vitae";

2.4.3. Cópia do documento que comprove estar em situação regular de residência na Nova Zelândia, no caso de não ser cidadão neozelandês ("Resident Visa");

2.4.4. Cópia dos títulos ou certificados de trabalho e/ou relação dos últimos empregadores, se for o caso, com endereços postal e telefônico para contato (referências); formação de nível médio ou, se for o caso, universitário;

2.4.5. Se brasileiro do sexo masculino, documento que comprove estar em dia com as obrigações do serviço militar;

2.4.6. Se brasileiro, cópia do documento que comprove estar em dia com as obrigações eleitorais e o número de inscrição no cadastro de pessoas físicas (CPF);

2.4.7. Se brasileiro, anexar declaração de que não ocupa cargo, emprego ou função pública;

2.4.8. Certidão negativa de antecedentes criminais, que pode ser obtida na página www.dpf.gov.br . No caso de estrangeiros, deve ser apresentada certidão equivalente;

2.5.  Não serão prestadas informações sobre o processo seletivo por telefone. Eventuais dúvidas deverão ser encaminhadas ao endereço eletrônico: brasemb.wellington@itamaraty.gov.br

3. das disposições gerais:

3.1. - DO CARGO, DAS FUNÇÕES E DO HORÁRIO:

3.1.1. o cargo de Auxiliar Local, a ser provido pelo processo seletivo, refere-se ao exercício da função de Auxiliar Administrativo, por tempo determinado (contrato de um ano, renovável);

3.1.2. O candidato selecionado será empregado da Embaixada do Brasil em Wellington, em contrato regido pelas leis trabalhistas da Nova Zelândia;

3.1.3. O candidato deverá cumprir regime de 40 horas semanais, das 9h às 18h, com uma hora de almoço, de segunda a sexta-feira, com perspectiva de execução de horas extraordinárias, de comum acordo com o empregador, compensáveis;

3.1.4. A posição anunciada prevê o apoio aos vários setores da Embaixada, em particular ao Setor de Consular, incluindo as seguintes atribuições:

  • Apoio no processamento e emissão de documentos, atendimento telefônico, recebimento e envio de emails;
  • Atualização de bancos de dados, mídia social e webpage;
  • Assistência no relacionamento com a comunidade brasileira;
  • Apoio em outras tarefas quando solicitado por outros setores;
  • Conhecimento de softwares tais como Excel, Word e outros, que possam auxiliar no desempenho das funções descritas;

4. DA REMUNERAÇÃO:

4.1. O salário mensal a ser percebido pelo Auxiliar Administrativo selecionado será de NZ$ 4.000,00 (quatro mil dólares neozelandeses) mensais, NZ$ 48.000,00 (quarenta e oito mil dólares neozelandeses) anuais, além de férias remuneradas de 22 dias úteis, após o primeiro ano de trabalho;

5. DO PROCESSO SELETIVO:

O processo seletivo abrange duas fases:

5.1. PRIMEIRA FASE (Eliminatória):

5.1.1. Análise da documentação remetida à Embaixada, conforme requisitos dos itens 2.2, 2.3 e 2.4, com vistas à pré-seleção dos candidatos;

5.2. SEGUNDA FASE (Eliminatória e Classificatória):

5.2.1. Os candidatos cujas inscrições forem pré-selecionadas serão convocados para entrevista;

5.2.2. As entrevistas serão realizadas na sede da Embaixada pelos representantes da Comissão de Seleção. Com base na entrevista, em que serão avaliadas a apresentação, o desembaraço e conhecimentos básicos em inglês e português, os candidatos cuja avaliação, nas entrevistas, for considerada satisfatória serão convocados a um teste escrito, a fim de avaliar as habilidades de redação em ambas as línguas;

5.2.3. Uma vez concluída a apresentação e avaliação dos candidatos pela Comissão de Seleção, serão aprovados os candidatos que obtiverem as melhores avaliações do item 5.2.2;

5.1.3. O resultado final, pela ordem de classificação, será divulgado na página eletrônica da Embaixada do Brasil em Wellington;

6. DAS DISPOSIÇÕES FINAIS: 

6.1. O primeiro colocado será convocado para comparecer à Embaixada e iniciar os trâmites para a sua contratação, devendo os demais aprovados formar cadastro de reserva para provimento de eventual vaga;

6.2. O candidato selecionado deverá cumprir estágio probatório remunerado de três meses, ao final do qual terá sua contratação confirmada ou anulada, sem que isto incorra em indenização de espécie alguma;

6.3. O presente processo seletivo terá validade de 12 (doze) meses, contados a partir da data de sua conclusão pela divulgação de seu resultado final;

6.4. Os casos omissos serão decididos pela Comissão de Seleção.

Wellington, 21 de setembro de  2016.

Comissão de Administração

 

LOCAL STAFF SELECTION PROCESS

VACANCIES:              1 (one) 

HOURS:                       Full time (40 hours per week)

JOB/TASKS :              Administrative Assistant

REQUIREMENTS:   -   Residence Visa;

  • Minimum age of 18 years;
  • Excellent written and spoken English and Portuguese   

EVALUATION OF APPLICANTS: - 

- Professional Experience;

- Qualifications (C. Vitae);

- Written Test

REGISTRATION :  -     From  21 Sept 2016 to 21 Oct  2016

Wellington,  21 Sep  2016.

NOTE: Brazilian citizens must provide electoral documents plus a declaration that they do not hold any position in the Brazilian civil service. In addition, Brazilian male candidates must present military documentation.

 

 

 

$45,000 - $48.000

Kia ūkaipō anō te reo Māori:
Koinei te tūruapō o te rautaki reo Māori hou e kīa nei ko Te Maihi Māori, he mea waihanga e ngāi Māori mō ngā kāinga, mō ngā hapori, me ngā iwi. Nā te Ture mō Te Reo Māori 2016 i rerekē ai te tirohanga o Aotearoa ki te whakarauoratanga o te reo Māori. I whakatūria ai te whare o Te Mātāwai hei whakakanohitanga mō ngā iwi me ngāi Māori i roto i te hononga kōtuitanga me te Karauna. Ko tā Te Mātāwai he tautoko, he waihanga, he whakakaha hoki i ngā heipūtanga ki roto ki ngā kāinga, ki ngā hapori, me ngā iwi.
  
I te tīmatanga o te tau 2017, i hui tahi a Te Mātāwai ki te hunga whai pānga huri noa i te motu ki te kohi haere i ngā whakaaro mō ō rātou tūmanako mō te whakarauoratanga o te reo Māori, me ngā mahi a Te Mātāwai ki te whakatutuki i ēnei tūmanakotanga. Nā ēnei kohinga whakaaro i hua mai Te Rautaki Maihi Māori 2017-2040, me tōna tūruapō, ‘Kia ūkaipo anō te reo Māori.’
  
Ko te kaitono e hiahiatia ana ko tētahi e mārama ana, e hihiko ana rānei ki te ako, ki te mahi tahi atu ki ngā kāinga, ki ngā hapori, ki ngā iwi, ki te rāngai tūmatanui, me tōna angitū ki te whaihanga, ki te whakapūmau hoki i ngā hononga whai pānga ki ēnei rohenga e rua. Ko te mana motuhake te ara ka whāia e Te Mātāwai, arā, kei ngā whanau, kei ngā kāinga, kei ngā hapori, kei ngā iwi te rangatiratanga ki te whakatau ko hea te huarahi tika mō rātou, tae atu ki ngā rauemi tika hei tautoko i a rātou.
  
E whai tono ana mātou mō tēnei tūranga pārekareka, tēnei tūranga whakapātari nei, te Kaitohutohu Matua. E whai nei i tētahi tangata ka hīkaka ki te whakakotahi i ōna pūkenga tuhi ki te reo Māori, ki te reo Ingarihi hoki, me tōna taunga ki te whakapuaki whakaaro, ki te aromātai kaupapa kia whai tautoko ai te Kaitohutohu Matua. Kei te Kaitohutohu Matua te mahi nui ki te tautoko, ki te ārahi hoki i te Tumu Whakarae, i te Poari Matua, me ngā kāhui ā-rohe mō te whakaūnga o Te Maihi Māori.
  
Ko te kaitono e whāiatia nei, tōna tikanga, kua whai wheako ki roto i ngā mahi kaupapa here a te kāwanatanga, ā, kua whakapau kaha ki ngā mahi a tētahi whare ‘nā ngāi Māori, mō ngāi Māori,’ pēnei i a Te Mātāwai. Me kaha tō pānui i ngā tikanga whakarauora i te reo Māori, me te hauhake ake i ētahi whakaaro auaha e hāngai pū nei ki a mātou mahi. Mā ō pūkenga rangahau, pūkenga aromātaitanga koe e angitū ai i tēnei tūranga mahi, ka haere ngātahi ō pūkenga me tō matatau ki ngā whakaaro ariā, ki ngā whakaaro pōhewa, me ngā tūhonotanga hoki i waenga i ngā kaupapa here, ngā mahi whakahaere, me ngā take haumi hoki.
  
Me pēhea te tono
For more information and to apply for this role please visit www.h2r.co.nz/tematawai.  Contact: Kirsty Brown on 04 4999 471 or kirsty.brown@h2r.co.nz quoting reference number 262604.  Katoa ngā tono ka whakamanatia mā te īmēra. Ka kati ngā tono hei te Mane, 28 o Hune, 5pm.

He mīharo a Slingshot hei wāhi mahi, ā, kei te hiahia mātou ki ētahi kaimahi mīharo mō tō mātou puni Te Reo Māori hou.

Ka kawe te puni nei i te ngākau whiwhita o Slingshot mō te ratonga kiritaki, waihoki, ka whakarawe āwhina ā-reo Māori ki ngā kiritaki o Slingshot - ahakoa mā te huarahi o te waea, te īmēra, te kōrerorero ā-tuihono.

E whakapono ana mātou he tuatahitanga tēnei mō tētahi rangatōpū o Aotearoa, ā, he hiahia nui tō mātou kia whai i ngā kaimahi kaiora kia hiki i tēnei kaupapa ki taumata ikeike.

Te Tūranga

He tūranga ukiuki ā-waea, ā-īmēra anō hoki tēnei e mahi ana kei raro i te maru o tō mātou Pū Whakapāpā. Ko te nuinga o te wā ka mahi koe ki tō ake kāinga, ā, ko ngā pātai ki te reo Māori (kāore e kore ko ētahi ki te reo Pākehā anō hoki) ka tukuna atu ki a koe.

Ko te āhuatanga o tētahi rā māori ki tēnei tūranga ko te tuku kōrero āwhina e hāngai ana ki ngā pātai hangarau ā-kāinga, te whakarongoā i ngā raru hangarau o ngā kiritaki, te whaiwhai atu i ngā raru kua tohua kētia, me te tautoko i ngā kiritaki kia whai rongoā. Ko te katoa o tēnā me te mātua aro anō hoki ki te whakatinanatanga o te whai hua ā-ipurangi a ngā kiritaki.

Ki te whakaaro koe he haepapa nui tēnā, kaua e māharahara, kua whakatauhia e mātou te 2.5 wiki te roa o tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū ā-Huitopa kia whakaakongia ngā āhuatanga katoa kia rite pai koe ki te kōkiri i ngā haepapa mahi - waihoki ka tuku atu ki a koe te katoa o ngā taputapu rorohiko kia whakatutuki pai koe i ngā mahi, ā, ka riro hoki i a koe tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tō hononga ipurangi.

Ka mahi tahi koe me tētahi ranga papai rawa me tā rātou kaha āwhina, kaha tautoko anō hoki mai i te timatanga. Ko tō mātou hiahia i a koe ko te paku mōhiotanga ki ngā āhuatanga hangarau, kia kounga tō reo Māori ā-waha, ā-tuhi anō hoki, kia tū koe hei tangata ngākau āhwina, ka mutu, kei a koe te āheinga kia ohia te hanga o te whakaaro!

Ko te katoa o tēnā mai i te āhurutanga o tō ake kāinga.

Ngā pūkenga me ngā āheinga me mātua kite

  • Me matatau i te reo Māori ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki
  • Me kounga te reo Pākehā ā-tuhi, ā-waha anō hoki
  • Kia pai te taumata pūkenga rorohiko me te tere o te patopato
  • Kua 1-2 tau te roa o tō whai wheako ki tētahi Pū Whakapāpā, ki tētahi tūranga ratonga kiritaki rānei e āhua rite ana ki tēnei
  • E ngākau whakapuke ana ki te hangarau
  • Me mātua whakapuāwai ki roto i tētahi taiao terenga-kakama
  • E ngākau whiwhita ana kia whai rongoā, kia āwhina tāngata anō hoki

Ngā paearu/ngā māraurautanga kia mahi ki tō ake kāinga

  • Me mātua mārōrō te hononga ipurangi me te āheinga kia hono mā te itarangi
  • He wāhi mahi ngū kia tutuki pai ngā whiwhinga waea
  • Tētahi waea pūkoro

Ngā Hua

  • Ka āhei te whiwhi i ngā āpititanga utu ā-tau tae atu ki te $6000
  • Ka riro i tētahi nama $80 ia marama kia tāpae atu ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Slingshot, ki tētahi ratonga ipurangi Orcon rānei
  • Tētahi hōtaka whakangūngū e 2.5 wiki te roa, ā, ka utua hoki e koe
  • Kua wātea e koe te mahi ki tō ake kāinga
  • Ka riro i te $300 hei moni āwhina mō te whare whakapakari tinana
  • Ka riro i te ōrautanga āwhina, arā te 50% mai i te utu o tētahi inihua hauora mō ngā kaimahi ukiuki

He kōrero whakamārama mō Slingshot (me tōna rāngai matua a Vocus)

Ka manaakitia o mātou nuinga, ka pōwhiritia te ahurea kanorau, ā, ka whakanuia ngā hunga ka eke ki taumata ikeike. I te pō, i te ao e kimi ana mātou i ngā hunga rikarika, i ngā hunga koi, otirā i ngā hunga ngākau hihiko.

Kua waihangatia e mātou tētahi taiao ā-ranga pai me tētahi ahurea whaiwhai hua, ā, ahakoa kei te kāinga te nuinga o a mātou kaimahi e mahi ana, ka hiki tonu mātou i tētahi taiao hihiko mā te whakatū i ngā huihuinga ā-ranga, mā te whakahaere i tētahi karapu whakangahau, ā, mā te whakahaere i ngā momo whakapoapoatanga, i ngā momo whakataetae ā-marama anō hoki. Mehemea e āhua rite ana koe ki a mātou, arā, he tangata whakaaro kaikaha, he kaha koe ki te kimi huarahi kia whakapai ake i tētahi āhuatanga, he ngākaunui tōu kia mahitahi me te hunga tangata, ā, e hiahia ana koe ki te whakawhanake i a koe anō, kāti, ka mātua tau tō noho ki waenganui i a mātou.

I a koe ngā pūkenga me te ngākau uruhi kia piri mai ki te ranga? Pāwhiria te 'apply', ā, tīmatatia tō para i te ara o Vocus.

job_title: Accounting Specialist - ITA - Roma - Viale Carmelo Bene 70, Bellaria HQ
job_ad_details:
Ricerchiamo urgentemente un Accounting Specialist da inserire nel dipartimento Finance, Tax team, presso l’Head office di Avis Budget Group con sede a Roma.

AVIS BUDGET GROUP è la multinazionale leader mondiale nel mercato del noleggio auto a breve termine che opera in Italia attraverso 5 leading brands: Avis, Budget, Maggiore, Amico Blu, Morini.
L'azienda opera attraverso le stazioni di noleggio, presenti negli aeroporti del territorio nazionale ed in centro città. I nostri team forniscono un servizio al di sopra delle aspettative, ponendo al centro la soddisfazione del cliente e la promozione dei nostri Brands.

In particolare, le principali mansioni saranno di supporto ai colleghi nella gestione delle seguenti attività:

  • Predisporre le scritture di rettifica per la redazione delle bozze di bilancio delle diverse Società del Gruppo
  • Presiedere la quadratura dei conti contabili relativi ai bilanci delle singole Società del Gruppo.
  • Presiedere le riconciliazioni Intercompany propedeutiche per la predisposizione del Bilancio Consolidato
  • Interrogare i sistemi aziendali per la verifica delle registrazioni contabili
  • Gestire le richieste della società di revisione/Audit
  • Supportare il miglioramento dei processi contabili aziendali

Requisiti minimi

  • Laurea in Economia
  • Padronanza dei principi contabili Italiani ed Internazionali
  • 3-5 anni di esperienza contabile in aziende strutturate ed internazionali
  • Inglese, livello C1
  • Excel, livello avanzato
  • Gradita conoscenza di SAP system e Oracle
  • Gradita precedente esperienza con società di revisione

Completano il profilo

  • Proattività
  • Organizzazione e gestione delle proprie attività
  • Precisione e puntualità nel rispetto delle scadenze

Inserimento immediato con contratto a tempo determinato di 1 anno

Ang aming kliyente ay dalubhasa sa mga serbisyo sa paglalaba ng linen at damit sa Auckland.

Magkakaroon kami ng trabaho sa dalawang shifts, 5 am-1.30pm at 2 pm-10pm, nagtatrabaho sa isang Lunes - roster ng Linggo.

Tutulong ka sa pag-uuri ng linen at damit para sa paghuhugas, natitiklop at pamamalantsa, pakainin at mahuli ang linen sa flat-work ironer at mangongolekta at pag-uuri ng maruming lino mula sa shoot at paglipat sa labahan para sa paghuhugas.

Ito ay isang pisikal na tungkulin at makikita mo ang iyong mga paa para sa karamihan ng iyong paglipat, na may paminsan-minsang pag-angat ng mga item hanggang sa 25 kilograms at o pagtulak / paghila ng mabibigat na bagay.

8% sa tuktok ng iyong oras-oras na rate at bayad bawat Miyerkules

Nakatuon ng 24 na koponan upang suportahan ka

Piliin kung maaari kang magtrabaho - buong oras O part time O kaswal

Malaking oras sa alok! Makipag-ugnay kay Holly sa 021 554 912.

Our client specialises in linen and garment laundry services in Auckland.

We will have work available in two shifts, 5am-1.30pm and 2pm-10pm, working over a Monday – Sunday roster.

You will be assisting in sorting linen and clothes for washing, folding and ironing, feed and catch linen in the flat-work ironer and will be collecting and sorting dirty linen from the shoot and transfer to laundry for washing.

This is a physical role and you'll be on your feet for most of your shift, with occasional lifting of items up to 25 kilograms and or pushing/pulling heavy objects.

8% on top of your hourly rate and paid each Wednesday

Dedicated 24 hour team to support you

Choose when you can work – full time OR part time OR casual

Big hours on offer! Contact Holly on 021 554 912.

job_title: Payroll Specialist - ITA - Roma - Viale Carmelo Bene 70, HQ
job_ad_details:
Ricerchiamo urgentemente un Payroll Specialist per la nostra sede di Roma.

La risorsa verrà inserita con contratto a tempo indeterminato nel dipartimento Risorse Umane nella gestione delle seguenti attività:

  • Controllo delle presenze ed eventi, elaborazione e controllo cedolini dipendenti e parasubordinati;
  • Gestione degli adempimenti periodici: Uniemens, F24, predisposizione pagamenti per fondi di previdenza complementare e assistenza sanitaria;
  • Gestione degli adempimenti annuali: CU, elaborazione autoliquidazioni INAIL, elaborazione modelli 770;
  • Elaborazioni di fine anno: TFR, calcolo acconto e saldo imposta sostitutiva, IRAP, studi di settore;
  • Predisposizione reportistica post paga: file consuntivazione costi, contabilità del personale, budget, quadratura imposte, contributi e similari;
  • Gestione ferie, straordinari, maternità, congedi, aspettative; pensioni e liquidazioni; gestione dei rapporti previdenziali;

Requisiti minimi:

  • Laurea triennale e/o magistrale in Economia o Scienze Giuridiche
  • Esperienza di 3-5 anni nell'elaborazione di paghe e contributi presso Studi Professionali o in contesti aziendali strutturati
  • Ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese
  • Conoscenza delle nuove disposizioni normative
  • Perfetta padronanza del pacchetto Office con particolare riferimento ad Excel ad un livello avanzato
  • Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza del sistema payroll ADP e E-time ADP
  • Precisione, organizzazione e autonomia operativa
  • Riservatezza, affidabilità e senso di responsabilità
  • Capacità di lavorare in team e abilità relazionali per essere punto di riferimento nel supporto a colleghi e direzione
  • Problem solving, time management e orientamento al risultato.

Inserimento immediato con contratto a tempo indeterminato

Kia ūkaipō anō te reo Māori:
Koinei te tūrua pō o te rautaki reo Māori hou e kīia nei ko Te Maihi Māori, he mea waihanga e ngāi Māori mā ngā kāinga, ngā hapori me ngā iwi.

I te tīmatanga o te tau 2017 i hui tahi Te Mātāwai me ngā rōpū whai pānga huri noa i te motu ki te kohi haere i ngā kōrero mō ngā kaupapa reo Māori kei ngā kāinga, ngā hapori; ngā wawata kei a rātou e pā ana ki te reo Māori, tae noa ki ngā mahi a Te Mātāwai hei whakatutuki i ēnei wawata. Nā runga i ēnei kohinga kōrero i hua mai ai Maihi Māori 2017-2040.
  
Te tūranga mahi:
Kua ara mai he āheinga pārekareka rawa atu mō tētahi Kaitohutohu Mātāmua Ako/Whanaketanga taiea kia mahi i tēnei wāhi mahi whakahirahira mō tētahi tūranga pūmau tekau mā rua marama te roa. He hunga ngākau nui kei Te Mātāwai e kaha pupuri ana i te mana me te whakarauoratanga o te reo Māori.   
Kei te Kaitohutohu Mātāmua mō ngā take Akoranga/Whanaketanga te haepapa ki te hanga i tētahi pou tarāwaho arataki, whanaketanga, whakangungu hoki mā ngā kaimahi, ngā mema o te Poari me ngā Pae Motuhake. Ko tāu mahi he kōkiri i ētahi hīraunga ako hou kia kairangi ake nei, mā roto i ngā rautaki maha. Āpā noa atu, ko ngā kauhau tuihono ērā, ko ngā papamahi, ko ngā kōwae ako matihiko, me ētahi rauemi hāpai i ngā kaimahi.
Ko tāu mahi he tautohu, he whakaraupapa i ngā hiahia whakangungu, whakawhanake hoki a Te Mātāwai mā te toro ki ngā rōpū whai pānga, tae atu hoki ki te mahi kōtui me ngā pakihi kia mārama ai ngā hiahia ako, ā, he tautohu hoki i ngā wāhi kāore nei e tino kaha ana.

He kōrero mōu ake:
Māu anō koe e kuhu, ā, ka noho mai koe hei kaimahi ako/whanaketanga whai mana i runga i:
  • Te hiranga o ōu pūkenga whakamōhiohio, tō pai ki te kōrero Māori, tō mārama hoki ki ngā tikanga me ngā mātāpono o Te Tiriti o Waitangi;
  • Tētahi huarahi mahi tahi kia pai ai te whakakotahitanga mai o te katoa, kia aro kē mai ētahi atu ki āu ārahitanga;
  • Ōu wheako hirahira mō te ārahi i te whakanaketanga, te hanganga, me te whakatutukitanga o ngā whakangungu arotika, tae noa ki ngā hīraunga ako;
  • Ōu wheako ki te ārahi i te hanganga o ētahi hīraunga ākonga hei whakapakaritanga ake;
  • Ōu mōhio me ōu māramatanga ki ngā mātāpono me ngā ahunga ako.
Me pēhea te tono:
Mō ētahi atu pārongo, ā, e tono ai koe ki tēnei tūranga, tēna tirohia te pae tukutuku www.h2r.co.nz/tematawai, whakapā mai ki a Victoria Brice ki 04 4999 471, ā, īmēra mai rānei ki  Victoria.brice@h2r.co.nz nama tohutoro 305415. Ka kati ngā tono hei te Wenerei 13 o Oketopa, 5pm.

job_title: Kaiako - Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi (L5)
job_ad_details:
Kaiako –Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi L5

Permanent Full-time

Raroera Campus

Hamilton

 

He karanga tēnei! E rapu ana mātou i tētahi tangata māna e whakaako Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi L5, tētahi kaupapa reo rūmaki o roto o Te Wānanga o Aotearoa.

 

Ko tōna tino whāinga he whakawhanake i te mātau o te hunga ako ki ngā tūāhuatanga o te reo Māori, kia ū, kia pakari tōna reo.  Me matatau rawa tēnei tangata ki te reo Māori kia pai ai tāna ārahi i ngā ākonga kia kōtihitihi rawa te aronga.  Me mātanga te tangata nei ki ngā kaupapa ka whakaakona arā ko te hokinga mahara, ngā āhuatanga o te reo, kōrero nehe, te taiao, te hekenga o ngā waka, whakapūrongo, kupu whakanikoniko, te marae.

 

Ngā pūkenga me ngā wheako a te tangata:

  • Kua pūkenga, kua wheako te tangata nei ki te whakaako ki te reo Māori anake me te whakaako i te hunga pakeke.

     

  • Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki te tohu paetahi, ki tētahi tohu ōrite rānei te taumata e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā kaupapa o te reo me ngā tikanga Māori, otirā ao Māori.

     

  • Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki tētahi tohu whakaako e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā āhuatanga o te mātauranga whakaako, te whakaako hoki i te hunga pakeke. 

 

Tonoa tēnei tūranga mā te rīhita me te tono ki te pae tukutuku nei:

https://twoa.careercentre.net.nz/

Kaiwhakaputa Aromatawai ā-Waho

Whakatairangatia ngā kete o te mātauranga ki te ao mārama! E te tai whakarunga, e te tai whakararo - nau piki mai, nau kake mai ki te Mana Tohu Mātauranga o Aotearoa.

E rapu ana mātou o Ngā Poutoko Aromatawai Māori i te tangata e matatau ana ki te whakarite i ngā tānga hou o ngā Aromatawai ā-Waho i Te Reo Māori. 

Kia pakari ōna pūkenga hei whakahaere i ngā taupānga o te kaiwhakaputanga; Desktop publishing (MAC OS X), Adobe Creative Suite, Adobe Acrobat & Microsoft Word.

E mārama ana te tangata ki te Marautanga o Aotearoa me ngā Kaupapa Ako Māori o NZC (New Zealand Curriculum) me āna whakapānga ki ngā ākonga Māori o ngā kura.  Me kī, ka whai wāhi ai te tangata nei ki te whakarato, ki te kōkiri hoki i ngā kaupapa aromatawai ā-motu ia rā, ia rā.  Heoi, ko ngā taiohi o ngā Wharekura te aronga!

Ki te tono mai, tuhia tō reta me tō tātai oranga ki te reo Māori i mua i a:

  • Paraire 5.00pm, 28 Oketopa 2022.

Mehemea he pātai āu me whakapā mai ki a:

  • Natasha Ropata, Natasha.Ropata@nzqa.govt.nz 027 226 4611.

job_title: Kaiako - Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi (L5)
job_ad_details:
Kaiako – Te Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi L5

Permanent Full-time

Apakura Campus

Waikato

 

He karanga tēnei!  E rapu ana mātou i tētahi tangata māna e whakaakoTe Rōnakitanga ki te Reo Kairangi L5, tētahi kaupapa reo rūmaki o roto o Te Wānanga o Aotearoa.

 

Ko tōna tino whāinga he whakawhanake i te mātau o te hunga ako ki ngā tūāhuatanga o te reo Māori, kia ū, kia pakari tōna reo.  Me matatau rawa tēnei tangata ki te reo Māori kia pai ai tāna ārahi i ngā ākonga kia kōtihitihi rawa te aronga.  Me mātanga te tangata nei ki ngā kaupapa ka whakaakona arā ko te hokinga mahara, ngā āhuatanga o te reo, kōrero nehe, te taiao, te hekenga o ngā waka, whakapūrongo, kupu whakanikoniko, te marae.

 

Ngā pūkenga me ngā wheako a te tangata:

·  Kua pūkenga, kua wheako te tangata nei ki te whakaako ki te reo Māori anake me te whakaako i te hunga pakeke.

·  Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki te tohu paetahi, ki tētahi tohu ōrite rānei te taumata e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā kaupapa o te reo me ngā tikanga Māori, otirā ao Māori.

·  Kua whakawhiwhia kētia ki tētahi tohu whakaako e whakaaturia ana tōna tohungatanga i roto i ngā āhuatanga o te mātauranga whakaako, te whakaako hoki i te hunga pakeke. 

 

Tonoa tēnei tūranga mā te rīhita me te tono ki te pae tukutuku nei:

https://twoa.careercentre.net.nz/

job_title: Poutuara (Assistant Head of School), Te Ūranga Waka & Te Whatukura
job_ad_details:
He kirimana tō tēnei tūranga whakahaere i Te Ūranga Waka me Te Whatukura. Ko tā te tangata ka angitū, he āwhina i te Pouarataki, i Te Ūranga Waka i Ōtātara. 

Anei ngā pūkenga kei te whāia:

· Me mātua mōhio koe ki te whakawhiti kōrero ki te tangata, ki te ārahi, ki te tuarā hoki i ngā mahi me ngā kaimahi o Te Ūranga Waka me Te Whatukura

· Mena he tohu reo Māori tōu, ko te painga atu tēnā

· Mena he tohu paerua tōu, ā, kua whakauru atu rānei koe ki ngā whakaakoranga tohu paerua – ko te painga atu tēnā  

· Mena he tohu Whakaako tōu, ā, kua whai wāhi atu rānei koe ki te whakaako - ko te painga atu tēnā   

Mena e ngākau hihiri, e ngākaunui ana koe ki te mahi tahi i waenga i te hunga pukumahi me te whāngai atu i ōu nā mōhiotanga ki ngā ākonga pakeke, tēnā whakapā mai. 

 Ka kati ngā tono ā te 6.00pm, hei te Rātapu, te 16 o ngā rā o Poutū te rangi, 2022. Hei ngā kōrero whakamārama mō tēnei tūranga me te puka tono, me pāwhiri atu ki te hono ā-rorohiko kei raro nei.

Kaiwhakaputa Aromatawai ā-Waho i Te Reo Māori

Whakatairangatia ngā kete o te mātauranga ki te ao mārama! E te tai whakarunga, e te tai whakararo - nau piki mai, nau kake mai ki te Mana Tohu Mātauranga o Aotearoa.

E rapu ana mātou o Ngā Poutoko Aromatawai Māori i te tangata e matatau ana ki te whakarite i ngā tānga hou o ngā Aromatawai ā-Waho i Te Reo Māori.

job_title: Temporary staff (Japan Information and Cultural Centre)
job_ad_details:
Attention: Due to the nature of this position, applicants must have complete fluency in both spoken and written business Japanese. Therefore, our advertisement is only available in Japanese, and we will only accept CVs in Japanese.

職員募集(臨時採用）について

在ニュージーランド日本国大使館では，以下の業務に従事していただく臨時採用職員（１ 名）を募集しています。

1 業務内容

窓口・電話・メールによる照会対応、会計・庶務的業務・書類作成等を含む広報文化業務 1 名

2 勤務場所

在ニュージーランド日本国大使館

Level18, Majestic Centre, 100 Willis Street, Wellington, New Zealand

3 応募資格

（1） 下記期間当地において働く資格（永住許可等）を有する方（ワーキングホリデービ ザで就労されている方は対象とはなりません）

（2） 語学力：日本語（母国語程度）及び英語によるビジネス文章作成等業務の遂行が可能な方

（3） 経歴等：日本あるいは外国において一定期間の職歴を有する方

（4）  コンピュータスキル（Windows, MSワード, エクセル, パワーポイント）

4 採用形態

当館現地臨時職員として１年未満の短期雇用

5 勤務日，勤務時間

原則として，毎週月曜日から金曜日までの週 5 日（9：00～17:00 /昼休み 12:30～13:30）

6 雇用期間

平成 28 年 7 月 から平成 29 年 3 月31日までのある一定期間の予定

7 給与等

経歴等に応じ決定します。             

8 応募方法

以下を同封の上，下記住所まで郵便で送付してください（なお，送付いただいた履歴書はお 返ししませんので，予め御了承願います）。

（1） 履歴書1通（顔写真貼付，詳細記入）

（2） 当地滞在資格（永住許可，就労査証等）のコピー

 （3） 英語の資格（TOEIC/TOEFL/等）及び他の資格（あれば）のコピー

10 選考方法

（1）  一次審査 書類選考

（2） 二次審査 一次審査合格者に対してのみ連絡の上，面接試験を実施します。 実施日時は，一次審査合格者に対し直接担当者よりお知らせします。

11 臨時採用人数

採用人数：           1名

12 履歴書送付先

Attn: Director, Japan Information & Culture Centre, Embassy of Japan PO Box 6340, Marion Square, Wellington 6141

封筒には，必ず朱書で「職員募集」と明記ください。 また，本募集について，電話や電子メールによる照会には応じられませんので，予め御承 知おきください。

La Embajada de España en Wellington busca un empleado/a de limpieza cuyas funciones a realizar serán las siguientes:
- Labores de limpieza y acondicionamiento general.
- Lavado y planchado de ropa.
- Funciones auxiliares en los actos protocolarios que se organicen o en los que participe  la Embajada, tales como servicios de mesa y guardarropas, entre otros.
- Todas aquellas otras tareas que, de acuerdo a su categoría, le sean encomendadas por el Jefe de Misión.
El detalle de las tareas, los requisitos y el procedimiento de selección se encuentra en las bases de la convocatoria que se encuentran en la página web de la Embajada:
http://www.exteriores.gob.es/Embajadas/Wellington/es/Paginas/inicio.aspx
Son requisitos indispensables:
• Estar en posesión del correspondiente permiso o autorización de residencia y trabajo en Nueva Zelanda
La presentación de solicitudes se realizará mediante el modelo de solicitud establecido (Anejo III), y que se encuentra en la web, y se presentarán a la Embajada de España en Wellington en la forma establecida en las bases. 
Se ruega la lectura detallada de las bases de la convocatoria y que se siga el procedimiento en ellas establecido, pues en caso contrario la solicitud de participar en el proceso de selección será rechazada.
Para solicitar información adicional se puede contactar con la Embajada en el correo emb.wellington@maec.es
El plazo de presentación de solicitudes finalizará el martes 24 de agosto de 2021, incluido.

  • Set up SOP for the Logistic Department, and implement necessary system such as SAP/ERP.

  • Direct and follow-up with incoming and outgoing products to ensure prompt delivery to customers.
  • Prepare, manage and file shipping documents (e.g. Import Permits, Export Permits) according to SOPs and requirements.

  • Responsible for planning and tracking the shipment of final products according to customer requirements.

Your role

Are you incredibly organized with an eye for detail? Do you have strong analytical skills?


We’re looking for someone like that who can:

  • Create stakeholder-oriented communications including preparation of management presentations
  • Covers the management of scope through tollgate, sign-off and change management concepts
  • Provide support to the program manager including project staff onboarding of new colleagues as well as contract management (setup and extension of contracts)
  • Maintain documentation for projects, including the maintenance of training offerings and contract documentation
  • Organize team meetings and workshops including preparation, facilitation and post-processing of a project meeting that includes all major stakeholders
  • Preferably to have experience in setting up and maintaining of Confluence / SharePoint instances to ensure clear communication for multiple stakeholders


Your team

You’ll be working in the APAC Strategic Change team based in Singapore. We are service/project managers for different teams across GWM . The scope of work includes liaising with teams across operations, business, and internal stakeholders to ensure requirements are captured from an APAC perspective and new processes ,new workflow tools are rolled out to the relevant teams.


Your expertise


You have:

  • Min. 6 years of proven experience as project manager/buisness analyst
  • Highly proactive and diligent in follow up and follow through.
  • Broad understanding of banking processes and have a general sense of risk awareness.
  • Risk conscious with emphasis on sensitive data sharing.
  • solution-orientated and accustomed to tight deadlines
  • Broad understanding of KYC/AML and account opening processes in Banking (preferable)


You are:

  • A self-starter who can work well with minimal supervision (you can micromanage yourself).
  • A skilled written and verbal communicator.
  • Can collaborate well with different functions and have the ability to manage stakeholder expectation.
  • A dedicated team player with a can-do attitude and eagerness to learn.
  • An effective worker who is able to multi-task and perform under pressure.


About us

UBS is the world’s largest and only truly global wealth manager. We operate through four business divisions: Global Wealth Management, Personal & Corporate Banking, Asset Management and the Investment Bank. Our global reach and the breadth of our expertise set us apart from our competitors.


With more than 70,000 employees, we have a presence in all major financial centers in more than 50 countries. Do you want to be one of us?


Join us

From gaining new experiences in different roles to acquiring fresh knowledge and skills, at UBS we know that great work is never done alone. We know that it's our people, with their unique backgrounds, skills, experience levels and interests, who drive our ongoing success. Together we’re more than ourselves.


Ready to be part of #teamUBS and make an impact?


Disclaimer / Policy Statements

UBS is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills and experiences within our workforce.


Employees working from UBS Singapore offices must comply with Workforce Vaccination Measures [link removed] as implemented by the Singapore government with effect from 1 January 2022, and other applicable safe management measures as may be amended from time to time..

JOB SUMMARY

Serves as the property Manager on Duty and oversees all property operations, ensuring that the highest levels of hospitality and service are provided. Represents property management in resolving any guest or property related situation. Manages the flow of questions and directs guests within the lobby. Serves as Guest Relations Manager and handles the tracking of service issues.


CORE WORK ACTIVITIES

Supporting Property Operations and Guest Relations Needs

• Maintains a strong working relationship with all departments to support property operations and goals and to expedite the resolution of any problems that may arise through the general operation of the property.

• Communicates any variations to the established norms to the appropriate department in a timely manner.

• Strives to improve service performance.

• Ensures compliance with all policies, standards and procedures.

• Emphasizes guest satisfaction during all departmental meetings and focuses on continuous improvement.


Managing the Guest Experience

• Intervenes in any guest/employee situation as needed to insure the integrity of the property is maintained, guest satisfaction is achieved, and employee well being is preserved.

• Provides immediate assistance to guests as requested.

• Serves as a leader in displaying outstanding hospitality skills.

• Sets a positive example for guest relations.

• Responds to and handles guest problems and complaints.

• Interacts with customers on a regular basis throughout the property to obtain feedback on quality of product, service levels and overall satisfaction.

• Records guest issues in the guest response tracking system.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Beyondsoft International (Singapore) Pte. Ltd. was set up in 2007 and established as the regional headquarters for the Southeast Asia (SEA) and European markets in September 2015. Based on our vision of "Using technology to promote social progress, economic development and become a global customer preferred partner" and our concept of "Beyond your expectations", Beyondsoft is committed to provide our customers in countries along the "Belt and Road" with comprehensive solutions and products and creating commercial value for customers to realizing continuous businesses development.

Our core business includes:

  1. IT development services providing customers with IT consulting, software research and development, software and hardware testing, system integration and operation and maintenance, data analysis and other services;
  2. New retail solutions and products through intelligent products, helping small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) realize the digital transformation of their daily operations;
  3. Internet of Things (IoT) platform and solutions comprehensive use of IoT, artificial intelligence, big data, cloud computing and other technologies to provide IoT solutions for intelligent upgrades in cities, parks, buildings and industries, to create a smart future.

For more information, please visit www.beyondsoft.com.

RESPONSIBILITIES

  • Manage and monitor all installed systems and infrastructure
  • Install, configure, test, and maintain operating systems, application software and system management tools
  • Proactively ensure the highest levels of systems and infrastructure availability
  • Monitor and test application performance for potential bottlenecks, identify possible solutions, and work with developers to implement those fixes
  • Maintain security, backup, redundancy and BCP strategies
  • Participate in the design of information and operational support systems
  • Liaise with vendors and other IT personnel for problem resolution
  • Manage the VMWare environment
  • Provide enterprise-wide support to a high level of Microsoft Windows
  • Support the HPE and Hitachi environments
QUALIFICATIONS
  • Diploma or Bachelors degree in Computer Science/ Information Technology/ Engineering or equivalent
  • Minimum 5 years of knowledge on the following technologies:
  • VMware vCenter: ESXi, SRM, VRM
  • Security operation and technologies such as Privileged Access Management, Endpoint Protection Platform, Firewall
  • System Monitoring
  • Backup And Recovery
  • Windows Server OS with good understanding of Windows AD, DNS, GPO, and Failover Clustering
  • SAN storage with good understanding of remote site replication (Knowledge of administrating Hitachi Virtual Storage Platform would be an added advantage)
  • Possess good understanding of Public Key Infrastructure and Network Access Control
  • Good communication skills and able to work independently
  • Able to provide support in a 24/7 environment and would require to work on-call at least 1 week every month
Please note that your application will be sent to and reviewed by the direct employer - Beyondsoft International (Singapore) Pte Ltd

We are inviting professionals in high-growth industries who are thinking about their next move or looking for a new opportunity to join our expanding talent pool.

The Marlee Talent Pool is a pilot project designed to: Help job seekers get discovered by our partners based on their anticipated hiring needs. Provide optional support and resources for job seekers in their career endeavours. Help individuals understand, and bring out the best in themselves and each other. The Marlee Talent Pool process: Once you express your interest, you will be asked to complete the Marlee work style assessment which measures 48 key attitudes and motivations in the context of work. About Marlee (Fingerprint For Success) Backed by 20+ years of research, Marlee’s revolutionary predictive analytics have achieved over 90% reliability in forecasting personal and team motivations, behaviours, and performance. Ultimately, we help people find purpose and fulfillment at work, and help build and scale high-performing teams.

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Hybrid IT Engineer to manage, maintain, and optimize our Windows-based infrastructure and associated technologies within our hybrid IT environment. The ideal candidate will be responsible for ensuring the health, performance, and security of Windows servers and systems while collaborating with cross-functional teams to implement and support enterprise-wide solutions.  

 

Key Responsibilities: 

Implement and manage Windows-based infrastructure and associated technologies. 

Monitor and maintain the health, performance, and security of Windows servers and systems. 

Administer Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, DHCP, and related services. 

Configure and troubleshoot Hypervisor Nutanix virtualization platforms (e.g., VMware, Hyper-V). 

Install, configure, and manage Windows servers and services, including IIS, SQL Server, Exchange 2019 and Skype 2019 

Collaborate with cross-functional teams to implement and support enterprise-wide solutions. 

Perform routine system and application updates, patches, and upgrades. 

Develop and maintain documentation related to system configurations, processes, and procedures. 

Provide level 2 and level 3 support for Windows-related issues. 

Participate in on-call rotation for after-hours support as needed. 

 Qualifications: 

Bachelor's degree in a relevant field. 

At least 3 to 5 years of experience in administering Windows-based systems and infrastructure. 

Proficiency in Windows Server operating systems (2019). 

Strong understanding of Active Directory, Group Policy, DNS, and DHCP. 

Experience with virtualization platforms such as VMware and Hyper-V. 

Knowledge of scripting languages (e.g., PowerShell) for automation and scripting tasks. 

Familiarity with monitoring tools and systems management solutions. 

Excellent problem-solving and troubleshooting skills. 

Strong communication and interpersonal abilities. 

Certifications such as MCSE, MCSA, or equivalent are a plus. 

 
Additional Preferred Skills: 

Microsoft System Center Suite (SCVMM, SCOM, SCCM, WSUS) 

Exchange 2019 and Skype 2019 administration 

Netbackup 10.x and Data Domain for backup and recovery solutions 

Nutanix HCI for virtualization and storage solutions 

NESSUS for vulnerability assessment 

F5 load balancers and RSA security solutions 

Splunk for log management and data analysis

The Innovation & Entrepreneurship (I&E) Office at NTU is established to consolidate, synergise and coordinate all I&E related engagement, collaborations and communications across all Colleges, Schools and Innovation Drivers in NTU. The Office seeks to accelerate the University’s efforts to translate NTU’s scientific discoveries, innovations and creative work into technological and social entrepreneurship activities that benefit industry and society.

job_title: Senior Officer, Reconciliation, Retail Investment Operations Center
job_ad_details:
About UOB
United Overseas Bank Limited (UOB) is a leading bank in Asia with a global network of more than 500 branches and offices in 19 countries and territories in Asia Pacific, Europe and North America. In Asia, we operate through our head office in Singapore and banking subsidiaries in China, Indonesia, Malaysia and Thailand, as well as branches and offices.Our history spans more than 80 years. Over this time, we have been guided by our values — Honorable, Enterprising, United and Committed. This means we always strive to do what is right, build for the future, work as one team and pursue long-term success. It is how we work, consistently, be it towards the company, our colleagues or our customers.
About the Department
Group Technology and Operations (GTO) provides software and system development, information technology support services and banking operations.We have centralized and standardized the technology components into Singapore, creating a global footprint which can be utilized for supporting our regional subsidiaries and the branches around the world. We operate and support 19 countries with this architecture to provide a secure and flexible banking infrastructure.Our Operations divisions provide transactional customer services for our businesses while also focusing on cost efficiency through process improvements, automation and straight through processing.
Job Responsibilities
1. Custody Reconciliation:
  • Perform daily, monthly and quarterly custody reconciliation for CPFIS/SRS Accounts
  • Identify causes of discrepancies and follow-up with various processing teams
  • Perform investigations of breaks/differences identified and do necessary follow-ups
  • Ensure completeness and accuracy in reconciliation
  • Ensure custody reports are submitted within pre-defined timelines
  • Ensure adherence and compliance to regulatory and internal control requirements
  • Timely escalation of breaks to Department and Division Head and to work towards resolution
 2. MIS:
  • Collate MIS reports for the Division
  • Ensure completeness and accuracy in the MIS reports
  • Submit daily and monthly MIS reports on a timely basis
  • Work closely with internal and external stakeholders to review processes and identify opportunity to streamline the operational workflow and improve overall efficiency
  • Collaborate closely with various functions to review queries, complaints, operational problems to ensure they are resolved promptly and satisfactorily
  • Support business plans and ad-hoc duties assigned by the Head of Department

Job Requirements
  • At least 1-3 years of experience, preferably in custody reconciliation and/or general banking operations
  • High proficiency in Microsoft Office applications with emphasis on Excel as well ability too create Macros
  • Knowledge in investment products (e.g., equity, fixed income, unit trust) will be an advantage
  • Able to work independently and in a team
  • Quick learner and able to multi-task
  • Organized and systematic
  • Able to work under pressure, good analytic skills and good time consciousness
  • Good interpersonal and communication skills (written and verbal)
  • Details-oriented and meticulous

Be a part of UOB Family
UOB is an equal opportunity employer. UOB does not discriminate on the basis of a candidate's age, race, gender, color, religion, sexual orientation, physical or mental disability, or other non-merit factors. All employment decisions at UOB are based on business needs, job requirements and qualifications. If you require any assistance or accommodations to be made for the recruitment process, please inform us when you submit your online application.

Overview

Oracle is a technology leader that’s changing how the world does business. We’re looking for an experienced and self-motivated person. We appreciate you taking the time to review the list of qualifications and to apply for the position. Come and join us!

As Oracle SaaS Customer Success Services (CSS) team, our mission is to ensure the success of our SaaS install base, help our customers drive value from their investment in our SaaS applications while deploying more and expanding their usage. Oracle has the most complete and unified portfolio of modern, cloud based business applications on the planet and a large and successful customer base.

Description

What You’ll Do

The objective of the Customer Success Executive (CSE) is to maximize customer retention and expansion by facilitating activities and guiding them to the solutions value while also driving increased SaaS revenue.  The CSE works at a strategic level across all product pillars in the cloud, leading teams in the delivery and continuous improvement of large scale transformational cloud projects.  In this role you will act as an enabler and trusted advisor to the customer to ensure they remain successful and engaged with their entire Cloud solution so they understand the full value of their investment with Oracle. For this role you will need to be definitive in your goals but flexible in your approach. As part of the role you will continuously improve on your network and internal relationships, working closely with sales, implementation success managers and customer success managers to enable further adoption of Oracle products within your customers.  You are one team, all responsible for delivering value to the customer with strong product knowledge and discovery expertise.

You will be responsible for delivering consistent, adherent and diligent collaboration with the internal stakeholder teams and will work collaboratively with them to deliver activities that fit with the strategic direction of the customer over the entire cloud estate. 

As a Customer Success Executive, you will:

·         Collaborate with the Sales Manager and broader account team to develop and deliver an overall account strategy and plan for the customer, that directs company resources to encourage renewal and return of investment cross pillar.

·         Develop and maintain a continuous close relationship with the relevant Account Team throughout the customer lifecycle.

·         Facilitate relationships across various customer teams, brands, and/or departments to further strengthen Oracle’s partnership with customers.

·         Regularly provide visibility of account at an executive level both internally and externally, defining progress against customers’ business objectives; any metrics that define success to the customer (ROI); and identifying risks and appropriate mitigations.

·         Deliver regular business reviews and success plans to senior executives and key business stakeholders.

·         Coordinate cross pillar activities across the account to ensure significant milestones for your customer such as upgrades, new releases and new features are managed effectively and with no adverse impact on co-existing pillars and identifying lessons learnt for future milestones within or across pillar.

·         Engage and understand the customers cloud strategy within and cross pillar in order to guide the customer by providing resources that can assist their strategic business direction across pillar.

·         Support other CSMs in their role acting as a ‘coach’ in working effectively with the customers support service to ensure it is being effective for enhancement requests and escalations. 

·         Develop a strong relationship with the senior leadership in your customer on a technical and business level.

·         Support in collaborating with Oracle’s Reference team to ensure ‘reference fatigue’ is avoided and customers can take advantage of our reference program.

·         Understand the value of the internal Oracle processes and tools available to assist your search for answers and for pro-active planning.

Required Skills/Experience

What You’ll Bring

You have that rare combination—a sharp technical brain and a head for business. You’ll use this to help customers achieve real-world success with our products. We also look for:

·         Experience in a customer facing role involving cloud based/SaaS technology with collaboration of senior stakeholders.

·         Proven ability to delivery complex projects with multiple internal and external stakeholders.

·         Proven ability to develop and cultivate lasting customer relationships with limited resources.

·         Strong technical understanding around cloud solutions, operating concepts and infrastructure (cloud, integration, lifecycle management etc).

·         Experience in delivering continuous improvement and change effectively to organisations.

·         Project management and delivery including effective risk management skills.

·         Pro-active commercial acumen.

·         Leadership and effective influencing skills.

·         Written and verbally communicate a complex message in a simplistic way.

·         Team working and collaboration.

·         Resilient, managing pressured situations effectively.

·         Confident and engaging presentation skills, personable, positive, approachable & tenacious with effective objection handling skills.

·         Extremely diligent & succinct organisation & communication skills.

·         Strong desire to learn and develop personally.

·         Strong time management work ethic and focus on delivery.

·         Able to travel at short notice 50% of the time.

·         Mirroring & ability to engage and be engaging at all levels.

Drive maximum adoption of Oracle solution and identify/drive product expansion opportunities via high value relationship with the client.

Develop long term partnership with our clients to ensure they remain successful by realizing the full value of their investment with us to ensure client continues/replenish/renews contract with Oracle. Responsible for maintaining a high level of client satisfaction by being a liaison between our clients and Oracle's internal operations. Identify product expansion/up sell opportunities. Work with larger clients. Provide input into the CSM methodology and direction. Act as mentor to newer CSMs on a voluntary basis.

Leading contributor individually and as a team member, providing direction and mentoring to others. Work is non-routine and very complex, involving the application of advanced technical/business skills in area of specialization. Recommended 7 to 10 years of professional experience. Demonstrated experience in implementation or client facing relationship experience. Understanding of various technical architectures and operating systems. Industry experience is desired.

Job Title: Strategy Director (Creative)

Job Description: About Us We are Dentsu Creative. We believe brands aren’t built like they used to be, and audiences aren’t either. Three forces are driving this change. First, most CMOs and CEOs want to acquire more customers with less investment. Second, great brand ads don’t create a great brand experience. Finally, too much of the money being spent by marketers is easily ignored as attention is harder to grasp than ever. We believe you can’t grow a brand if people don’t notice what you create. People don’t see the expected. People don’t see the predictable. The familiar is too often forgotten. Which is why we create The Never Before. The Never Before is the most elusive of ideas. The one you never saw coming, but you will never forget. The kind that turns the expected on its head. The Never Before doesn’t have a template. There are no guidelines. It will make you nervous, good nervous. But if it gets made, it will make everyone else jealous. Yes, people will have ‘concerns’. But that’s how you know you’re close. Because work like this has never been done before. About You Above all, you love it when clients say, “Why haven’t we thought of that before?” after presenting your thinking. You want to be a very senior strategic brain across key accounts in the Dentsu Creative Singapore business. You want to lead the brand and communications strategy for Dentsu Creative clients, in partnership with the client and creative leads. You are knowledgeable in brand management and can apply the proven principles of growth to any category. You are strong at brand diagnostics and turning the findings into effective strategy and tactics. You can help architect long-term business and brand strategies for large clients. You are focused on unearthing and articulating ‘never-before’ insights to inspire world-class creative work. You generate excitement around an array of creative opportunities and champion creativity in the client organization. You know how to champion a brand’s purpose/positioning and ensure that it lives across all key touchpoints and communications. You don’t just make briefs; you shape them and can proactively identify new opportunities for great creative work. You can mentor junior members of the team with clarity and consistency, helping others to grow and develop. You champion a culture of effectiveness, ensuring every dollar spent generates a return. You can command a room, craft a compelling story, sell it, and form long-lasting relationships. Your Partners Chief Strategy Officer ANZ

Client Leads

Chief Creative Officer / Creative Directors

Junior strategists

KPIs Organic Client Growth: >10% per annum (targeting most strategically important growth clients in your portfolio).

Planning Satisfaction Results (TRR): TBC based on client mix.

Net New Client Growth: > value greater than $250K per annum.

2+ pieces of ‘never before’ work – measured by Effies, Lions, Spikes, or Contagious

recognition.

Job Description


The National University of Singapore invites applications for Research Fellow (Metabolic Lab) in the Department of Medicine, Yong Loo Lin School of Medicine. Appointments will be made on a 1- year contract basis renewable.

Purpose of the post


The staff will provide support in managing established research laboratory, in the Department of Medicine, Division of Endocrinology. He/She shall be the overall in charge for lab operations, ensuring strict compliance based on NUS OSHE.


Main Duties and Responsibilities - Research

  • To perform lab experiments and carry out assigned experiments
  • To work on primary human cell culture, molecular biology, biochemistry and microscopy
  • To organise, preserve and present the results of the experiments in a logical manner
  • To properly and systematically record all experiments that have been assigned and their results
  • Modification and validation of methods of scientific research and relevant scientific theories
  • To assist in supervising, training and guiding attachment/undergraduate students where required
  • Work closely with clinicians, specializes in in vivo physiology and metabolic phenotyping in humans
  • To work on the statistical data analysis


Main Duties and Responsibilities - Laboratory

  • Designated Lab Safety Lead and management existing equipment setup
  • To manage and update laboratory safety related documents such as SOPs, Risk assessments, and laboratory personnel safety training certifications
  • Designated Biological and chemical spill responder
  • Designated First aid responder
  • First point of contact for the Institute’s staffs and students on all Safety & Health (S& H) matters, to provide guidance, advice and technical assistance to all related parties to ensure compliance with statutory and other requirements
  • Point of contact for RFM and Department of Medicine safety team on lab safety and lab inspection/audit matters.
  • Lead lab in all lab safety audits
  • Managed disposal of chemical and biohazardous waste
  • Conduct safety briefing for new staffs, students and contractors prior to them starting work in the lab


Main Duties and Responsibilities - Strategy Planning and Development

  • Implement, monitor, plan, coordinate and implement safety management system on site to adopt S&H best practices in the Institute
  • Advise and assist with all licence application/renewal/termination
  • Managed, plan and coordinate equipment maintenance/calibration and service contracts
  • Conduct lab inspection regularly to identify and assess any unsafe condition in the worksite/work practice and to recommend practicable measures to remedy the work condition/practice
  • and any other duties as required


Qualifications


The applicant should:

  • PhD in Science/Biochemistry; major in biology, immunology, biochemistry or other related scientific field
  • Demonstrated basic knowledge and skills in supporting various research activities;
  • Be able to work independently and in a team, have an investigative nature and attention to detail;
  • Relevant clinical research and laboratory experience will be advantageous
  • Self-driven, independent mature worker, who is well-organized and has the ability to multitask.
  • Possess good interpersonal, written and spoken communication skills
  • Independent mature worker who is well-organized and multitask
  • Able to communicate effectively with other members of the study team
  • Strong analytical or quantitative skills
  • Experience in statistical software will be advantageous


Application

Remuneration will be commensurate with the candidate’s qualifications and experience.

Formal application: Please submit your application, indicating current/expected salary, supported by a detailed CV (including personal particulars, academic and employment history, complete list of publications/oral presentations and full contacts of 3 recent referees to this job portal.

Overview / Brief

Louis Dreyfus Company (LDC) is a leading merchant and processor of agricultural goods, leveraging our global reach and extensive asset network to deliver for our customers around the world – safely, responsibly and reliably. Our diversified activities span the entire value chain from farm to fork, across a broad range of business lines. Since 1851, our portfolio has grown to include Oilseeds, Grains, Rice, Global Markets, Finance, Coffee, Cotton, Sugar, Juice and Dairy.

We help feed and clothe some 500 million people every year by originating, processing and transporting approximately 81 million tons of products. Structured as a matrix organization of 6 geographical regions and 10 platforms, LDC is active in over 100 countries and employs some 19 000 people globally.

LDC in South & Southeast Asia

LDC first established a presence in Asia more than 100 years ago with an office opening in Melbourne, Australia in 1913, trading grains to the international market. Our regional headquarters opened in Singapore in 1993, which now serves as the hub for our origination and merchandizing activities in the South & Southeast Asia Region, which spans across 9 platforms – Oilseeds, Grains, Rice, Freight, Global Markets, Coffee, Cotton, Sugar and Dairy – across 7 countries of Singapore, Australia, India, Indonesia, Vietnam, Pakistan, and Malaysia.

Main Responsibilities

Coffee Team is expanding to meet the increasing growing demand in Asia. We are looking at a motivated individual to join the team to help us in expanding our Asia marketing footprint.

Marketing:

  • Responsible for managing relationship with the buyers from the region including pricing, market info, negotiate and conclude contracts
  • Following up and managing physical contracts executions, as well as managing relevant futures pricing.
  • Coordinate commercial activities and participate in discussion involving marketing strategies.
  • Develop good understanding of demand/supply and relay relevant information to the Group.
  • Developing new leads, establish new accounts for the region and may involve for any new developing projects

Research:

  • Hold ownership of research data & perform information verification, processing & analysis.
  • Identify, track product development & trends in the industry
  • Develop tools to improve clarity and information quality for marketing strategies

Trade Admin/Internal Processes:

  • Participate actively on desk processes. Be a force of proposal to develop new tools to improve/automate processes.
  • Support the team through any new processes and take charge of bringing the information to the team.
  • To involve in IT Innovation & transformation, building the team’s competency efficiency on IT processes

Experience

  • 1-3 years’ experience in commodity cash trading and/or marketing
  • Experienced in SEA agriculture commodity market, any prior working experience on Coffee related will be a plus
  • Very strong analytical skills, including excellent handle of Excel & macros, coding skills a plus.
  • Requires entrepreneurial & good interpersonal skills & a team player
  • Possess work ethics and humility, high level of ownership and responsibility.

Languages:

  • Good written and spoken English / Mandarin, additional language command will be a plus

Academics

  • Degree in any relevant academic qualifications

Shopee’s Regional Marketplace Operations department is constantly solving problems and introducing innovative solutions to improve platform usability and enhance end-user experience for our buyers, sellers, and partners.

  • Perform risk-based audit, evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of systems of internal controls of the Group businesses

  • Ability to work effectively as a team player/leader, with excellent analytical skills and the requisite leadership skills to manage detailed/technical work without losing sight of ‘big picture’ issues

Your role

Do you have a strong sense of when things are not as they seem? Do you have a keen eye for detail? We're looking for someone like this to:
• perform and report on periodic controls including review of new and existing clients, and any other ad-hoc reviews through both manual and electronic means, for the purpose of identifying potential money laundering issues, and assisting suspicious transaction reporting with the local authorities
• perform exposure checks in relation to emerging risk themes and sanctions developments and co-operate with counterparts in other locations within and outside of APAC
• perform compliance screening matters and make sure transactions comply with international regulatory lists, sanctions and legal requirements
• perform the preparation/follow-up on internal/external audit and regulatory inspection and management information relevant for financial crime prevention taxonomy
• provide AML compliance advice / training to the Business and Support functions with respect to due diligence/KYC standards and on applicable internal policies/local regulations

Your Career Comeback

We are open to applications from career returners. Find out more about our program on ubs.com/careercomeback.

Your team

You will join as part of the Financial Crime Prevention team within Compliance & Operational Risk Control. This team comprises of both Due Diligence Officers (DDO) and our Financial Intelligence Unit. We work as a gatekeeper in preventing money laundering, corruption and the financing of terrorism (AML/CFT) for the bank.

Your expertise

• a graduate degree with minimal 2 years of relevant experience
• previous compliance or audit experience in the area of Anti-money Laundering. Experience pertaining to private banking or wealth management would be highly preferred.
• knowledge of various legal entities, trust structure and fund structure set ups.

You are:
• proactive and able to work independently
• known for having a strong attention to detail and strong research capability.

Join us

The Investment Counselor is a strategic professional who stays abreast of developments within own field and contributes to directional strategy by considering their application in own job and the business. Recognized technical authority for an area within the business. Requires basic commercial awareness. There are typically multiple people within the business that provide the same level of subject matter expertise. Developed communication and diplomacy skills are required in order to guide, influence and convince others, in particular colleagues in other areas and occasional external customers. Significant impact on the area through complex deliverables. Provides advice and counsel related to the technology or operations of the business. Work impacts an entire area, which eventually affects the overall performance and effectiveness of the sub-function/job family. The Private Bank at Citi (CPB) is part of the Institutional Clients Group and offers a wide range of products and solutions, including investment strategies, banking and lending, trust and specialized services. The Private Bank delivers solutions to help meet the individual, family and business needs of over 10,000 ultra-high net worth clients around the world. The Private Bank is focused on clients with a minimum net worth of $25mm and serves 40% of the world’s billionaires and their families.

 

Responsibilities

  • Investment Counselors joining Citi Private Bank will be distinguished and highly accomplished at establishing, growing and managing investment relationships with ultra-high net worth clients. They should be experienced in the implementation and oversight of investment solutions, and in providing advice and guidance on markets and actionable investment ideas. Appropriate candidates will possess the credibility to cultivate trusting relationships with existing ultra-high net worth clients of Citi Private Bank, and should be entrepreneurial and capable of bringing in new clients/investment relationships. Candidates for the position should be collaborative and team oriented, able to leverage a wide array of internal partners.
  • An individual in this role will be expected to:
  • Function as the primary client contact and trusted investment advisor for clients, including direct selling , determining suitability, identifying product specific opportunities, portfolio advice and after sales execution (in partnership with the Banker team)
  • Leverage existing client relationships, local network and investment experience to introduce new ultra-high net worth clients to Citi Private Bank.
  • Build and manage a successful practice centered on deepening relationships by providing potential and existing clients with appropriate investment advice and solutions.
  • Combine in depth knowledge of traditional and alternative investments with wealth planning and private banking services to optimize client service and cross-marketing opportunities.
  • Work across currencies, asset classes, markets and jurisdictions
  • Engage and advise clients on brokerage activity and execute trades seamlessly.
  • Actively look for cross sell opportunities in others areas of the bank, in particular lending, trust and institutional markets solutions, etc.
  • Partner with Bankers to prospect for new investment business
  • Appropriately assess risk when business decisions are made, demonstrating particular consideration for the firm's reputation and safeguarding Citigroup, its clients and assets, by driving compliance with applicable laws, rules and regulations, adhering to Policy, applying sound ethical judgment regarding personal behavior, conduct and business practices, and escalating, managing and reporting control issues with transparency.

Qualifications

  • 6-10 years of experience
  • Robust experience in providing investment advice and solutions.
  • CFA
  • Requires good analytical skills in order to filter, prioritize and validate potentially complex material from multiple sources. Exercises wide degree of latitude and discretion.

Education

  • Bachelor's/University degree, Master's degree preferred

About us

Dyson is a global technology enterprise. We solve the problems others choose to ignore, with surprising new inventions that defy convention and simply work better. We’re driven by progress and thrive on the challenge of relentless improvement. We’re growing fast and our ambition is huge – more categories, more locations and more people.

Our scale and rapid growth make Dyson rich in new opportunities. We value new ideas and diverse perspectives, so our people are trusted with real work and responsibility from the outset. You’ll develop fast and have the chance to move into different business areas and regions. And you’ll be part of a global network of like-minded people – a community that supports and learns from each other.

At Dyson we are encouraged to think differently, challenge convention and be unafraid to make mistakes. We’re creative, collaborative, practical and enthusiastic, but most of all we’re hugely passionate about what we do. We are looking for individuals who wish to invent, design and develop leading products for the global market. By working in our world class Research Design and Development department, these individuals have the opportunity to work alongside other leading technical specialists and highly motivated creative people, to develop products which fulfill our ambition of being truly different and better than our competitors.

About the role

Dyson has an opportunity for Senior Power Electronics Engineers to join the highly successful Power Electronics and Energy Storage group. The Power Electronics and Energy Storage group is a global and multidisciplinary team responsible for the development of the driver of Dyson Digital Motors and Lithium Ion battery management. Dyson Digital Motors are small and light, yet extremely powerful; they power the next generation of handheld vacuum cleaners as well as the Supersonic which is revolutionizing hair care. Dyson battery management systems provide the high-power energy sources required to power the category leading cord free and robot products. As part of this group, we are looking to expand our Power Electronics capability in SEA. Some of your tasks could include:

  • Create and implement world leading designs to produce high quality products.
  • Design of mains, electronic drivers and battery powered electronics to meet global product requirements.
  • Develop, test and document designs using best engineering practice.
  • Take an active approach in the generation of ideas.
  • Communicate with other teams to ensure effective project delivery.
About you
  • Degree or equivalent experience in electronic engineering or comparable discipline.
  • Desirably 3 years working experience in the electronic design industry or similar environment.
  • Experience in the design and development of drivers, inverters, SMPS, and power electronics products.
  • Experience in Battery Management System and Secondary Battery Technologies is a plus.
  • Ability to work within a global and multidisciplinary team.
  • Able to communicate complex ideas to a range of experts in different fields.
  • Good understanding of basic principles of semiconductor devices such as MOSFET, BJT and diode.
  • Good understanding in writing test methods and conducting electronic tests in the laboratory.
  • Experience with circuit simulation and analysis.
  • Experience with PCB/schematic capture tools.
  • Able to understand the Schematic diagram and PCB layout.
  • Fluent in spoken and written English.
  • Demonstrate strong communication skills, interpersonal skills and the ability to work independently and in a team.
  • Innovative problem solver willing to search for creativity.
Benefits

Dyson Singapore monitors the market to ensure competitive salaries and bonuses. Beyond that, you’ll enjoy a transport allowance and comprehensive medical care and insurance. But financial benefits are just the start of a Dyson career. Professional growth, leadership development and new opportunities abound, driven by regular reviews and dynamic workshops. And with a vibrant culture, the latest devices and a relaxed dress code reflecting our engineering spirit, it’s an exciting team environment geared to fuelling and realising ambition.
