job_title: Java Standard Edition Developer | Temporary Work From Home Assignment*
job_ad_details:
Ready to join Accenture’s team of empowered people? We’re looking for candidates with the following skills and experience for this role. Do you fit the profile? If you do, we’d love to hear from you!
 
Get hired and enjoy a joining bonus when you become part of Accenture! We're offering up to Php80,000 joining bonus* to qualified applicants who will onboard for select Tech roles in Cebu and Manila! Plus, get a chance to win one (1) of the two (2) lucky winners of PHP 25,000 worth of SM shopping vouchers if you get hired on/before June 30, 2022
 
In adherence to Accenture’s process of Identity Verification, your resume or CV must include your photo to ensure the accuracy of your application.
 
Responsibilities:
  • Designs, codes or configures, tests, debugs, deploys, documents, and maintains web service applications using a variety of software development toolkits, testing/verification applications and other tools, while adhering to specific development best practices and quality standards.
  • Gathers business requirements, translating that information into detailed technical specifications from which programs will be written or configured, and validating that the proposed applications align with both the architectural design and the business needs.
  • Responsible for troubleshooting and issue analysis, as well as coding, testing, and implementing software enhancements.
Qualifications:
  • Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology, Computer Science or other relevant fields
  • Minimum of 1-2 years of experience in Java Standard Edition
  • Knowledgeable in software development design patterns
Nice to have:
  • Experience using Eclipse, Intelli-J, DB Design, UML Designs Write, UML Design Read, Jenkins, Junit, Docker
Join our high-performing team and enjoy these benefits:
  • Health Insurance (HMO) & Life Insurance coverage from day 1 of employment
  • Expanded maternity leave up to 120 days*
  • Expanded paternity leave up to 30 days*
  • Employee Stock Purchase Plan
  • Loyalty and Christmas Gift
  • Inclusion and Diversity Benefits
  • Night Differential
  • Allowances
  • Car and Housing Plan
  • Company-sponsored trainings, upskilling, and certification
  • Flexible Working Arrangements
  • Healthy and Encouraging Work Environment
  • *Work from home set-up until end of the year or depends on project assignment
TERMS AND CONDITIONS
The company provides an equal opportunity employment and welcomes applications from all sections of society and does not discriminate on grounds of race, religion or belief, ethnic or national origin, disability, age, citizenship, marital, domestic or civil partnership status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or any other basis as protected by applicable law.
 
Additional Information:
 
The following documents will be asked as part of the pre-hiring requirements prior onboarding. We recommend to prepare the requirements early to ensure on time onboarding. Detailed discussion will take place during onboarding process as well as changes on the requirements as needed.
  • Transcript of Records (TOR)
  • Diploma (for graduates only) and/or Certificate of Graduation
  • Certificate of Employment (COE) and/or SSS Employment History
  • Government Documents:
    • SSS ID and/or SSS Verification Form
    • SSS Statement of Account (SOA)
    • SSS Certificate of Contribution
    • Pag-IBIG Member’s Data Record (MDR)
    • Philhealth ID and/or Philhealth Member Data Record (MDR)
    • TIN ID and/or Processed BIR Form 1905 or any BIR documents reflecting your TIN and with BIR Stamped
    • NSO Birth Certificate

PRIMARY JOB FUNCTIONS:

  • A Promodiser is the working, moving force of sales that gives a lively image to a product through better product exposures and displays in stores with the intention of maximizing product awareness and Offtake.
  • Should be able to achieve his individual quota and optimizing sales opportunity thru effect selling and promoting the products.
  • Performs an important function of ensuring the availability of the complete lines of products in the shelves within easy reach of the consumers.

SPECIFIC DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

1. To achieve, daily, weekly and monthly sales quota by applying aggressive, consistent and persuasive selling techniques.

2. To create and maintain prominent, interesting and dominant mass display or shelf display of assigned products in the assigned supermarket or outlet in accordance with agreed merchandising guidelines.

3. Ensure that the maximum number of product and sizes are prominently and creatively displayed. Always look for opportunities to increase facings of the client’s product at all times.

4. Maintain product hygiene of all assigned products in the display area at all times ensuring that products are kept clean and presentable to consumers.

5. Conduct regular count of inventory in the warehouse and selling area and submit the merchandiser’s weekly inventory and off-take report and all other reporting requirements on due date.

6. Prevent stock run-outs by regularly replenishing stocks in the selling area and informing the coordinator concerned of any stocks at critical level.

7. Monitor batches of products and account for expiring or damaged stocks for possible withdrawal or reassignment and inform the coordinator concerned for prompt action.

8. Maintain an effective system of controlling quality of merchandise using First-In, First Out (FIFO) method of inventory control.

9. Assist in special sales promotion (bundling activities, raffle draws, etc.) which may be implemented from time-to-time.

10. Be observant for any competitive promotion or sales activities and provide immediate feedback to the coordinator concerned.

11. Maintain the secrecy of any privileged information or marketing plans which are considered confidential.

12. Observe punctuality in reporting and always be present in his assigned outlets.

13. Wear the prescribed uniform at all times. Conduct himself at work in a behaved manner within the bounds of company policies and procedures.

job_title: Dispatcher Officer - CEBU CITY (FREE STAFF HOUSE)
job_ad_details:
Every role in SEAOIL contributes significantly to the company. Here’s a summary of what you will be doing in this job:


1. Processes documents of all approved fuel sales orders (SO's) and ensures that tank trucks move out of the terminal on scheduled or within the delivery lead time.

2. Ensures accurate and on-time shipping of actual sales orders in the online system."



Success in this role will require you to fulfill the following responsibilities:


Preloading

1. Confirms from the Product Inventory Assistant the actual availability of products on each corresponding source tank.

2. Secures and validates the attendance list of trucks.

3. Reports to the Road Transport Scheduler the available trucks and discrepancies in the preliminary match if any.

4. Prepares truck loading line up based on the delivery schedule and time log arrival of trucks.

5. Prepares the Releasing and Receiving Inspection Checklist (RRIC).


Loading

1. Prepares the delivery documents and issues the security seals.

2. Coordinates and verifies with the Product Inventory Assistant the availability and source of fuel products from the online system.

3. Ship confirms through Shipping Transactions module all dispatched fuel Sales Orders according to each product and volume descriptions.


Postloading

1. Conducts inspection of the quantity and quality of product loaded in the tank truck prior its release.

2. Releases loaded tank trucks cleared for dispatch.

3. Updates the Dispatcher's Report.

4. Monitors and transmits acknowledged Delivery Receipt (DR).


Other Functions

1. Monitors utilization and ensures availability of adequate security seals and dispatching forms.

2. Performs other related tasks that may be assigned from time to time.

3. Responsible in ensuring that DoS agreement reached between a ship and either a port facility or another ship with which it interfaces, specifying the security measures each will be implemented.

4. Understand environmental aspects of their function and perform in accordance to meet quality and environmental objectives.


Qualifications:

College graduate, preferably with a degree in Engineering

With more than 1 year of relevant experience preferably from other industries.

Willing to be assigned in Ludo Depot, Cebu.

Willing to work during Weekdays and Saturdays

Amenable to work on a shifting schedule


Skills:

  • Adept in in MS Office, Email, G-drive, Spreadsheets, Communication tools .
  • Demonstrates strong communication, Problem Solving, Adaptability, Teamwork.
  • Above average verbal and written communication skills.
  • Working knowledge of web-based Google Workspace (formerly, G Suite, and comprises of spreadsheets, documents, and presentations).


Expectations from Candidates:


Candidates who are invited for HR screening will need to undergo and pass an online exam and/or technical exam, and accomplish HR documents, personality tests, and essay exams before proceeding to the HR interview.


Candidates who pass the HR interview would then need to submit soft copies of their available pre-employment requirements, such as the Transcript of Records, Diploma, and NBI clearance. The complete list will be provided by the recruiter.


In the event candidates are hired, they would be required to submit hard copies of all the pre-employment requirements and pass the medical exam and background check before on-boarding.



Benefits of Working in the Company:


1. Office-based positions can enjoy the privilege of working from home during the pandemic

2. Employees will have the opportunity to be trained by our in-house training team and subject matter experts

3. Early regularization opportunity

4. Family-oriented culture

WSP, a world leading management and consultancy firm, currently have an exciting opportunity for a HR Administrator to join their HR Shared Services team.

The role of the HR Administrator is to provide a support to the HR team and the business, this includes documentation, and maintenance of the HRIS.

Main Activities and Responsibilities: (including but not limited to)

  • Maintaining HR data in UBW
  • Producing paperwork for Employees based on life-cycle changes such as Salary changes, change in hours, terminations, Change in Employment, COE and other administrative task request etc.
  • Maintaining employee files and proper filing of employee documents
  • Handle the enrolment and deletion of Insurance and HMO and to ensure
  • Ticket management
  • Assist in completion of Monthly Payroll Advice for processing
  • Proper communications with Exit employees with proper completion of Exit Clearance and documents
  • Assisting AU employees with other HR Shared Services Task.

Qualifications (Minimum and Desirable):

  • Desirable – Certification in Administrative role or equivalent
  • Minimum 1-2 years experience
  • Desirable – Shared Service experience
  • Knowledgeable in DOLE policies
  • Knowledgeable in handling end to end process of payroll and benefits.


Experience, skills and organisational knowledge

  • Experience in data entry and maintenance of employee records ensuring accuracy and timely entry of transactions
  • Experience in providing efficient onboarding processes, including working collaboratively with other departments e.g. IT and Payroll
  • Developing proficiency in UBW, Excel, Word, OneDrive and HR/System Tools


What you'll love about us:


At WSP, we provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many personal and professional development opportunities that are aimed to help you deliver your best self to the role whilst managing your personal life in balance. We have been recognised for the second consecutive year as a Great Place to Work® with year-on-year increases in employee engagement.

Come join Analog Devices (ADI) – a place where Innovation meets Impact. For more than 55 years, Analog Devices has been inventing new breakthrough technologies that transform lives. At ADI you will work alongside the brightest minds to collaborate on solving complex problems that matter from autonomous vehicles, drones and factories to augmented reality and remote healthcare.

ADI fosters a culture that focuses on employees through beneficial programs, aligned goals, continuous learning opportunities, and practices that create a more sustainable future. 

ADI At A Glance

Analog Devices, Inc. (NASDAQ: ADI) is a global semiconductor leader that bridges the physical and digital worlds to enable breakthroughs at the Intelligent Edge. ADI combines analog, digital, and software technologies into solutions that help drive advancements in digitized factories, mobility, and digital healthcare, combat climate change, and reliably connect humans and the world. With revenue of more than $12 billion in FY23 and approximately 26,000 people globally working alongside 125,000 global customers, ADI ensures today’s innovators stay Ahead of What’s Possible. Learn more at www.analog.com and on LinkedIn and Twitter (X)

Be part of ADGT Global Failure Analysis department and help ADI’s internal and external customers resolve product quality issues. Provide the highest quality services through investigations into device performance and failures.

Key Qualification:

  • Strong knowledge in circuit analysis and in data analysis
  • Capable of interpreting datasheet specifications and translating these in working bench setups
  • Has sense of continuous improvement by identifying and working on gaps into the existing process to achieve department goals


Education & Experience:

  • Degree in Engineering particularly Electronics and Communications Engineering (ECE) or Electrical Engineering (EE)
  • Experience in similar or related field, preferred but not required

Additional Requirements:

  • Knowledgeable in programming on Labview or Python
  • Good verbal and written communication skills

For positions requiring access to technical data, Analog Devices, Inc. may have to obtain export  licensing approval from the U.S. Department of Commerce - Bureau of Industry and Security and/or the U.S. Department of State - Directorate of Defense Trade Controls.  As such, applicants for this position – except US Citizens, US Permanent Residents, and protected individuals as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3) – may have to go through an export licensing review process.

job_title: Senior Producer - Graphic Design Specialist - Verizon
job_ad_details:
When you join Verizon Verizon is one of the world’s leading providers of technology and communications services, transforming the way we connect around the world. We’re a human network that reaches across the globe and works behind the scenes. We anticipate, lead, and believe that listening is where learning begins.

In crisis and in celebration, we come together—lifting up our communities and striving to make an impact to move the world forward. If you’re fueled by purpose, and powered by persistence, explore a career with us. Here, you’ll discover the rigor it takes to make a difference and the fulfillment that comes with living the #NetworkLife.

The Sr. Producer - Graphic Design role is responsible for playing key roles in developing unique and engaging experiences for our Learning and Development organization such as serving key stakeholders and driving innovation, making design decisions and recommendations,  and ultimately inspiring  others to deliver exceptional results that will directly impact the business. We are looking for someone who thrives in a fast-paced, opaque environment, who knows how to extract and understand a client’s needs and take ownership for the development of all deliverables.

Someone who can manage multiple projects with multiple stakeholders within a dynamic cross functional organization. Someone with an infectious, passionate spirit. Who knows how to excite people and get them to feel something; who is agile; who will always be able to adapt to changing landscapes because of a passion for learning.

Who’s excited to partner with some of the smartest clients out there. A collaborator, but just as comfortable on solo missions. A great teammate.

Someone who can manage up, down and side-to-side. Whose leaders have confidence in them, whose juniors are inspired by them, and who strives to operate in harmony with their cross functional counterparts.   Responsibilities Demonstrate exceptional design ability and creative vision.

Ability to fully understand client needs, provide independent or collaborative strategic direction, and take responsibility / ownership for development of deliverables. Collaborates creatively across other media and creative teams within Learning and Development and corporate. Demonstrates an ability to envision, develop, and support a clear creative vision with multiple partners and clients.

Ability to effectively manage multiple projects/tasks of varying complexities, meet deadlines, and work well under pressure. Delivers projects on time. Ability to work both independently and collaboratively Gather information and research as needed for projects.

Communicates challenges and opportunities regarding project details to appropriate team members. Must demonstrate strong production abilities, work ethic, and attention-to-detail Ability to regularly and confidently present concepts and campaigns to clients and leadership. Obtains required approvals on all projects.

Direct photo shoots Coordinates the use of resources such as photography, video, illustrations, copywriting, and outsourcing. Mentor, educate, and support other Visual Designers in both creative and technical areas. Continually evaluate and collaborate to improve creative and technical processes.

Interpret corporate brand identity and guidelines and implement them in projects balanced with the ability to know when and how to stretch those guidelines when appropriate.   You’ll Need to

Have… BFA, BA or other advanced degree in graphic design, digital design, motion graphics 3-6 years agency, in-house or learning and development experience as a creative. Strong knowledge of digital and print production. Mastery of Photoshop, Illustrator and InDesign.

Able to generate new assets as well as edit existing assets including photographs Able to craft a deck. Willing to use Powerpoint and Microsoft Office to communicate. Can wield the written word to sell an idea.

Can think in terms of big ideas - as well as the tactics that fall underneath it. Emotionally intelligent with management potential. Even

Better if You Have… A background in Art Direction with design skills.

Prior experience in a learning and development organization is a plus Experience with Captivate, Storyline, Premiere, After Effects, LMS systems, SCORM compliance, audio production desirable. Web development experience and UX/UI experience is a plus. Has a diversified background and a variety of interests to draw inspiration from.

Skills Design principles: composition, color theory, alignment, texture, scale, framing, harmony, dominance & emphasis, etc. Ideation Branding UX Design Needs Analysis Client Relations Negotiation Communication Collaboration Time management Portfolio management

Where you’ll be working…  This position will be Hybrid  and can be based from any valid [country location]. Hybrid w/ expectation of 3 days in office and two days work from home. Travel:  up to 50% as needed; Schedule: willing to work flexible hours including evenings & weekends

Where you’ll be working In this hybrid role, you'll have a defined work location that includes work from home and assigned office days set by your manager. Scheduled Weekly Hours 40 Diversity and Inclusion

We’re proud to be an equal opportunity employer. At Verizon, we know that diversity makes us stronger. We are committed to a collaborative, inclusive environment that encourages authenticity and fosters a sense of belonging.

We strive for everyone to feel valued, connected, and empowered to reach their potential and contribute their best. Check out our diversity and inclusion page to learn more.

job_title: Start your career with us at Concentrix Eastwood - Non Voice Account - 23K/Month
job_ad_details:
Why Concentrix:
Prepare for a game-changing career adventure filled with fun, growth, and endless possibilities!
As a five billion-dollar publicly traded company (CNXC), we know that when we put our people first, business thrives. You'll find the runway and resources to build the career you've always imagined.
At Concentrix, we celebrate diversity, empower our people, and provide unwavering support. We're not just a team; we're your dedicated squad on the path to greatness. We proudly hold the certification as a Great Place to Work, a testament to our unwavering commitment to foster a positive workplace culture. 
Join us! Together, we will continue to reshape the CX industry. 


Your Role as a Customer Experience (CX) Advisor

As a Customer Experience (CX) Advisor, you hold a crucial position in ensuring that our clients' customers receive exceptional experience. Your primary responsibility is to address their needs and concerns promptly and professionally, leaving a lasting positive impression.

To achieve this, your excellent communication skills will be put to use. Active listening, empathy, and effective communication are key. Consistently delivering high-quality service and exceeding expectations are vital for success. 

If you're passionate about CX and making a game-changing difference, start your journey now.

You are a perfect fit for the position if you:

• Are a college graduate with or without a background in the Customer Experience (CX) industry
• Have at least six (6) months of background in the Customer Experience (CX) industry
• Have good English communication skills
• Have excellent customer service, problem-solving, and multitasking skills
• Have superb computer skills
• Are willing to work on shifting schedule


Company Overview:
We’re a leading global provider of customer experience (CX) solutions and technology. We create game-changing customer journeys for our people and our clients and their customers. 
With the help of over 440,000 global game-changers, our business is borderless. We support more than 2000 of the world's best brands and dream up the CX tech and innovations of tomorrow. Across 70+ countries and six continents, we provide services across key industry verticals including technology & consumer electronics; retail, travel & ecommerce; banking, financial services & insurance; healthcare; communications & media; automotive; and energy & public sector. With 155+ clients on the Fortune Global 500 list, we are undeniably the future of CX.
Our people around the world have devoted their careers to ensuring every relationship is exceptional. So naturally, we're committed to creating game-changing career journeys that power our people towards greater opportunities and brighter futures. 
Like and follow us on Facebook and TikTok @ConcentrixPH or visit www.concentrix.com to learn more about us.

We are Cambridge University Press & Assessment, a world-leading academic publisher and assessment organisation, and a proud part of the University of Cambridge.
 
We are recruiting for a Technical Support Analyst who will be part of our Global Technical Support team.  This team is responsible for resolving technical support issues involving Cambridge digital products and platforms within Australia business hours as reported by our external and internal customers.
 
Why should you join Cambridge?

Our mission is to contribute to society through the pursuit of education, learning, and research at the highest international levels of excellence. Which is why every year, we give vital support to millions of people in more than 170 countries around the world. From teachers and learners to researchers and academics, we help to build confidence, unlock potential, and enable success. We give people the opportunity to show what they've learnt, we spread knowledge, spark enquiry, and aid understanding.
 
We achieve this by embracing change, and continuously focusing on our customers' needs. And by collaborating, and carefully listening to our customers and to each other, we keep moving forward, keep innovating, and keep finding newer and better ways of doing things.
 
When you join Cambridge, you get the best possible combination of a supportive, caring environment, balanced with work that brings out the best in you. You will have access to learning and development opportunities, and business tools essential for your role so that you can perform at your peak.
 
What can we offer you?
 
The key to our work is our colleagues, whose shared commitment enables us to have an ever-greater impact. We are a united, vibrant, and respectful global community of people, and we ensure that every individual is recognised, listened to, and cared for. And because our impact is amplified when our people are empowered, we give everyone the opportunity to develop in their own way. Whether you want a career that's linear, or want to follow your own path, we'll support you, and help give you the resources and training you'll need to be bold and take ownership of what you do.
 
This role will provide you with opportunities to have meaningful and productive interactions with customers from across the globe by providing them with the support and resolution for their concerns. The 12-month project is designed to hone your skills in analysis and people-interaction and technical support.
 
On top of these, working with Cambridge will also give you stability. We show our care for our people by allowing them to grow not just professionally but also personally. We promote work-life balance through flexible work schedules, hybrid work arrangements, and generous paid leaves. In addition, you will be entitled to our health care benefits, group life insurance, and robust wellbeing programs right on the first day of joining us.
 
What will you do in this role?
 
The Technical Support Analyst role will be tasked with providing technical support to our external customers (administrators, users and teacher) and Cambridge Sales and CS Teams for one or more business streams. You will be investigating issues to provide successful resolution and liaise with senior technical team members.
 
You would also be expected to manage a technical investigation in the following ways:
  • Accepting the customer's issue and gathering the technical information
  • Responsible for resolving basic customer issues.
  • Analyze the symptoms of a technical problem to identify the underlying problem.
  • Dealing with any queries and resolving them on a timely basis.
  • What makes you the ideal candidate for this position?
  • Our ideal candidate is someone with strong English communication skills and a Technical Support background. You are our ideal candidate if you are a team player, computer literate, possess a confident telephone manner, and have good attention to detail.
  • Amenable to work for the project until March 202
  • Previous experience in a technical support or customer service role
  • Effective time management skills.
  • Experience with Microsoft Office and Excel.
Cambridge University Press & Assessment is committed to being a place where anyone can enjoy a successful career, where it's safe to speak up, and where we learn continuously to improve together. We welcome applications from all candidates, regardless of demographic characteristics (age, disability, educational attainment, ethnicity, gender, marital status, neurodiversity, religion, sex, and sexual identity), cultural, or social class/background.
 
We believe that diversity of thought, background, and approach create better outcomes. More importantly, fostering an inclusive culture is the right thing to do, and it's part of how we achieve our purpose: to contribute to society through the pursuit of education, learning and research at the highest international levels of excellence. Ensuring that anyone, no matter who they are, feels they belong here is an essential part of who we are and the contribution we make to society, and to our planet.
 
To enable an environment which our people can thrive in, our customers benefit from, and where work complements life, we empower everyone to manage their time and capacity, and to prioritise their wellbeing. That's why from day one everyone at Cambridge University Press & Assessment can discuss flexible working options to find the best solution for them and their role.

Acquire BPO is an award-winning, global business outsourcer with 8,500+ staff operating out of Class A offices in 16 locations across the Philippines, Australia, the Dominican Republic and the US, as well as from comprehensive Work-from-Home environments, where client-permitted. We are one of the fastest-growing BPO companies and Australia’s largest outsourcer to the Philippines.   We have 15-years’ experience delivering intelligent contact center and back-office functions for global businesses across many industries including telecommunications, banking and financial services, insurance, media, education and retail. We're recognized as being Safe, Flexible and Innovative, giving our clients the capability to Outsource with confidence.   As a dynamic organization with the ability to take your career to the next level, we're looking for strong candidates to join our team and partner with one of the biggest cloud communications companies in the world - RingCentral. We value our employees highly and, as such, offer excellent career development programs and competitive compensation and benefits packages.   RingCentral is the global leader in cloud-based communications and collaboration software. We are fundamentally changing the nature of human interaction—giving people the freedom to connect powerfully and personally from anywhere, at any time, on any device.   We’re a $1.5 billion company that’s growing at 30+% annually and we’re expanding our Acquisition Ops Team to make sure we stay ahead of the competition.   Acquire BPO is currently looking for a Project Manager to support us, RingCentral.  Responsibilities:

  • Create and maintain process flow charts on, but not limited to, Sales Transformation processes 
  • Create/maintain Sales Transformation self-serve documents and team SharePoint/Wiki sites. 

 Essential Skills: 

  • Confirmed 2-3 years' work experience in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) especially on Salesforce and in a Portfolio/Program/Project Management Office

  • Confirmed 2-3 years' experience working in a Project, Program or Portfolio Management Office

Job Description

Dispensing Pharmacist

Job Qualifications

1. Male/ Female
2. Graduate of BS Pharmacy
3. With experience in a pharmaceutical laboratory is an advantage
***email resume at nmroselyn.fbichr@gmail.com

Compensation

15,000 - 20,000 starting salary

Compensation Range

₱15,000 - ₱20,000

Project Overview


Do you know what IT consultants dread when it comes to their day-to-day tasks? Completing detailed and descriptive timesheets! But, for Project Managers, timesheets are the holy grail of forecasting team bandwidth and capacity to take on additional projects, which the management also uses for billing customers. Unfortunately, timesheets are so time-consuming and repetitive that IT consultants often do not stick to them, leading to incomplete or incorrect submissions. As a Product Manager, you have been given the challenge of making this process less painful for everyone involved. Your mission, should you choose to accept it, is to understand the target customer base, their needs, and challenges, and come up with expected solutions. Get ready to put your detective skills to the test as you conduct a thorough problem validation by talking to the right audience and uncovering their pain points in detail.


Project Mentor


Indrajeet Kumar


Senior Marketing Manager


Project Tasks


To begin solving the challenge at hand, you will undertake the following steps;


Part #1


Problem Validation


You will start by identifying companies that use timesheet management applications and analyzing their pros and cons. Using secondary research and internal data, you will identify the target customer base and evaluate competitors with a SWOT analysis.


Part #2


Customer Experience Analysis


Next, you will collect feedback from IT consultants and project managers to create detailed customer profiles and empathy maps. By understanding the top pain points of your target audience, you will create a solution map that will wow your customers.


Part #3


Problem Areas And Benefits


Analyze all of your research and feedback to determine the three core problem areas that need to be solved. By identifying the benefits of solving these problems, you will create a clear value proposition document that will make impress customers. Get ready to become a problem-solving superstar!


Project Takeaways

  • Conduct problem validation.
  • Perform end-to-end customer experience analysis.
  • Develop an analytical mindset.
  • Get feedback from marketing experts.
  • Earn a certificate upon completing the project.


How will this project help you?


This project will empower you to:

  • Showcase employers your ability to understand user needs and pain points.
  • Employ the right techniques to get insights from users.
  • Demonstrate your ability to identify opportunities.
  • Prove that you can create the customer profile map and empathy map effectively
  • Improve project management skills.

财务（经理）岗位要求

6、工作认真细致、责任心强、品行端正。

Độ tuổi 21-28 tuổi;
Do phát sóng nên yêu cầu phần trên không có hình xăm, không có sẹo hoặc khuyết điểm nhìn thấy được.
Sức khỏe tốt, thị lực bình thường;
Giọng nói to, rõ ràng.
Chào đón người mới, công ty đào tạo đầy đủ về chuyên môn và được hưởng mọi quyền lợi như chính thức trong thời gian thử việc.

job_title: Program Rozwojowy dla Absolwentów (Managerial Trainee Program)
job_ad_details:
Job Title
Program Rozwojowy dla Absolwentów (Managerial Trainee Program) Job Description

Czy chcesz rozpocząć swoją karierę w jednej z najbardziej zrównoważonych firm na świecie? Chcesz mieć szybki rozwój zawodowy i otrzymać propozycję objęcia stanowiska mid-seniora po 2 latach? Oto okazja!

Dołącz do naszego Programu: Managerial Trainee w Signify Piła

Praca w Signify oznacza bycie kreatywnym. Nasza kultura ciągłego uczenia się oraz zaangażowanie w różnorodność i integrację tworzą środowisko, które pozwala Ci budować swoje umiejętności i karierę. Razem przekształcamy naszą branżę.

Jako światowy lider w dziedzinie oświetlenia, nieustannie wyprzedzamy trendy. Dzięki naszemu przywództwu w dziedzinie zintegrowanego oświetlenia i Internetu Rzeczy, przełamujemy nowe granice w zakresie analityki danych, AI oraz inteligentnych domów, biur, miast i nie tylko!

Signify jest jedną z niewielu firm na świecie, która osiągnęła neutralność węglową, a nasze kolejne cele w zakresie zrównoważonego rozwoju są jeszcze śmielsze: podwojenie naszego pozytywnego wpływu na środowisko i społeczeństwo do 2025 roku.

Co będziesz robić...

Będziesz współpracować w ramach naszych biznesów w Pile (Signify Electronics, Hue Connected, Digital Solutions) w obszarach inżynierii, łańcucha dostaw, jakości, lean i produkcji, na zasadzie rotacji przez 2 lata.

Będziesz skupiać się na:

  • Realizacji projektów i wyzwań w obszarze produkcji /przemysłu lub logistyki
  • Utrzymywaniu ścisłej współpracy z Partnerami Biznesowymi na różnych szczeblach w organizacji
  • Zdobywaniu praktycznego doświadczenia np. w zakresie Six - Sigma, Lean, zarządzaniu projektami
  • Współpracować z menedżerami wysokiego szczebla z Signify

Chcemy, abyś miał...

  • Status absolwenta uczelni wyższej w dziedzinie inżynierii, logistyki, ekonomii lub pokrewne
  • Umiejętność sprawnego posługiwania się językiem angielskim
  • Elastyczność i proaktywną postawę
  • Chęci do rozwoju
  • Ambicje do budowania doświadczenia biznesowego w globalnej firmie o wysokich standardach

Co otrzymasz w zamian...

  • Atrakcyjne wynagrodzenie i benefity
  • Umowę o pracę na okres 2 lat (z możliwością przedłużenia)
  • Pracę dla firmy będącej liderem na rynku globalnym
  • Życzliwych współpracowników i atmosferę pracy rodem z XXI wieku
  • Szybką ścieżkę rozwoju kariery
  • Premię roczną
  • Szerokie możliwości nauki i rozwoju

See #SignifyLife through the eyes of our employees!

ACCIONA Energía es la mayor compañía energética 100% renovable y sin legado fósil del mundo. Con más de 30 años de trayectoria y operaciones en 20 países de los cinco continentes, ACCIONA Energía ofrece una amplia cartera de soluciones energéticas a medida para que sus clientes corporativos e institucionales puedan cumplir sus objetivos de descarbonización. Ello incluye el desarrollo, ingeniería, construcción, operación y mantenimiento de plantas renovables – principalmente eólicas y fotovoltaicas-, gestión y comercialización de la energía, servicios energéticos, autoconsumo, movilidad eléctrica y nuevas tecnologías como el almacenamiento y el hidrógeno verde. ACCIONA Energía se rige por los más exigentes criterios medioambientales, sociales y de gobierno corporativo (ESG).
 

Descripción del puesto

En ACCIONA Energía, nos encontramos en búsqueda de un Técnico/a de Mantenimiento Eólico para desempeñarse en Parque Eólico ubicado en la comuna de Renaico, región de La Araucanía, Chile.

Misión:
Realizar, de manera autónoma, tareas operativas complejas en su unidad/departamento, de acuerdo a las directrices marcadas por su responsable, a fin de satisfacer las necesidades del proyecto.

Producción:

Explotación de la generación energética basada en energías (según tecnología), en función de la situación real de la misma, maximizando los resultados económicos en la vida útil del proyecto y asegurando funcionamiento de los mismos en las mejores condiciones de seguridad para personas e instalaciones y preservando el medio ambiente.

Realizar el mantenimiento predictivo, preventivo y correctivo de toda la infraestructura asociada a los parques eólicos, incluyendo aerogeneradores, media tensión, sistemas de comunicaciones y equipos auxiliares.

Funciones:

- Ejecutar las actividades de mantenimiento preventivo, correctivo y predictivo necesarias para el óptimo funcionamiento de los parques eólicos y el cumplimiento de los objetivos de producción, disponibilidad y eficiencia de ACCIONA Energía.

- Ejecutar las actividades de mantenimiento en estricto cumplimiento de las normas y procedimientos de prevención de riesgos, calidad y medio ambiente.

- Realizar el control y seguimiento continuo de la operación de los parques eólicos para lograr el óptimo rendimiento de los activos, analizando y resolviendo averías.

- Proponer e implementar acciones para incrementar la eficiencia y la eficacia de las actividades de mantenimiento.

- Reportar la información necesaria en los sistemas de mantenimiento MAXIMO, SCS, ENABLON.

- Colaborar en la mejora continua en lo que respecta a prevención de riesgos reportando eventuales incidencias y/o condiciones inseguras oportunamente.

- Colaborar con los soportes de equipos globales y locales en las distintas iniciativas para mejorar la perfomance de los parques eólicos.

- Participar activamente en la planificación de los trabajos, realización de procedimientos y la revisión de documentación en conjunto con otros miembros del equipo.

- Participar en el sistema de turnos de disponibilidad para atención de fallas.

- Supervisar a las empresas contratistas y subcontratistas de ACCIONA que trabajen en los parques eólicos para la ejecución de los trabajos con calidad, seguridad y respeto al medio ambiente requeridos por ACCIONA.

#LI-MR1

Requisitos del candidato

- Titulado/a en Técnico Eléctrico / Técnico Mecánico / Técnico Electrónico.

- Al menos 2 años de experiencia en cargos de mantenimiento.

- Licencia de conducir clase B al día.

- Conocimientos de hidráulica, mecánica, equipos electromecánicos, esquemas eléctricos, instrumentación, control y subestaciones.

- Deseable experiencia en Parques Eólicos.

Somos una compañía que valora la diversidad como fuente de talento y por ello trabajamos para impulsar un entorno inclusivo en el que se promueve el respeto, la pertenencia y el compromiso de forma que todas las personas puedan participar en igualdad de oportunidades. Invitamos a todas las personas a inscribirse con independencia del origen, circunstancias, bagaje o condición. ACCIONA ha recibido la certificación Top Employer 2021, 2022 y 2023, que reconoce a la Compañía como una de las mejores empresas para trabajar en España.

Informático /a - planta de alimentación
Pontevedra
Pontevedra, Galicia, ES

Empresa dedicada al sector de la alimentación necesita la incorporación de un/a informático/a para estar en planta en Cambados. Las tareas a desempeñar son las siguientes:

  • Administrar y configurar Axapta, en todos sus niveles de gestión.
  • Soporte a todos los departamentos de la empresa a nivel de hardware como también en sus equipos, ya sean escáneres, impresoras de etiquetas, etc.
  • Resolver las consultas sobre los temas informáticos y dar formación si es el caso al personal.
  • Control de los procesos internos que requieren parametrizaciones a nivel informático, con el fin que los procesos, ya sean administrativos o de producción, tengan un funcionamiento óptimo.
  • Soporte y control a la empresa a nivel de telefonía fija y móvil.
  • Resolver los problemas conjuntamente con la empresa externa que corresponda, a nivel de alarmas y cámaras de seguridad.
  • Efectuar la configuración, programación y mantenimiento de los equipos de etiquetaje así como del sofware de producción.
  • Configuración de las etiquetas nuevas como de las actuales, según la normativa y los requerimientos de los clientes.
  • Aseguramiento de la trazabilidad de la producción a través de Axapta.
  • Soporte a empresas externas en todos los niveles informáticos de su organización, ya sean administrativos como productivos.
  • Entra otras tareas propias del puesto de trabajo.
$

- Experiencia mínima de 1 año en un puesto similar al descrito.

  • Buscamos a una persona dinámica y polivalente.
  • Valorable residencia cercana al puesto de trabajo.

$Castellano hablado y escrito correctamente.

$GS en Informática y/o similar.

在 goFLUENT，我们提供根据贵组织目标和需求量身定制的超个性化企业语言培训。自2000年以来，我们已帮助全球数百万人提升商务沟通能力。
我们的团队以共同的使命为纽带：让每个公司和学习者都能轻松获得相关、高效的语言培训。加入我们充满活力的亚洲学习顾问团队，体验在全球公司工作的兴奋！

  • 管理参与 goFLUENT 课程的客户/学习者关系。

我们在寻找：

  • 具备同理心和积极的态度，能够解决复杂问题。

  • 熟练使用MS Office、Google Docs和Open Office。
  • 高级英语水平，读写流利。
  • 本科及以上学历，专业不限。

在 goFLUENT，你将获得：

  • 稳定且有前景的职业生涯，结合快速增长的瑞士公司带来的充满活力的初创公司氛围。
  • 直接向教育和语言行业的高管及思想领袖学习的机会。

  • 丰富有趣的全球团队建设活动（上一次是在马尼拉！）。

Buscamos personas que quieran marcar la diferencia, promover el desarrollo sostenible y encontrar soluciones a los mayores desafíos globales, incluidos el cambio climático, la sobrepoblación y la escasez hídrica. Únete a nosotros en la búsqueda de soluciones para lograr un futuro sostenible.

Job Description

Job summary
Eurofirms busca operario/a de laminado para empresa del sector químico ubicada en Burgos.
Job seniority: mid-to-senior level
Responsibilities
  • - Realización de tareas de producción.
  • - Manejo puntual de carretillas elevadoras.
  • - Entre otras tareas propias del puesto de trabajo.

Requirements
  • - Experiencia mínima de 2 años desempeñando tareas similares a las descritas.
  • - Buscamos a una persona resolutiva y responsable.
  • - Valorable residencia cercana al puesto de trabajo.

Key Skills Needed
  • Experiencia en labores de producción
  • Manejo de carretillas elevadoras
  • Resolutividad
  • Responsabilidad

Details van de functie

Dit ga je doen

Ben jij op zoek naar een toffe stage bij een erkend leerbedrijf waar je alles wat je leert in je mbo-opleiding Retailmedewerker, Assistent verkoop/retail, Retailspecialist of Retailmanager écht in de praktijk kunt brengen? En wil je ontdekken hoe het is om te werken bij een succesvol bedrijf met leuke collega's, goede begeleiding én een prima stagevergoeding? Stop met zoeken en solliciteer direct! Als stagiair bij Kruidvat mag je vanaf dag één aan de slag met veel verschillende taken en draai je gewoon mee op de winkelvloer (zo leer je het snelst!). Onder vakkundige begeleiding van je filiaalmanager leer jij binnen no time de fijne kneepjes van het vak. Je zorgt ervoor dat de winkel netjes is, adviseert klanten bij het vinden van de juiste producten en springt bij achter de kassa. Samen met je collega's ga je voor goud en geef je alles (al valt er ook genoeg met ze te kletsen en te lachen).  Heb je na je stage de smaak te pakken? Dan maken we graag plek voor je in het team en kun je lekker bijverdienen als (parttime) verkoopmedewerker en hiervoor eventueel aanvullende diploma's halen. Dus, waar wacht je nog op? Kom bij de Kruidvatclub! Dit krijg je ervoor terug
  • Een leuke en leerzame stage bij jou in de buurt die aansluit bij jouw mbo-opleiding Retail.
  • Een stagevergoeding van € 100,- bruto (niveau 1 en 2) of € 200,- bruto (niveau 3 en 4) per maand op basis van 37 uur per week. Dit is afhankelijk van je opleiding.
  • Een team van enthousiaste collega's, die niet kunnen wachten om jou te ontmoeten!
  • Goede begeleiding. Niet alleen in je werk, maar ook bij je studieopdrachten.
  • Veel doorgroei- en doorleermogelijkheden. Beginnen als stagiair en eindigen als filiaalmanager? Je zou niet de eerste zijn!
  • En er is meer? als je een nieuwe collega aandraagt, ontvang je een bonus van € 100,- bruto voor een winkelmedewerker en maar liefst € 1.000,- bruto voor een leidinggevende functie. Ka-ching!
Dit ben jij
  • Je bent minimaal 15 jaar oud en bezig met een mbo-opleiding Retail (BOL).
  • Je bent sociaal, leergierig en enthousiast.

Funciones

Desde Quick Up estamos seleccionando TECNICO EN INDUSTRIALIZACIÓN para importante empresa fabricante de vehículos industriales, en el área de Pontevedra. Se integrará dentro del equipo productivo, en contacto con el equipo de Producción y Oficina Técnica, colaborando en las siguientes tareas:

– Análisis de la necesidad de materiales para los proyectos dados.
– Generación y mantenimiento de listas de materiales, sistemas y componentes
– Identificación de los inputs necesarios en el sistema de componentes/escandallos para la consecución de los resultados, según proyecto.
– Interpretación de planos
– Registro de procesos y métodos de trabajo.
– Seguimiento de los pedidos y de los plazos de entrega de materiales.

Requisitos

Buscamos una persona acostumbrada a trabajar con códigos numéricos, que se maneje bien a nivel informático. – Pensamiento analítico. Capacidad para distinguir lo relevante y para organizar la información. – Capacidad crítica y toma de decisiones. Habilidad para evaluar datos y tomar decisiones lógicas desde un punto de vista racional. – Acostumbrad@ a trabajar bajo presión o por objetivos. – Fundamental saber trabajar en equipo. No es necesaria experiencia en fábrica pero se valorarán conocimientos / experiencia en área automoción, maquinaria agrícola/industrial, a nivel de componentes/proceso de fabricación. Se valorarán conocimientos informáticos a nivel programación o ciclos en administración de sistemas o desarrollo de aplicaciones.

SSR Mining Inc. is a leading, free cash flow focused intermediate gold company with four producing assets located in the USA, Turkey, Canada, and Argentina, combined with a global pipeline of high-quality development and exploration assets in the USA, Turkey, Mexico, Peru, and Canada.

SSR Mining is committed to delivering excellence through the contributions of our dedicated employees. With an industry-leading pipeline of projects, strong financial positioning, and talented employees, we aim to continue building on our strong foundation – we have high expectations for the future!

Director, People Experience Partner
Apply remote type On-site locations Hong Kong, SAR, China time type Full time posted on Posted 30+ Days Ago job requisition id REQ312503

JLL supports the Whole You, personally and professionally.


Our people at JLL are shaping the future of real estate for a better world by combining world class services, advisory and technology to our clients. We are committed to hiring the best, most talented people in our industry; and we support them through professional growth, flexibility, and personalized benefits to manage life in and outside of work. Whether you’ve got deep experience in commercial real estate, skilled trades, and technology, or you’re looking to apply your relevant experience to a new industry, we empower you to shape a brighter way forward so you can thrive professionally and personally.

This PXP role is dedicated to one of our key accounts in financial industry. The account is transforming to Workplace of the Future, transforming the operating structure to better support the workplace experience and overall delivery goals, driving innovative knowledge growth through training & exposure to fresh ways of thinking across all the functions, reviewing and enhancing current and future skills to drive productivity, innovation and enable future of work.

The role is responsible for partnering with account leadership team to drive, navigate and enable the transformation and achievement of business strategies and priorities, through a solid people strategy and roadmap, establishing the account as an account of choice that attracts and retains high-performing talents. In particular, the role needs to focus on:

  • Understanding the business and the priorities of account leadership, including the business strategy, P&L, and key initiatives that drive the results that JLL and the account expect and provide sound and innovative solutions to support business objectives.
  • Working closely with business and TA CoE team across the region to improve the speed and quality of hiring at all levels, getting right people at the right position at right time, with future-oriented skills and mindset.
  • Renovating succession planning for key roles, developing and immersing potential successors to build an effective and diverse talent pipeline to be future leaders of the account.
  • Articulating and translating future state to concrete skills, upskilling team and elevating leadership capability across region to be future fit to enable transformation and excellent delivery of services.
  • Prioritizing engagement and retention, enhancing an engaging and motivating culture right from the onboarding experience and throughout employee life cycle at all moments that matter, anticipating areas of concern and taking actions, leveraging people survey, onboarding & exit survey etc.

Key Accountabilities

Functional Knowledge:

  • Act as local delivery experts of JLL’s global HR strategy, ensuring that local policies and practices are in line with the Global HR strategy.
  • Proactively anticipate opportunities or issues and develop innovative solutions to address the opportunities at the root cause with intention to arrive at sustainable solutions.
  • Enable an exceptional employee experience during moments that matter throughout the employee lifecycle e.g., onboarding, performance review, promotion, etc.
  • Contribute towards a culture of inclusion which celebrates our employee diversity and promotes employee belonging.
  • Lead or participate in just-in-time projects impacting business results.
  • Manage various degrees of employee relations situations and performance management.
  • Provide consultation to business stakeholders through coaching, training and advisory support.
  • Support assigned employee group in transition, expansion and stabilisation of new business with great consideration given to employee experience.
  • Cultivate strong meaningful relationships with both local employees and People Partners to build trust as their primary touchpoint “on the ground”.
  • Execute on HR tasks by driving efficiencies in the employee life cycle – using touchpoints and hand offs to other HR stakeholders.

Business Expertise:

  • Experience of delivering HR and Operational activity within a complex organization with the ability to balance JLL and client needs.
  • Highly skilled in utilising data and technology to drive business performance and organisation efficiency.

Skills & Competencies

Leadership:

  • Drive the growth of the workforce on the ground, serving as a local HR professional
  • Skilled facilitator, who can lead local and regional employee events, programs, etc.
  • Strong team management skills with the ability to effectively manage priorities.

Problem Solving:

  • Ability to adjust styles of communicating to varying situations to ensure an inclusive environment.
  • A passion to work with people across a variety of backgrounds teaching and learning from people across the organisation.
  • Excellent organisational skills with a starter finisher mentality with acute attention to detail

Interpersonal Skills:

  • Ability to adjust styles of communication to varying situations to effectively communicate with a diverse array of stakeholders.
  • Ability to cultivate robust and meaningful relationships to serve as a trusted HR expert to employees and managers.

Qualifications / Experience / Education:

  • Bachelor's degree in any disciplines.
  • At least 10 years of equivalent work experience.
  • Experience in working in a matrix organisation.

Systems Used:

  • Workday
  • Microsoft Suite
  • Tableau
  • PeopleSoft

Location:

On-site –Hong Kong, SAR, China

If this job description resonates with you, we encourage you to apply even if you don’t meet all of the requirements. We’re interested in getting to know you and what you bring to the table!

  • Ensure stocks are stored neat and tidy with proper sublocations/labelling for easy retrieval.
  • Ensure that warehouse equipment and facilities are maintained in good working condition.

The Mills is a landmark revitalization project of Nan Fung’s old textile factories in Tsuen Wan in Hong Kong. This is a heritage and innovation project by the Nan Fung Group consisting of 3 pillars- a nonprofit Center for Heritage, Arts & Textiles (CHAT) focused on heritage & community, a retail mall Shopfloor focused on experiential & experimental retail and an innovation center Fabrica.

The Mills Fabrica is a go-to solutions platform accelerating techstyle (an intersection of technology and style – incl. fashion, textile, wearables and apparel) and agrifood tech innovations for sustainability and social impact. The Mills Fabrica runs a startup incubator, a VC investment fund and a co-working space/ lab/ store.

job_title: Hotel Manager - The Langham, Hong Kong
job_ad_details:
Langham Hospitality Group (LHG) is a global hotel company with properties located in major cities and four continents under The Langham Hotels and Resorts and Cordis Hotels and Resorts brands. It is the hospitality arm of Great Eagle Holdings, a leading property development company in Hong Kong.

Located at the most fashionable address of Tsim Sha Tsui, Hong Kong, you will be part of a dynamic team to drive for maximizing the long-term growth of the Hotel by driving revenue and delivering high standards in guest experience in alignment with the culture and values of Langham Hospitality Group.

Role
Hotel Manager is to assist Regional Vice President – Operations in Asia and Managing Director to manage the luxury property, The Langham, Hong Kong. He / she has to communicate clearly the Hotel direction and goals to a team of management and brining the team to achieve it.

Responsibilities
• Responsible for acting on behalf of the Managing Director during his/ her absence to the effect of running the hotel on a day-to-day basis.
• Manage operations functions of the hotel effectively including Rooms, Food and Beverage and Engineering divisions.
• Review the daily financial performance and attend to all matters pertaining to the well being and efficient operation of the hotel.
• Motivate and direct the hotel operations in ensuring a professional and guest service focused.
• Maintain management visibility throughout the hotel and ensure that hotel guests have easy access to hotel management ; &
• Ensure quality assurance standards are maintained and process improvement are executed while compliance at all times with internal standards auditing are met.

Qualifications
• Diploma/Degree/Professional Qualifications in Hotel Management or relevant disciplines.
• Minimum of 10-year hotel experience at senior management level; Current capacity at Hotel Manager / Resident Manager in international hotel chain is base requirement.
• Possess proven track record with a stable career history in Southeast Asian countries, Greater China or Hong Kong. Career background from Rooms Division is required.
• Complete knowledge in the functions essential to operate hotels with more than 500 rooms.
• Present with strong entrepreneurial style, excellent people skills and business acumen.
• Be able to apply highly customer-orientated standards to lead and motivate operations teams.
• A thorough knowledge of hotel’s operating policies and standards is expected.
• Ability to co-ordinate functions into efficient and coherent operation; &
• Good owner relationship is always important.

*Candidates with more experience and proven track record of wider responsibilities will be considered as General Manager. 

To apply, please send us your resume with current & expected salary to Human Resources.

For more information about the property, please visit https://www.langhamhotels.com/en/the-langham/hong-kong/.

A Career with Hang Seng Bank

Hang Seng is committed to service excellence. Our people are our most important asset and play a vital role in our efforts to continually enhance our performance for customers and provide best-in-class products and services.  We seek to attract high-calibre talent by offering a dynamic working environment, good career development opportunities and competitive compensation packages.

Data, Analytics and CRM 

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our department as Manager Data Analytics and CRM (Customer).

Principal responsibilities:

  • Establish and implement a comprehensive data strategy that aligns with business goals.
  • Collaborate with business, work independently to perform customer analysis, design customer journey and develop innovative analytics solutions to support strategic initiatives.
  • Keen to take initiatives to translate business problems into analytics-led solutions with appropriate methodology, manage the business application effectively and evaluate the results rigorously. 
  • Highly sensitive to state of business and anticipative of business problems and priorities.
  • Explore the data and conduct quantitative analysis to ascertain root cause of business' issues, identifies opportunities and effective targeting for business growth potential.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to integrate analytics into business processes and decision-making. 
  • Design and develop dashboards and reporting tools for performance monitoring.
  • Ensure timely and quality analytics deliverables to satisfy business needs effectively under the dynamic business environment.
  • Sharing knowledge and good practice, working collaboratively with different parties to create a productive, diverse and supportive working environment.

Requirements

  • University degree in in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Systems or other related discipline.
  • Minimum of 6 years’ experience in data analytics, preferably with focus on customer life cycle management or wealth management in banking industry.  
  • Strong knowledge of wealth products and experience with high-net-worth customer segments is a significant plus.  
  • Proficiency in data analytics tools (e.g. Big Query, Python) and visualization software (e.g. Tableau, Qlik Sense). 
  • Strong problem-solving skill and a strategic mindset, with the ability to analyses complex data, identify core issues and recommend solutions.
  • Ability to communicate with impact, with the capacity to ensure complex information is articulated in a meaningful way to a wide and varied audience.
  • Customer-centric oriented, with good interpersonal, organizational, and presentation skills
  • Self-motivated professional with great sense of ownership and servicing mind-set to ensure efficient and effective customer service delivery.

 

Visit Hang Seng Career Page and sign up with our Talent Community to receive the latest information about our career opportunities in Hang Seng Hong Kong.

All information provided by applicants will be used only for recruitment purposes and will be used strictly in accordance with the Bank's personal data policies, a copy of which may be obtained by the applicant upon request. Unless otherwise instructed in writing by the applicant concerned, applicants may be considered for other suitable positions within the Bank and its related companies. job_title: Temporary Research Assistant II (Project No: RD/2024/1.19) (N&HS) (Ref: 24001ZP)
job_ad_details:
Founded in 1989, Hong Kong Metropolitan University (HKMU) is a modern, vibrant and dynamic university. We tailor our professional programmes to adapt to market trends and meet industry needs, thus providing our students with quality professional education and clear career paths. Being the first University of Applied Sciences (UAS) in Hong Kong, we pledge to play a pioneering role in enhancing recognition of vocational and professional education and training, and nurturing talents with both applied skills and knowledge.  

As a faculty-driven, student-centred university in support of innovative teaching and learning, strategic research, and stakeholder outreach to provide maximum benefit to our communities, we conduct research that advances knowledge and enhances teaching, focusing on strategic areas, including digital humanities and literature, international business, gerontechnology, personalised care, smart city, open and innovative education, and bilingual learning and teaching.

HKMU is becoming an ever more vital link in addressing and helping Hong Kong to solve many difficult challenges – as part of our involvement in, and commitment to, the ‘metropolis’ of Hong Kong. Our plans to expand into the Greater Bay Area (GBA) will also cultivate talent to serve Hong Kong and the wider metropolitan GBA.

For more information about the University, please visit https://www.hkmu.edu.hk.

 

We are now looking for a suitable person to fill the following position in the School of Nursing and Health Sciences:

Temporary Research Assistant II (Project No: RD/2024/1.19) (N&HS) (Ref: 24001ZP)

 

Major Duties and Responsibilities

The appointee will assist the Principal Investigator in coordinating a qualitative study on exploring the experience of Hong Kong critical care nurses in caring for brain death organ donors. The study adopts a descriptive qualitative design and will be conducted in a local regional ICU. 

The appointee will be responsible mainly for the following:

  • Conducting literature review on relevant topics;
  • Recruiting research participants;
  • Assisting in data collection;
  • Conducting verbatim transcription;
  • Performing qualitative data analysis; and
  • Providing research-related assistance.

 

Candidates

Candidates should possess the following qualifications, experience and competence:

  • A recognized Bachelor’s degree of above, preferably with a Bachelor’s degree in healthcare, social science, psychology, statistics or related disciplines;
  • Proficient in MS Office Words, Excel, and PowerPoint; proficient in SPSS will be an advantage;
  • A good command of written and spoken English and Chinese; and
  • A good team player and able to coordinate research projects independently.

 

Terms and Conditions for Appointment

Successful candidate will be appointed on a temporary full-time contract.  Benefits will be provided in accordance with the statutory provisions.

 

To Apply

Candidates who are interested in joining us may submit their applications via the University’s eRecruitment System.

https://hkmu.taleo.net/careersection/ex_non_full_time/jobapply.ftl?lang=en&job=24001ZP    

 

Closing date of application: 1 October 2024

 

The personal data collected will be used for the purpose of considering your application for employment.  For details, please refer to the “Personal Data (Privacy) Notice for Job Applicant” on the University’s website. If you are not contacted by the University within eight weeks from the closing date of application, you may assume that your application was unsuccessful.

Why join us

You don’t join Forvis Mazars by coincidence, you choose Forvis Mazars: a global school of excellence where you will be challenged to develop and grow. Progression is tied to education, empowering you to match your career to your aspirations both within and outside our firm. We expect your contribution to what Forvis Mazars and our clients do next and reward your ingenuity. Come and write the rest of (y)our story with us – you’ll make friends along the way too. Forvis Mazars, the smart choice.

What you can expect

As a Graduate Associate with our Audit & Assurance team, you will build an understanding on the importance of audit work and how it impacts their business. You will be working in a team environment, leading by a senior and stepping out to interact with clients. The senior will guide you through in case you have any questions. Also, you will gain exposure to a number of different industries and organisations, from privately owned business, well known household name up to public/listed companies.

Your typical day will vary between:

  • Getting familiar to use key software and systems facilitating your day-to-day work;
  • Learning by doing through checking and investigating a client’s financial information, such as purchase and sales invoices, payroll records, bank balances and statements;
  • Building up your professional knowledge by providing analysis and insight;
  • Nurturing client relationships through meetings and developing an understanding of their business/industry;
  • Acquiring essentials skills to shape your career the way you want

Who we are looking for

We are looking for collaborative people who think creatively about their work and enjoy embracing challenges. Do you have the followings?

  • Excellent communication skills – the ability to connect with clients and stakeholders
  • Interpersonal skills – the ability to build client relationships with a foundation of trust and responsibility; the ability to fit in a team environment and establish rapport with peers as well as supervisors
  • Analytical skills – the ability to think critically, research and solve problems
  • Attention to detail and strong time-management skills
  • Commitment to self-development & learning
  • Affinity with our values – in particular, respect for individuals, diversity and integrity.
  • Self-motivation and passion about your career
  • Ability to work with deadlines
  • Good writing and speaking skills in English and Chinese
  • Proficiency in MS Office

If this sounds like you, this could be the perfect opportunity.

Intake Period

 June or October 2025

What we offer

Choosing the right start is the first step to a promising career path. We recognise that rewards are important to you. On top of the base salary you will be receiving, we offer a range of staff caring benefits and policies including medical and dental insurance, life insurance, a 5-day working week, discretionary performance bonus, qualified pay, birthday leave, marriage leave and employee activities. For your career progression, we will provide examination support, including but not limited to study / examination leave and subsidy along the way.

All applications received will be used strictly for selection purpose only.

The Department

Digital Experience and Innovation Department is responsible for providing quality experience and CRM to local and overseas customers of The Hong Kong Jockey Club. It operates 88 Race Meetings a year, 33 Simulcasts days, a thrice-weekly Mark 6 Draw, 7X24 Digital Channels, 7X24 Football Betting Services on over 11,000 different leagues per year. The ultimate aim is to provide an impressive total customer experience leading to sustainable turnover growth in a responsible manner and engage new customers.

The Job 

You will:

  • Deliver user interface designs and visual assets, working in highly collaborative and agile cross-functional teams
  • Design and develop wireframes, user flows, and prototypes that demonstrate exceptional interaction and holistic user experience
  • Leveraging gamification principle into our interfaces and experiences to enhance user engagement and satisfaction.

  • Provide constructive feedback and mentorship to other designers on the team

  • Work closely with developers to ensure designs are implemented accurately and to specifications
  • Communicate design decisions and rationale effectively to stakeholders
  • Manage multiple projects and prioritize workload effectively to meet project deadlines

About You

You should have:

  • Bachelor's degree in design or related field
  • At least 6 years of experience in UIUX design with a strong focus on interactive and animation design
  • A portfolio that demonstrates exceptional design skills and problem-solving abilities, with a particular focus on interactive and animation design
  • Strong understanding of user-centered design: A UIUX designer with a focus on user interaction should have a deep understanding of user-centered design principles and methodologies.
  • Strong analytical mindset to make the data-driven decision.
  • Expertise in design tools such as Figma, Sketch, Adobe Creative Suite, AfterEffect, Principle, and other animation and prototyping tools
  • Excellent communication and collaboration skills
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and a good team player
  • Experience working in an Agile development environment

Terms of Employment

The level of appointment will be commensurate with qualifications and experience.

Good command in general computer skills 懂得一般電腦應用,懂中英文打字

Good command of spoken Cantonese able to speak Mandarin and English 能講流利廣東話,一般普通話和英語

Immediate availability is preferred 即時上班會優先考慮

有銷售經驗較佳

Benefits:
Basic salary up to 18K - 20K

Work Location: Tsim Sha Tsui 工作地點: 尖沙咀

Shift Duties 輪班制: 9:00-18:00/ 12:00-21:00

有興趣可電郵履歷至 Ms Tsang

Overview

Client relationships and marketing are integral to our business. Our Marketing team applies contemporary business-to-business marketing strategies to support the targeting of existing and new clients.

 

Responsibilities

  • Write and edit copy for thought leadership reports, opinion pieces and newsletters, with a focus on financial services
  • Project manage thought leadership campaigns throughout the publication lifecycle, from conceptualising content ideas and conducting market research, to writing/editing the report and driving marketing initiatives
  • Develop and drive marketing campaigns to leverage new publications
  • Advise multiple stakeholders – both internal and external – on considerations and suggest best approach to achieve objectives through thought leadership campaigns
  • Work closely with designers and conceptualise ideas to ensure graphics and design illustrations are visually impactful and linked to the publication’s theme
  • Analyse data including research results provided by third-party providers
  • Coordinate with regional and global marketing professionals to maintain an editorial calendar and content pipeline for financial services, comprising both local and relevant global thought leadership

 

 Experience and Requirements

  • University graduate
  • A minimum of eight years editorial work experience - preferably with a financial services background
  • Strong proven editing and writing skills, a key responsibility for the role
  • Experience of running marketing campaigns        
  • Good understanding and knowledge of the firm’s activities
  • Ability to work under tight deadlines
  • Ability to handle multiple tasks as well as manage complex projects and prioritise work
  • Strong language skills required: English language skills essential, Mandarin proficiency is preferred
  • Pro-active and detail-oriented with an ability to develop content ideas and insights
  • Strong project management and marketing skills
  • Flexible: ability to handle last minute issues
  • Strong work ethic, resourceful and takes initiative

We offer successful candidates an attractive remuneration package and the opportunity to work in a dynamic and exciting environment.

Personal data collected will be used for recruitment purposes only.

    1由2023年5月1日起，法定最低工資水平已調升至每小時40元。

job_title: Senior Technician (HVAC) 高級空調製冷技術員 - 太古廣場奕居
job_ad_details:
我們的團隊

在太古地產工作不僅是一份職業，更是一種使命。

我們正尋找渴望實現創新衍變的卓越人才。創新衍變強調創新思維並著眼長遠，彰顯我們的發展理念及營運策略。它亦促使我們不斷探索新的視角，激勵我們破格創新。我們的使命是持續為社區創造價值，並構建出色和活力盎然的可持續社區，讓每個人都可以安居樂業。

加入太古地產大家庭，與我們攜手開展創新項目，共同塑造香港、中國內地、美國邁阿密及東南亞地區地產行業的未來。

主要職責

  • 負責保養、維修及操作酒店之空調製冷系統，協助監督承辦商及技術員之工作

入職要求

  • 具備五年以上相關工作經驗
  • 持有機電工程署發出之A牌或R牌，及建造業平安咭
  • 持有空調或相關技工證書者優先考慮
  • 操流利粵語及略懂英語，懂基本電腦操作

行為能力

  • 以顧客為中心 
  • 追求結果
  • 協作
  • 靈活交往
  • 展示自知 

員工福利

  • 十日或以上有薪年假
  • 十七天公衆假期
  • 每月勤工獎
  • 工作表現年賞
  • 超時津貼
  • 免供款退休金
  • 員工及家屬牙科、門診及住院醫療福利

加入我們

  • 我們於2022 年獲任仕達(Randstad)評為香港最具吸引力僱主; 並由2017年起一直位居首十名
  • 2023 HRoot人力資源卓越大獎 (中國內地)

把握機會

歡迎有意應徵者直接提交網上申請。如有查詢，請WhatsApp至+852 9213 8973，並註明 1) 姓名 2) 聯絡電話 及 3) 應徵職位。（請勿透過WhatsApp發送履歷或任何文件副本）

作為一個提供平等機會的僱主，太古地產重視擁有多元化的團隊，並會致力維繫共融平等的工作環境。如果你在招聘過程中 (包括網上申請及/或選聘過程)因殘疾而需要合理便利，請透過電郵與我們聯絡。

凡應徵或面試後六星期內不獲通知者，一概作落選論。未獲取錄的應徵者資料，將於招聘程序完成後12個月被全部銷毀。應徵者所提供的資料，只會用於招聘有關事宜。公司將根據香港特別行政區的《個人資料（私隱）條例》保密處理所有個人資料。

申請截止日期：2024年12月13日

job_title: TikTok Shop - GTL Logistics - Middle Mile Supervisor - Indonesia
job_ad_details:
Responsibilities

About Us TikTok is the leading destination for short-form mobile video. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy.

TikTok's global headquarters are in Los Angeles and Singapore, and its offices include New York, London, Dublin, Paris, Berlin, Dubai, Jakarta, Seoul, and Tokyo. Why Join

Us Creation is the core of TikTok's purpose. Our platform is built to help imaginations thrive. This is doubly true of the teams that make TikTok possible.

Together, we inspire creativity and bring joy

  • a mission we all believe in and aim towards achieving every day.

To us, every challenge, no matter how difficult, is an opportunity; to learn, to innovate, and to grow as one team. Status quo? Never. Courage? Always. At TikTok, we create together and grow together. That's how we drive impact

  • for ourselves, our company, and the communities we serve.

Join us. About The team Delivery team serves as a vital force of delivery operations in Tiktokshop. Excelling in precise, prompt delivery operations, our aim is to ensure every package reaches its destination safely and swiftly. Committed to customer satisfaction, we navigate challenges with the spirit of efficiency & collaboration, embodying Tiktokshop's dedication to excellence in every delivery. Job Responsibilities:

  • Supervise and coordinate middle mile logistics activities, including transportation planning, route optimization, and scheduling.
  • Lead and manage a team of drivers, logistics personnel, and other operational staff to ensure efficiency and safety in all activities.
  • Monitor and track the movement of goods between facilities, ensuring all shipments arrive on time and in optimal condition.
  • Collaborate with warehouse, inventory, and distribution teams to maintain smooth handoffs of goods at various stages of transportation.
  • Conduct regular inspections of transportation equipment (e.g., trucks, trailers) to ensure they meet safety and operational standards.
  • Maintain detailed records of transportation costs, performance metrics, and driver compliance.
  • Work closely with external partners and vendors to coordinate services and resolve any third-party issues.
  • Ensure compliance with all relevant regulations, including environmental standards, and health and safety guidelines.
Qualifications

Minimum Requirements: 1. Bachelor's degree in Business Administration, Logistics, or a related field. 2. Proven experience in Middle Mile delivery operations, with a minimum of [3] years in a supervisory role.

3. Proficiency in Microsoft Office and logistics management software. 4. Strong understanding of logistics principles and first mile & last-mile delivery processes. Preferred Qualification:

5. Excellent leadership and communication skills, with the ability to motivate and inspire a team. 6. Experience in operations field & excellence topics other express logistics companies, preferably from ShopeeXpress, J&T, NinjaVan, Lazada Logistics 7. Strong in problem solving skills and independent in driving initiatives from ideation to completion

8. Strong personal skills. Willing to work closely with the operations team to execute changes TikTok is committed to creating an inclusive space where employees are valued for their skills, experiences, and unique perspectives.

Our platform connects people from across the globe and so does our workplace. At TikTok, our mission is to inspire creativity and bring joy. To achieve that goal, we are committed to celebrating our diverse voices and to creating an environment that reflects the many communities we reach.

We are passionate about this and hope you are too.
